texts.en:
Maryam is the featured borrower of Al Ahiba group. She got together with her other group members to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Maryam is a 49-year-old married woman, mother of three children. She has been working preparing and baking the special traditional Lebanese Saj bread for twenty years. She used to work as a tailor, but she preferred to turn to a daily income business, which will support her family better.

She is an expert in her domain and is working hard to develop her business as much as she can to keep her customers satisfied. With the applied-for loan, Maryam will buy a special new Saj bread oven and a dough smoothing machine that will help her a lot in doing the requested job in a short time with an excellent quality.

She is the first one from the left.

Hala is the one in the middle, she is a 52-year-old married woman, mother of four children, with three years of experience in selling Brazilian gold. The requested loan, will be invested in increasing the collection she has to attract customers' attention.

Jamal has been selling make-up and cosmetics for three years. She is 60, married with four children. The requested loan will be invested in buying a refrigerator for her house.

loans.use: To buy a new Saj Oven and a dough smoothing machine

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar panel for her house.

loans.name: Neiva

texts.en:
Neiva is 40 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Neiva has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Neiva requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Neiva has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Saroeurt's Group

texts.en: A local villager from Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Saroeurt is 50 years old and has one son. For her, rice farming is the core income-generating business to support the daily cost of living. She has been farming for ten years. Including this loan, she is a third-cycled client with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has smartly used her loans to improve her lifestyle and relieve her family’s burden. Now, she leads a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash, rice seeds, and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can earn more income so that she can run a small grocery stall at home.

loans.use: to buy potash, rice seeds, and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Thelma has been in this business for one year. She earns more income from food vending.

Thelma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ivan

texts.ru:
Иван – предприниматель, работает таксистом. Водит на марке автомобиля «Жигули». Работает в этой сфере уже 8 лет. 
Кредит в размере 10 000 гривен понадобился Ивану для того, чтобы приобрести авто поновее для таксовки. Весной в Украине дороги всегда в самом плохом состоянии, что непосредственно влияет на транспортное средство и Ивану приходится часто ремонтировать машину. Он надеется, что более новое авто поможет ему хотя бы некоторое время избегать ремонтов на местных СТО.
texts.en: Ivan is a business man who works as a taxi driver and has for the last eight years. He currently drives a Zhiguli.  Ivan needs a loan of 10,000 hryvnia in order to buy a newer car.  During spring, roads are in their worst causing wear and tear on the vehicle.  Ivan has to make repairs often.  He hopes that a newer car will help him, at least for a while, avoid having to take his car in for maintenance.

loans.use: to buy a newer car to use as a taxi

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en:
Sidi is a married woman and has five children. She lives in Kisauni and sells fish which she buys from fishermen. She has done this for over twenty years.

She tells us that she has almost everything she needs in order to do this work. She also tells us that this job has helped her to help her family with the household costs and to get them ahead. She is a very hard-working person who has always taken pains to get ahead and succeed.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of a freezer, which will help her greatly in her business. She thanks Yehu Microfinance and Kiva Lenders for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase a freezer

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married mother of three children, all of whom attend school. They live at their own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

For years, she has operated a business selling clothes from her home to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a boutique in the future. 

With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase second-hand clothes for resale to her clients. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase second-hand clothes

loans.name: Erika

texts.ru: Со времени получения и использования предыдущего кредита в семье и бизнесе Эрики практически не произошло особых изменений. Кредит КИВА помог ей увеличить количество товара в бизнесе и, соответственно, увеличить доход. В этот раз Эрика обратилась за дополнительной финансовой помощью в размере 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы приобрести партию весеннего товара. За счет его реализации Эрика надеется и дальше увеличивать свой доход от бизнеса.
texts.en: Since the receipt and use of the last loan, not much has changed for Erika concerning her business or family.  The Kiva loan helped her increase her inventory, and consequently raised her income.  This time, Erika needs additional financial assistance, a loan of 15,000 hyrvnia in order to buy spring inventory.  She hopes to continue to further increase her income and business.

loans.use: to buy inventory for spring season

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena is 32 years old, married with four children. She and her family live in CPG, Bohol. She and her husband are in the transportation business with the help of their motorcycle. It is called "habal-habal" (a motorcycle used to transport passengers in remote places).  Their business has been in existence for four years now. She is asking for a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to buy a chain and spare tire for her motorcycle. The income that she will generate will cover her family's food consumption and school fees of her children. 

In the future, Lorena hopes to have another business that will give her a chance to provide for her family better.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle chain and spare tire

loans.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz is 44 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell like canned goods, soap, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

Flordeliz has borrowed and repaid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from buying and selling purified drinking water.

Flordeliz aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell like canned goods, soap, soft drinks, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Chea

texts.en:
Chea, 53, lives with her life companion and their three dependent children; they live in their own house in Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham. She works in agriculture growing rice and vegetables and the profits obtained cover some of her household expenses. She has been in the business for more than 30 years.

Chea completely paid back her past loan from Kiva and she’s asking for this loan to buy farming supplies such as seeds and fertilizer, among other things for growing vegetables well. She hopes that she can get better crops and give her children their basic needs.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 46 years old and is from CPG, Bohol. She is married and her husband works as a driver. Elsie has a retail business selling  clothing, such as shorts, jackets, shirts, slippers, towels and jeans. Her business started last year. She is asking for a loan to buy more shorts, jackets, shirts, slippers, towels and jeans to refill her inventory.

In the future, Elsie hopes to offer more products that she can sell, in order to make better profits.

loans.use: to buy shorts, jackets, shirts, slippers, towels and jeans for resale.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a business woman. She is married to a truck driver. They have three children, all of whom attend school.

Agnes began in sales thanks to help from her husband, who, since he was young, has worked as a truck driver. Little by little, Agnes began increasing her sales since she herself goes out to offer her products in the area. She sells mostly clothing for women and children, such as blouses, shorts, undergarments, t-shirts and sweatshirts. One of her great dreams is to have her own store in the city center. She is asking for a loan to purchase seasonal clothing. This will help her greatly with her sales.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Kavumbi

texts.en:
Kavumbi is a married woman. She owns a diner specializing in dishes prepared using local fish. Her work is difficult since it requires her to begin preparing her dishes very early. 

Kavumbi has a good customer base thanks to her good service. One of her dreams is for her children to attend college and pursue a professional career instead of having to struggle to make a living. She is requesting a loan to buy fish for her business. Kavumbi is grateful to Yehu Microfinance for providing her with the opportunity to access business loans.

loans.use: to buy fish for her business.

loans.name: Sopheak's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province, Sopheak is 55 years old and the widowed mother of eight children. Currently, only one daughter still depends on her as she is still in school. Sopheak's single business as a rice grower, which she has engaged in for 30 years, has returned her about 38,000 KHR per day. 

Sopheak has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two loan cycles. After the successful loan which she has fully repaid back, she feels confident that she can maintain good living conditions for her family. For this cycle, she is in a group of two and is the group leader. She is seeking a loan of 1,400,000 KHR. For Sopheak, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, rice seeds, and to plow her farmland. She hopes to increase the income from her current business and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seeds, and to plow her farmland.

loans.name: Olga

texts.ru:
Ольга совсем недавно открыла свой торговый бизнес. Около года назад она стала арендовать небольшой прилавок на местном рынке, где раскладывает свои товары и продает носки и детскую одежду. Сначала Ольга боялась начинать свое дело, так как все говорили о кризисе. Но сейчас совсем не жалеет, что отважилась на этот шаг. 
Ольге потребовался кредит в размере 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы пополнить товар на точке и закупить новую партию детских носков и трусиков, а также маечки. Она планирует расширять бизнес. Недавно нашла более подходящее место на рынке, надеется со временем перейти торговать туда, когда немного подкопит денег.
texts.en: Olga recently opened her own business.  About a year ago, she began renting a small stall at a local market where she sells her goods such as socks, children's clothing.  In the beginning, Olga was afraid of starting her own business since everyone was talking about the financial crisis.  Now, she doesn't doesn't regret it and is glad she took that step.  She requires a loan of 5,000 hryvnia in order to replenish her inventory at her stall and to buy a new batch of children's socks, pants and shirts.  She plans to improve her business.  Not long ago, she found a better space at the market and hopes, with time, to move and begin selling there once she saves up the money.

loans.use: to replenish goods at her store and buy a batch of children's socks, pants and shirts

loans.name: Jelly

texts.en:
Jelly is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a bakery business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 40,000 through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like flour, yeast, cheese, etc. for her  bakery business.

Jelly has been in this business for 11 years. Jelly earns more income from raising pigs and farming sugarcane.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her bakery, pig-raising and sugarcane-farming businesses.

Jelly has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like flour, yeast, cheese, etc. for her business

loans.name: Judith Gyadalupe

texts.es:
La clienta Judith vive en Guayaquil.  Empezó hace más o menos 4 años con su tienda ya que el esposo la ayudo con los gastos del negocio. En la actualidad abre su tienda desde las 06h30 y cierra a las 19h00.

Su dificultad es que en el invierno los carros no suben hasta donde ella vive. Si esta casada, tiene  dos hijos los cuales estudian en escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos juegos geométricos arroz. su sueño es hacer más grande la casa y que sus hijos se hagan profesionales de bien.
texts.en:
Judith lives in Guayaquil. She started her business approximately four years ago. Her husband helps with the business expenses. She currently operates her store from 6:30 A.M. to 7:00 P.M.

Her difficulty is dealing with the winter season, since cars are not able to reach the area where she lives during that time. Judith is married and has two children who are studying at a state school. With this loan, she will buy notebooks, geometric games, and rice. Her dreams include expanding her house and seeing her children become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy notebooks, geometric games, and rice.

loans.name: Sunny

texts.en:
Sunny works hard to support her family. Sunny is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Sunny requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ingredients for her business.

Sunny has been in this business for 13 years now. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ingredients for her business

loans.name: Cornellius

texts.en:
Cornellius is a businessman residing in the Mukuru informal settlement in Nairobi, Kenya. He is a married man and the proud father of one son. During his many years in Mukuru, he has been greatly involved in community improvement programs for the slum. He is part of a self-employed group that focuses on sanitation; the group mainly collects garbage from the community with the aim of creating a better environment.

Cornellius is seeking funding to finance the purchase of one Fresh Life toilet to further ensure a cleaner environment for his community. He also plans to use the Fresh Life toilet as an opportunity to create jobs for youth in the slum, and through this sanitation project he aspires to become a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase and run a Fresh Life toilet

loans.name: Rislyn

texts.en:
Rislyn is 30 years old and has one child who is in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Rislyn is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Rislyn has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from vegetable and spice vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 62 years old and married, with four children.

Anita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 27,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, and eggs.

Anita has borrowed and paid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 35 years and also earns an income from pig fattening. She aspires to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, canned goods, noodles, and eggs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married and together with her husband she has three children, all of whom attend school.

She operates a food pantry out of her home. Mary worked with her mother from a young age and then inherited the business from her. Mary's husband works in construction. With great effort and the help of her husband, Mary’s family is able to move forward. She needs a loan to buy merchandise for her food pantry as well as school supplies. Her dream is to expand her business and provide employment in her neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her food pantry and school supplies.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 34-year-old married lady who has  with five children aged 13, 11, 9, 7 and 4 years old.  All of them go to school. She operates a retail shop selling household goods; the shop started in 1998. She has  additional income  from a restaurant that she runs.

Rosemary wants a loan of 2,500,000 shillings to  complete construction of her residential house. She does not want to get money from the  business for construction.

Rosemary is a hard-working person but her major challenge is the capital as well as the competition in the market from  similar businesses. She hopes to get money to  construct rental houses so that her sources of income are diversified.

In the photograph are the client and the loan officer. The loan officer has a name tag.

loans.use: To construct her residential  house

loans.name: Iskandarany Group

texts.en:
Amal is the featured borrower of Iskandarany Group. She got together with the other group member to apply for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends.

Amal is a 44-year-old married woman; she works as a tailor to help her husband with their living expenses. To improve her working sector, she applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, to start selling curtains and clothes too.

This will develop Amal's business in such a way that she will not need to wait for customers' requests to work; she will have her own prepared collection. She is the one in the middle.

Mounira is a 44-year-old married woman who works in the beauty & cosmetics business to earn her living and help her husband in covering their expenses. She is the one at the right. The requested loan will help her buy new furniture to improve her house to please customers, because her home is her business location.

Marwa is a 33-year-old married woman who works selling used mobile phones and prepaid cards. She will use this loan to increase her business capital with prepaid cards, which are highly requested.

loans.use: To start selling clothes and curtains

loans.name: Diana Patricia

texts.es:
Diana de 42 años de edad, desea capacitarse en la elaboración de carnes frías con el propósito de generar ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar, actualmente reside con su madre, por lo cual los gastos recaen sobre ella.
Sueña con crear su propio negocio y tener una estabilidad económica que le permita llevar una vida alejada de las preocupaciones monetarias.
Considera que con la capacitación tendrá mejores oportunidades en el mundo laboral.
texts.en:
Diana is 42 years of age, and she wishes to receive training in the preparation of cold meats, in order to generate income and improve the quality of life in her home. At present, she lives with her mother, who must absorb the costs.

Diana dreams of creating her own business and having the economic stability to allow her to live a life far removed from her present monetary preoccupations. She thinks that with this training, she will have better opportunities in the working world.

loans.use: acquire training in preparing cold meats.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en: Ms Gulzar is a 36-year-old married woman. The man shown in the photo is Gulzar’s husband who is a wholesaler by profession.  He purchases different types of goods from the market and then sells them to various shops using his motorcycle. He has been doing this business for many years to meet the family expenses.  In order to increase sales; Gulzar has applied for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to Kashf Foundation. With this, her husband would be able to purchase more items such as packs of biscuits, grains, juices and sweets. Gulzar is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as packs of biscuits, grains, juices and sweets.

loans.name: Igor

texts.ru:
Игорь уже несколько раз пользовался помощью КИВА в ведении своего бизнеса. Каждый их них давал ему возможность постепенно увеличивать свой доход. За счет реализации последней партии товара Игорь смог увеличить свой доход на 3 000 гривен. Особенно сложно Игорю в бизнесе пришлось зимой, когда покупателей было совсем мало. 
В этот раз он обратился к КИВА за суммой в 5 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сезонный товар. За счет увеличения ассортимента товара Игорь сможет сможет привлечь дополнительное количество покупателей и увеличить объемы реализации своего товара.
texts.en: Igor has already used Kiva to help us business a few times.  Each loan has given him the opportunity to steadily increase his income.  The last loan was used to buy a batch of inventory that increased Igor's income by 3,000 hrynia.  It was especially tough for Igor and his business during the winter when he had very few customers.  This time, he has turned to Kiva for a loan of 5,000 hrynia in order to buy seasonal inventory.  Buy increasing the variety of his goods, he will be able to attract additional customers and increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy seasonal inventory

loans.name: Amir

texts.en:
Ms Amir is a 41-year-old married woman. She is a vigorous lady and for the past two years she has been running a cloth business. She buys cloths of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. 

Amir requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from the Kashf Foundation to buy more variety of cloths for the summer season to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She is in her third loan cycle and has a good repayment history. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend the part of profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of cloth for the summer season to attract more customers and expand her inventory.

loans.name: Juan Cruz

texts.es: Don juan de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el  tiene una panadería desde hace 27 años con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir los gastos de su hogar, Don Juan solicita un crédito para poder comprar materia prima como: harina, azúcar, lavadura, etc. Y asi poder obtener mas ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Don Juan is 53 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and son. He has managed a bakery for 27 years. With the income he generates from his sales, he is able to cover the household expenses.

Don Juan is requesting a loan so that he can buy more supplies such as flour, sugar, yeast, and other items. This will enable him to generate more income so that he can provide better financial stability for his family.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, and other supplies.

loans.name: Salma

texts.en: Ms Salma is a 42-year-old married woman. For the past 10 years, she has been successfully running a milk-selling business with her husband. She is a mother of six. Two of her sons are doing agriculture work. She has three buffalo and sells their milk on a daily basis. Milk selling is her major source of income for meeting all household expenses. Salma has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. Salma has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. She is happily running her business. Now she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. She hopes to get an increase in her production capacity, which will ultimately help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Emilio Fausto

texts.es:
El cliente Emilio vive Quevedo. Comenzó con un ahorro que tenia de su trabajo anterior. Poco a poco pudo  comprar la máquina para elaborar sus helados. En la actualidad recorreo las calles de quevedo vendiedo helado ya que puedo comprar una maquina de helados y trabaja desde las 8h00am a 17h00.

La dificultad de él es el cuidado de sus hijos ya que es separado de su esposa, es soltero, tiene 5 hijos los cuales todos están en escuela fiscal.

Con el prestamo quiere comprar un compresor para tener mas venta de helado. Su sueño es arreglar su casa y poderle dar a sus hijos el estudio.
texts.en:
Emilio lives in Quevedo. He started out with some savings he accumulated from his previous job. Over time, he was able to buy a machine for making ice cream. He currently travels through the streets of Quevedo in order sell ice cream. With the ice cream machine he purchased, he works from 8:00 A.M. to 5:00 P.M.

His difficulty is being able to look after his children since he is separated from his wife. Emilio is single and has five children, all of whom are attending a state school. With this loan, he will buy a compressor so that he can sell more ice cream. His dream is to repair his house and provide for his children’s education.

loans.use: to buy a compressor for making ice cream.

loans.name: Daniel Matías

texts.es: Don Daniel de 35 años de edad vive  con su esposa y sus 3 hijos en casa propia, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el maiz y el maicillo, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Don Daniel solicita un crédito para poder comprar abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas y todo lo necesario para su cosecha y asi pueda obtener mejores ganancias con sus ventas para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
Daniel, 35 years old, lives with his wife and 3 children in his own house.  He has made his living in agriculture for many years.  His primary crops are corn and sorghum.  With the earnings he gets from his sales, he is able to cover his household expenses.

Daniel is applying for a loan to be able to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and everything necessary for his crop, so that he can get better profits from his sales in order to give his family greater economic stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Musrat

texts.en:
Ms Musrat is a 49-year-old married woman; she has been running a business selling milk for the past five years. She has one cow in milk. On a daily basis, she sells 10 Kg milk to many of her neighbors. Her business is good enough allow her to lead her decent life. 

She is a mother of two; both are school-going. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet life's day-to-day expenses. Her husband is also doing a job but his income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members alone. 

She needs to inflate her sales to earn more income to contribute to the family income. For this reason she applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase one more cow to get an increase in her capacity to produce milk which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa is a 57 year old male Ugandan, married to Cate with whom he has seven children aged 22, 20, 18, 15, 13, 11 and eight. Four of these attend school. He also looks after one elderly person.

Issa is a farmer growing bananas, cassava and sugarcane in Kahyoro-Muhorro, where his clients come from. He works 6 days a week and 13 hours a day. He also brews Waragi (a Local Brew) for additional  income; he has been doing this since 2009. 

Issa is seeking a loan facility of 1,000,000 UGX to buy machines to help him to cut sugarcane so he can brew alcohol from it as his dream is to prosper and grow his business into a big brewing business.

His challenge is seasonality of the business.

He is hard working and honest and extends his appreciation to the for providing these services to him.

loans.use: To buy machines to help him harvest sugarcane.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 41 years old and married with five children.

Melanie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, bread, egg, noodles, etc..

Melanie has borrowed and paid back six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying and selling livestock.

Melanie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like canned goods, soap, bread, eggs and noodles.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is married and has one school-age child. She buys and sells shoes. Her business is home-based in the town of Kisauni. She started this line of work with her husband and as they were in the same business and had a little bit of capital she was able to start her own business.

She comments that she has a good clientele because of the good work she does and the good customer care. She says that she’d like to expand the business and provide employment for people from her town. Because of this she puts more effort into it every day.

She is asking for the loan to buy shoes to resell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to resell.

loans.name: Yervand

texts.ru:
Emergency Situations Ministry's rescuer Yervand parallel to his work is still engaged in farming and animal breeding in Tsovagyugh village which is in Sevan area. Yervand breeds cattle, chickens and bees. Last loan from Kiva helped Yervand to buy 5 beehives and he received good profit from honey selling. 
Yervand has a higher education in the field of economy in rural sphere and this fact helps him in his agricultural business. 
This year Yervand started raising rabbits on his farm. Rabbit breeding is too hard work but it is new in their region and he discovered that it is a good new business which will bring him a good profit. More than 3 months Yervand learned and read a lot of information about rabbit breeding and decided to run this activity in his farm. 
This is second loan from Kiva for Yervand . This time Yervand asks from Kiva lenders a loan to construct barn for his rabbits and to buy 20 young rabbits for his new created rabbit breeding.
texts.en:
Yervand, a rescue worker employed by the Emergency Situations Ministry, parallel to his work, is still engaged in farming and animal breeding in Tsovagyugh village, which is in Sevan area. Yervand breeds cattle, chickens and bees. Last loan from Kiva helped Yervand to buy 5 beehives, and he obtained a good profit from selling honey.  Yervand has received a higher education degree in the field of economics in rural areas, which helps him in his agricultural business. 

This year Yervand started raising rabbits on his farm. Rabbit-breeding too is hard work, but it is new in their region, and he discovered that it is a good new business which will bring him a good profit.    For over 3 months, Yervand learned and read a lot of information about rabbit breeding and decided to  launch this activity on his farm.  This is a second loan from Kiva for Yervand . This time Yervand asks from Kiva lenders a loan to construct a barn for his rabbits and to buy 20 young rabbits for his new   rabbit-breeding business.

loans.use: to construct a barn for his rabbits and to buy 20 young rabbits.

loans.name: Riaz

texts.en:
Ms Riaz is 41 years old and a married woman and mother of four children. The man shown in the photo is Riaz’s husband who is a driver by profession. He provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Riaz has applied for a loan of PKR 30,000, for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Riaz is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: Doña maria de 50 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hija en casa propia, se dedica a vender ganchos para el cabello, juguetes, etc. de forma ambulante cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene ayuda en los gastos de su hogar, Doña Maria solicita credito para poder comprar mas ganchos para el cabello,  juguetes, peluches, etc  y obtener mejores ganancias para tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Maria, 50, lives with her husband and daughter in a house they own, she sells hair pins and clips, toys, etc. as a street vendor, close to her residence.  With the income she makes, she helps with the home expenses, Maria requests a loan to be able to buy more hair clips and pins, toys, stuffed animals, etc. and this way make more income and have better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy hair clips and pins, toys, stuffed animals, etc.

loans.name: Iy's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Kampong Cham province where cassava is the common business in the area, Iy is 41 years old and has three children. She also grows cassava in her neighborhood. This provides the main source of family income but she also works for pay to get additional income. She has been with this current business for 20 years, earning about 41,000 KHR per day. 

She and two other members of her group have applied to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for a new loan. They are seeking for 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fees for her cassava. She hopes that she can grow her crop healthily and gain a high yield so that she can sell it and get a high income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to pay plowing fees for her cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en:
Ms Fozia is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She has been doing a tailoring business for five years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household as well as the educational needs of the children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Now she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons and laces etc. In this way she will be able to complete orders of her customers on time. Fozia hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons and laces.

loans.name: Aldo Jaen Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Aldo Jaen Carlos, labora de lunes a sábado En una imprenta, tiene 4 años de trabajar allí. Es operario de maquinas.
     
Solicita un  préstamo  para invertir en la reparación de su casa, lo cual será reforzamiento de paredes y reparación de techo. Estas mejoras le permitirán reparar su vivienda.

 Agradece  a  Ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en el, por lo que este crédito lo invertirá en su vivienda de forma que esto le permitirá ir mejorando su condición de vida y la de su familia al mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sr. Aldo Jaen Carlos works Monday through Saturday at a print shop. He has worked there for four years and is responsible for operating the machines.

Aldo is requesting a loan so that he can invest in repairs to his house. He will reinforce the walls and repair the roof. These improvements will enable him to make his home more secure. Aldo is grateful to CEPRODEL and Kiva for this opportunity and the trust that they have placed in him. His loan will be invested in his home so that he can improve his living conditions and that of his family.

loans.use: to construction materials for home repairs.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Ms Abida is 35 years old and the mother of six children. For about 10 years, Abida has been running a business selling milk. She initiated her own business by buying a buffalo to support her family when her husband was doing a peon job. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters as well as financial matters. 

While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her son to college for further studies. She has some savings and applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Abida

texts.en:
Ms Abida is 41-year-old vigorous lady; she has been stitching clothes for many years. She stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads in different colors as well as packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will allow her to create a means of increasing revenues so she may able to generate healthier source of income. She is in her 4th loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors as well as packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Golibshoh

texts.ru: Голибшох 31 год. Он женат. У него одна дочь и двое сыновей. Он со своей семьей проживает в Шахритусском районе, в южной части страны. Голибшох занимается животноводством. Одновременно он хочет заняться торговым бизнесом и выбрал для этого куплю продажу миндального ореха. Он планирует закупать миндальный орех с близлежащих деревень района по низкой цене и поставлять на рынок с наценкой. С этим намерением он запрашивает кредит для закупа миндального ореха.
texts.en: Golibshoh is 31 years old. He is married. He has one daughter and two sons. He lives with his family in the Shahrituz region, in the south of Tajikistan. Golbishoh raises livestock. In addition, he would like to become a vendor, and has decided to specialize in buying and reselling almonds. He plans to buy almonds in nearby villages at a low price and deliver them to the marketplace to be sold with a mark-up. With this goal, he is requesting a loan to stock up on almonds.

loans.use: to stock up on almonds for resale.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Ms. Bushra is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of five. She has been running a business of trading cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good-quality cloth in her community. 

Bushra requested a loan of PKR 35,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. 

She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a male Ugandan, aged 40. He is married to Rosemary; together they have five biological children aged 14, 12, 9, 4 and 2. Four of the children attend school. Godfrey also has two elderly dependents.

Godfrey is a teacher by profession, working at Crane Model Primary School. He works nine hours a day, six days a week. He also earns extra income in agriculture, in particular bananas and beans in Kidwanyindo-Kagadi. His customers are mainly locals from Kagadi.

Godfrey seeks a loan of 500,000 UGX to help him finish the construction of his first home. He has completed a certain portion, but building is at a standstill due to financial constraints.

Godfrey faces the challenge of seasonality and weather.

He is honest and God-fearing. He is grateful for the services available to him.

loans.use: To complete construction of his house.

loans.name: Robina

texts.en: Ms. Robina is a 52-year-old married woman and a mother of four. She sews bedsheets and pillows. The man shown in the photo is Robina’s son who assists his mother in running this business. They have five years of experience in this field and make enough to contribute to the family income. Robina works hard to consistently provide income for their everyday expenses. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PKR to purchase bundles of cloth and spools of thread in different colors. In this way she will be able to meet the increasing demand. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Robina hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good quality education to her children through all her hard work.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth and spools of thread in different colors.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is a 31-year-old businesswoman.  She is single but has a fiance. In the year 2006, she established her local foodstuffs business. Working six days a week and eight hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like another loan of 6,000,000 SLL. 

She has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and she now requires a new loan in order to buy more local foodstuffs for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 500,000 SLL. She is still maintaining the rented store with her colleagues. She realizes more sales there and does not want to rent a store where she might find it difficult to get sales. Sales are important because she does not want to be unable to repay her loan. Meanwhile, she still intends to rent her own store that is closer to the market. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more local foodstuffs for her inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do culinary training in making products with cheese or syrup bases

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Ms. Rubina is 27 years old and a married woman who has sold milk with her husband for two years. She has three milk buffaloes. Rubina sells the milk, along with butter and cheese made from the milk, to many of her neighbors. She looks after the buffaloes and milks them while her husband sells it to different places on a daily basis. She makes enough to lead a decent life.

Rubina is a mother of three children; one of them goes to school. She needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing and education. In order to make bigger profits, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to serve more customers. She hopes to increase milk production, which ultimately will help to generate more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo.

loans.name: Hayat

texts.en:
Hayat is a  27-year-old married woman who has been working as a tutor out of her house for seven years. She is well known in the region, and recommended by her customers. She works to cover her education expenses, so that her husband doesn't need to add her university fees to the expenses he is already handling.

Hayat is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to pay for her university fees. She hopes to succeed in her life and education and start her own official teaching business in the future.

loans.use: To pay for her university fees.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Ms. Shazia is 35 years old and has been stitching clothes for five years. She sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is supporting her household because her husband is a pensioner and is now working for daily wages. She makes clothes and bedsheets on order for shopkeepers. 

She has requested a loan of PKR 25,000 from the Kashf Foundation. Shazia intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread, fabric and sheets for her sewing business. She wants to increase her revenues so that she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She is in her seventh loan cycle and thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: To purchase more spools of thread, fabric and sheets.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Ms. Naseem is a 37-year-old married woman. She makes “Ladoo Pethi,” which is a favorite snack in Pakistan, as it is simple yet spicy and very easy to make at home. Naseem is an expert in making it and has been doing this for the past 20 years. She manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of four children and is responsible for their food, health and education and tries hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. In order to build her sales, she needs to purchase packs of salt, black pepper, chili powder and bottles of cooking oil. For this reason she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 25,000. It will help her to cater to more customers time after time, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She is in her 4th loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: To purchase packs of salt, black pepper, chili powder and bottles of cooking oil

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Ms. Irshad is a 47-year-old, married woman. For eight years, she has been running a business purchasing and selling animals. She buys animals (baby cows) at low prices, brings them up, then her husband sells them out in the market, at higher prices. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. 

Currently, she has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to purchase one more cow. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children, through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to  purchase one cow.

loans.name: Elinah

texts.en:
Elinah is married to Kadii and has one child who attends school. She is a seamstress who, over time and after getting experience, opened her own workshop. She began with a single sewing machine and now has four. Her husband is a press reporter, and between them, they have provided everything for their child.

In the future, her goal is to expand her workshop, buy more machines, and provide jobs for others. She is applying for this loan so that she can buy fabric and thread to keep working and meeting her customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en:
Ms. Ghazala is a 39-year-old married woman. She is a very hard worker and a committed woman. 

For the past six years, Ghazala has been doing a business of milk sales. She initiated her own business by buying two buffaloes to support her family. With the passage of time, her sales increased and also her income. Now she has five buffaloes. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family members alone. Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She supports her family in all matters, as well as financial matters. 

Ghazala has some savings and applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en: Ms. Rukhsana is a 48-year-old active, married woman. She has had an embroidery business for the past four years. She is zealous about her work, and her client demand is strong.  But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to fully support his family alone. Rukhsana’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street, and she is the best earner in her household. She is a mother of five children, and all of them are school-going. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet her customers' increasing demands. She wants to run a training center for girls in her village. She would like to teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business and to also earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: To buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet her customers' increasing demands

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman with seven children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past years, she has operated a soft drink-selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the challenges of seasonality and the high cost of transporting raw materials. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts, fruits, mangoes, and passion fruits. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts, fruits, mangoes, and passion fruits.

loans.name: Turdimurod

texts.ru:
Турдимурод предыдущий заем брал для покупки досок, клея и красок для изготовления деревянных окон и дверей на продажу. С полученной прибыли он приобрел деревообрабатывающий станок и другие необходимые рабочие инструменты.
В настоящее время Турдимурод обратился за повторным кредитом. Теперь он берет кредит для нового бизнеса. Помимо своей основной деятельности он хочет заняться еще куплей и продажей крупнорогатого скота. У него имеются все условия для разведения скота. Турдимурод планирует каждый месяц закупать по двух голов бычков, откармливать их в течение месяца и перепродавать на скотном рынке своего района.
texts.en: Turdimurod took out a previous loan to buy boards, glues and paints to make windows and doors with wooden frames to sell.  With the profits he made, he purchased a woodworking machine and other necessary tools.  Now Turdimurod has returned for another loan.  This time, it is for a new business.  In addition to his main business, he wants to buy and sell cattle.  He has all the necessary conditions for cattle breeding.  Turdimurod plans to buy two bulls each month, fatten them for a month and then to sell them at a livestock market in his region.

loans.use: to buy a cow and feed

loans.name: Safar

texts.ru: Сафар житель района Джиликуль. Ему 57 лет. Он женат и является отцом четверых детей. Его жена работает учительницей в сельской школе. Сам Сафар занимается закупом и перепродажей мелкорогатого скота. Одновременно он хочет заняться еще и купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. При дворе дома у него имеется два коровника и собственное сено. К тому же скотный рынок находится недалеко от его дома. Сафар запрашивает кредит для закупа трех голов крупнорогатого скота. Продолжительность откорма будет составлять два месяца.
texts.en: Safar is a resident of the Jilikul region of Tajikistan.  He is 57 years old, married and is the father of four children.  His wife works as a teacher at a rural school.  Safar himself works buying and selling small livestock.  He wants to also start buying and selling cattle.  In his yard, he has two barns, each with its own hay.  The livestock market is located not far from his home as well.  Safar is asking for a loan to buy three head of cattle.  The duration of feeding will be two months.

loans.use: To buy three head of cattle

loans.name: Everline

texts.en: Everline has operated a clothes-selling business for some years. She sells in a shop to town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She also runs a food stall to supplement her earnings. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to buy bales of clothing for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business, and she appreciates her previous loan.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothing for resale.

loans.name: Wilder Antonio

texts.es: Don Wilder, habitante del barrio 380 una zona peligrosa por los delincuentes, con su familia busca como salir adelante principalmente que sus hijos logren culminar su carrera universitaria, por eso don Wilder trabaja incansablemente en su pulpería en conjunto con su esposa, para lograr su objetivo en la vida el bienestar de sus hijos que es primordial. Este sexto crédito que solicita es para alimentar un poco el negocio ya que carece de muchos productos de demanda por los vecinos, sus principales compradores y asi ayudarse a cubrir los diferentes gastos.
texts.en:
Wilder lives in the 380 neighbourhood. It's a dangerous area because of the criminals, and along with his family he is searching for a way to move forward, mainly because his children have managed to finish their university degrees. 

For this reason, Wilder works tirelessly in his grocery store with his wife to achieve his life goal - the wellbeing of his children, which is fundamental. 

This, his sixth loan, is to feed his business a bit as he lacks many products in demand by his neighbours, who are his main customers, and so it will help him to cover the different expenses.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy products, soap, meat.

loans.name: Kouser

texts.en: Ms. Kouser is a 40-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is trying hard to cover their needs, including food, health, clothing, and education. She and her husband have been engaged in agriculture together for many years. The man shown in the photo is Kouser’s husband. They grow various vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. Her son also assists her in growing the various crops by watering the soil for good quality production. She has gradually improved her business, with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to buy various types of seeds, as well as packs of insecticides and pesticides, Kouser applied for a loan of PKR 30,000. This would help her to grow more, which would ultimately help by generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase various types of seeds, as well as packs of insecticides and pesticides, to use in growing vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more textiles for her clothing business.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Ms. Tahira is 34-year-old lady. She is very talented and excels at her work of making soccer balls. She has also hired some people to stitch soccer balls, and she pays them wages according to their per piece rate for soccer balls. Her husband works as a laborer in a factory, and his income is too low to meet their expenses by itself. Tahira wants to cover all the basic needs of her children, including good quality food, health and education. She wants to make her sales grow. For this purpose, she applied a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy rubber bladders and leather covers in a large quantities, to cater to more customers without delays. She is hopeful of achieving an increase in her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business and desires to use part of her profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy rubber bladders and leather covers in large quantities, to cater to more customers for soccer balls without delays.

loans.name: Mahmadulo

texts.ru: Махмадуло холостой молодой человек. Ему 28 лет. Он живет с родителями в районе Вахш Хатлонской области. Махмадуло добрый и очень скромный человек. У него среднее образование. Махмадуло с 20 лет занимается растениеводством. Он на большом земельном участке выращивает арбуз и дыню.  Махмадуло  занимается этой деятельностью уже 8 лет. Он зарабатывает на жизнь за счет сельского хозяйства. Махмадуло берет кредит для приобретения минерального удобрения для урожая арбуза и дыни. С прибыли, полученной от продажи урожая Махмадуло хочет жениться.
texts.en: Mahmadulo is a young bachelor, 28 years old.  He lives with his parents in the Vakhsh region of the Khatlon state.  Mahmadulo is a kind and very modest person.  He has received a higher education.  Since he was 20, he has worked in agriculture.  On a big piece of land, he grows watermelons and other melons.  This is what he has done for eight years.  He earns his living from this business.  He is taking a loan out to buy mineral fertilizers for his crops.  With the profits, he hopes to get married.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers for watermelon and other melon crops

loans.name: Mumtaz

texts.en: Mrs. Mumtaz is a 27-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has gained two years of experience in this field. The person shown with her in the picture is her husband, who also assists her by purchasing stocks of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. She is the mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health care. She wants her business to grow, so she applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages for her small general store.

loans.name: Mahmad

texts.ru: Махмаду 45 лет. Он женат и у него пятеро детей. Он со своей семьей живет в районе Вахш. Махмад ответственный и трудолюбивый человек. У него среднее техническое образование. Его сыновья занимаются животноводством. Сам Махмад занимается земледелием в течение 16 лет. У него имеется большой участок земли, на котором он выращивает зерновые культуры и хлопок. Одновременно Махмад работает водителем. Кредит берет для приобретения минерального удобрения для урожая хлопка и пшеницы. В дальнейшем Махмад хочет расширить и улучшить свое сельское хозяйство, и надеется, что его хозяйство будет одним из лучших хозяйств.
texts.en: Mahmad is 45 years old, married and has five children.  He lives with his family in the Vakhsh region of Tajikistan.  Mahmad is an accountable and hardworking man.  He has a technical degree.  His sons work with livestock.  He himself works in agriculture and has done so for 16 years.  He has a large plot of land on which he grows crops and cotton.  Mahmad also works as a driver.  He's taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers for his cotton and wheat crops.  In the future, he wants to develop and expand his farm and hopes that it will be one of the best.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers for cotton and wheat crops

loans.name: Zeny

texts.es: Zeny, de 41 años de edad, vive acompañada de su esposo y su única hija en la casa propia que compro hace algunos años .Su actividad económica se centra en la venta de productos comestibles, siendo su hogar su propio centro de trabajo, hace mas de cuatro años que se dedica a este negocioa , fue su esposo quien le dio la iniciativa de poner una tienda de productos comestibles ya que en su localidad no habia ningún negocio de este tipo y fue así como se inicio en esta actividad. Al principio tuvo problemas ya que su casa no era apropiada para este tipo de negocio pero luego pudo arreglar este problema logrando tener un buen espacio.Este es el primer crédito con Kiva, por lo que agradece el apoyo financiero recibido, con el cual ayudará a mejorar su negocio e incrementar sus ventas.Zeny, invertirá los S/.1500 soles en la compra de productos tales como arroz , azúcar, leche , condimentos , entre otros .
texts.en:
Zeny, 41 years old, lives with her husband and her only daughter in her own house that she bought some years ago. 

Her economic activity is focused on the sale of food. She works from home and has more than four years in this business. It was her husband who gave her the initiative to open a grocery store as her neighborhood did not have this type of business so she started this activity. At first she had problems because her house was not appropriate for this type of business but later she was able to fix the problem succeeding in having a good space.

This is her first loan with Kiva, and she is grateful for the financial help given, which will help her improve her business and increase her sales. Zeny will invest the 1500 soles in the purchase of products such as rice, sugar, milk, spices, and more.

loans.use: to buy products such as rice, sugar, milk, spices, and more

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena is a small-scale fruit vendor in Dompoase (near Cape Coast). She has had some formal education, as she is a primary graduate. She is married and has four children. Her husband is currently unemployed. 

Abena has been working as a fruit vendor for close to seven years. As the sole provider in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of fruit, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of having a fruit stand, which will allow her to sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of fruit, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands.

loans.name: Ali

texts.ru: Али житель района Шахритус. Ему 56 лет. У него жена и двое взрослых сыновей. В данное время оба его сыновей находятся на заработках за границей. Сам Али занимается сельским хозяйством. Сейчас он хочет начать животноводческую деятельность. Его интересует купля-продажа крупнорогатого скота. При дворе дома у него имеется сарай для содержания скота. Чтобы начать бизнес, он запрашивает кредит для закупа трех голов крупнорогатого скота и его корма. Он планирует откармливать скот в течение месяца и затем перепродавать с наценкой на скотном рынке.
texts.en: Ali lives in the Shahrituz region of Tajikistan. He's 56 years years old and has a wife and two grown sons, both of whom are currently working out of the country. Ali makes a living as a farmer but wants to expand his business to cattle breeding. He owns a barn near his residence that can be used to house the cattle. He needs a loan in order to purchase 3 heads of large-horned cattle with feed. He's planning to fatten them for a month and then resell the cattle at the market for a profit.

loans.use: to purchase 3 heads of large-horned cattle and cattle fodder.

loans.name: Jose Medardo

texts.es: Don jose de 53 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en casa propia, don jose se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace 15 años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos su principal siembra es el maiz y el maicillo, el vende sus productos en agencias de granos básicos que están cerca de su  lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar. Don jose solicita un crédito para poder comprar abonos, herbicidas, fertilizantes, semillas y todo lo necesario para seguir con su cosecha y poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica
texts.en:
Jose is 53 years old and lives with his wife and his two children in their own house. 

Jose  has been working in agriculture for 15 years and that has given him the necessary experience to attend to his crops. His main crops are corn and sorghum. He sells his products at basic grains agencies that are near his home. With the earnings he obtains from his sales he can cover some household expenses. 

Jose is asking for a loan in order to buy compost, herbicides, fertilizers, seeds, and everything needed to continue with his harvest and to be able to give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, compost, etc.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline  is 50 years old, is a mother from Homabay County. She is married to John and they have four children who are adults.She is a small-scale farmer who grows sugarcane for the last five years and makes a monthly income of 10,000 KES. 


She has applied for her first loan of KES. 20,000 from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase seedlings for her farm. She will use the anticipated profit to pay back the loan.

Her dream is to have a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase farm seedlings.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius still operates his motorcycle transport business. The business has grown by leaps and bounds, and now he earns a monthly income of KES 10,200. He is most thankful to KADET LTD and KIVA lenders, for making it possible for him to achieve this success. He is applying for a second business loan, which will enable him to buy another motorcycle and create employment for his relatives.

loans.use: to buy an additional motorcycle

loans.name: Diego Alejandro

texts.es:
Diego de 29 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de vehículos automotores desde hace más de 6 años. En la actualidad tiene un proyecto de negocio que desea materializar pero antes de ello, requiere de capacitación en la elaboración de carnes frías con el fin de adquirir el conocimiento y obtener mejores resultados. 
Su mayor sueño es crecer dentro del mercado de embutidos y carnes frías con el fin de mejorar su calidad de vida y tener en un futuro próximo una gran empresa.
texts.en:
Diego is 29 years old. He sells automotive vehicles for a living and has for more than 6 years. Currently he has a business project that he wants to pursue but before he can, he requires training in processed meats with the goal of acquiring knowledge and obtaining better results.
His great dream is to grow within the market of sausages and processed meats with the goal of improving his quality of life and having a large business in the near future.

loans.use: to train in processing meat.

loans.name: Noheli Kharem

texts.es: La Sra. Noheli  tiene 21 años, soltera, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa deportiva, tiene su puesto de venta en uno de los mercados más concurridos de la ciudad de de El Alto,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Noheli  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de ropa  deportiva por mayor para surtir su puesto de venta, y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la compra de mercadería, La Sra. Noheli  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que hay varias personas que venden deportivos y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, es una persona joven con ganas de superación esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Noheli is 21 years old and single. She makes a living in the sale of sportswear and has a stall in one of the busiest markets in the city of El Alto.

This is Noheli's first loan cycle with this institution. She will use the loan to buy wholesale sportswear to stock up her stall and increase her working capital. 

Noheli's business faces competition, since there are many people selling sportswear, and she will use the profits to improve her quality of life.

She is a young person wanting to excel  and this is the only activity that keeps her happy. She is happy and thankful for this opportunity presented to her.

loans.use: to buy wholesale sportswear

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 43 años de edad, es una mujer casada y vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo, sus dos hijos y su suegra.Maribel se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles , pero su principal actividad es la preparación y la venta de tortillas y pan. Se inicio en este negocio gracias a su suegra quien le enseño a preparar las tortillas y desde entonces se dedica a este negocio .Al principio no le fue nada fácil, por que no contaba con los insumos necesarios para abrir el negocio, pero gracias al apoyo de su familia y a los ahorros que tenía mando hacer un horno para la preparación de las tortillas y del pan.Como una mujer emprendedora Maribel espera mejorar su negocio, y hacerlo crecer de tal manera que pueda abastecer a sus clientes con un mejor producto.Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad brindada para crecer con su actividad laboral. Con el monto solicitado de S/.1500.00  soles comprara insumos para la preparacion de tortillas tales como harina ,levadura , azúcar , entre otros productos .
texts.en:
Maribel is 43 years old. She is a married woman and lives in her own home with her husband, their two children, and her mother-in-law. Maribel sells food products, but her main activity is the preparation and sale of tortillas and bread.

She began this business thanks to her mother-in-law who taught her to make the tortillas and since then she has been working in this business. Af first it was not easy, because she did not have the necessary supplies in order to start the business, but thanks to the support from her family and and the savings that she had she was able to get the oven for the preparation of the tortillas and bread.

As a woman entrepreneur Maribel hopes to improve her business and to grow in such a way that she can supply her customers with a better product.

This is her first loan through Kiva and she is very grateful for the opportunity to grow through her work. With the requested amount of 1500 soles she will buy supplies for the preparation of tortillas such as flour, yeast, sugar, and other products.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as flour, yeast, and more

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
This is Gloria. She previously accessed an 8,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase merchandise items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would now like to apply for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy more merchandise items and products to increase her product inventory. The more items she has on display and available on hand, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to cover her children’s education and daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Gloria dreams that all her children will finish their studies and hopes to be successful in her business. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Aabida

texts.en:
Ms. Aabida is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. She has gained a year of experience in this field. Her husband also assists her by dealing with customers and by purchasing stock of goods from the market. 

Aabida is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. 

She is in her fourth loan cycle with a good repayment history.She is expecting a boost in her earnings, and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store.

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es: La Sra. Roxana tiene 31 años, casada  con un hijito de las edad de tres años,  ella se dedica  a la venta de relleno es una comida hecha de papa, ella vende es su puesto de venta que se encuentra en la zona Cotoca,   La Sra. Roxana una persona muy trabajadora  que con dedicación poco a poco va adquiriendo estabilidad y solvencia y también popularidad por que es muy conocida por sus clientes ya que La Sra. Roxana les atiende muy amablemente,  con el dinero del crédito comprara insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas como papa y aceite por mayor, la cliente cuenta que con mucho esfuerzo se puede crecer más y así seguir haciéndose de patrimonio para el bienestar de su familia y también personal, el deseo de La Sra. Roxana es poder mejorar su puesto fijo ya que esto le haría crecer más en su negocio y por ende mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Roxana is 31 years old, and is married with a three year old son. 

She works selling rellenos, which is a dish made from potatoes. She sells from her food stall which is located in the area of Cotoca. Roxana is a hardworking person who is little by little gaining stability, solvency, and also popularity as she is well known by her customers as Roxana serves them very graciously. 

With the loan proceeds she will buy supplies in order to make her dishes such as potatoes and oil at wholesale. The client with a lot of effort can grow more and thus continue earning money for the wellbeing of her family and personally.

Rosana’s dream is to be able to improve her regular food stall as this will make her business grow and thus improve her income.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food stall

loans.name: Elezabeth

texts.en:
Elezabeth is 49 years old and married with three children. She lives in Bonifacio, Misamis Occidental. 

She owns and operates a cement business to earn a living. She has been in her business for over nine years and earns 15,000 PHP every month. She has been a member of GMDPC since the year 2009, and now she has requested a loan of 24,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as cement. 

In the future, Elezebeth wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as cement.

loans.name: Anastacio Francisco

texts.es: Don anastacio de 53 años de edad se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 20 años y eso le ha dado mucha experiencia en esa actividad el se dedica a sembrar maíz y sorgo cuando su cosecha esta lista las vende en los comercios de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Don Anastacio esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, herramientas y todo lo necesario para su cosecha también para mejorar el terreno donde siembra y asi obtener mejores cosechas para darle a su familia una mejor vida sin limitaciones algunas.
texts.en:
Anastacio, age 53, has been farming for 20 years.  This has given him a lot of experience in this business activity.  He grows corn and sorghum.  When his harvest is ready, he sells it to the basic grains merchants that are close to where he lives.  With the income he gets, he manages to pay some of the household expenses.

Anastacio is requesting a loan to be able to buy manure, fertilizer, seeds, herbicides, tools, and everything that is needed for his harvest.  He will also use the loan to improve the land where he sows.  This way he will get better harvests in order to give his family a better life without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Narda

texts.en: Narda is 55 years old, widowed with five children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a tailoring shop. She has been in her business for over six years and earns 9,000 PHP every month. She joined GDMPC in the year 2007, and now she has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to purchase tailoring materials. In the future, Narda wants to make improvements of her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase tailoring materials

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is engaged in supplying sand and gravel for construction business in her place in Antequera, Bohol. Cheryl is a married woman and a mother of three children.

Cheryl is asking for a loan to buy more sand and gravel. Through this loan, she will be able to improve her business and makes it a success. Moreover, she wants to save money for the schooling of her children and to repay her loan time.

loans.use: to buy more sand and gravel

loans.name: Elkin Dario

texts.es:
Elkin de 37 años de edad, se quedó sin empleo desde hace algunos meses, por lo cual comenzó a laborar como independiente en la preparación y venta de comidas rápidas con el fin de generar los ingresos para el sostenimiento del hogar ya que su familia depende económicamente de él.
Debido a su labor actual, desea capacitarse en la elaboración de comida express y mejorar las ventas, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito ya que no cuenta con los recursos para dicha inversión. 
Sueña con tener una cadena de restaurantes y garantizarles a sus dos hijos menores de edad acceso a una educación de calidad.
texts.en:
