Elkin is 37 years old. He was unemployed for a few months, which is why he started working independently preparing and selling fast food in order to earn income for household expenses as his family depends on him financially.

Because of his current work, he wants to become qualified in the making of fast food and improve his sales, which is why he is requesting a loan as he does not have the resources for such as investment.

He dreams of having a chain of restaurants and guaranteeing his two young children access to a good education.

loans.use: to become qualified in the making of fast food

loans.name: Norma Yamileth

texts.es: Norma vive junto a su esposo, sus dos hijos y su suegro, ella es una mujer muy responsable quien siempre está en miras de mejorar su estabilidad económica. Ella trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan francés, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas y la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. Ella solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para contar con la ayuda necesaria para invertir en la compra de harina, levadura, manteca, latas y todo lo necesario para poder producir más. Este proyecto de mejoramiento para su panadería es muy importante para ella puesto que así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Norma lives with her husband, their two children, and her father-in-law.  She is a very responsible woman who is always looking to improve her financial stability.

She works in her own bakery, where she makes French bread.  With the income that she gets from her sales she helps her husband pay for the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan from INTEGRAL in order to have the help she needs to buy flour, yeast, shortening, baking pans, and everything she needs to be able to produce more.

This improvement project for her bakery is very important to her.  This way she will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, and shortening, etc.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is 46 years old and married with three children. Ma. Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Elena runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like shampoo, canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, bread, etc.

Ma. Elena has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, bread, etc. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

In the future, Ma. Elena would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store like shampoo, canned goods, soft-drinks, noodles, bread etc.

loans.name: Khoi

texts.en:
Khoi was born in 1990. He is a driver. His income is about 5,000,000 Vietnamese Dong (VND) per month.

Khoi has participated in the Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance (SEDA) credit program since 2009. In the last loan cycle, he borrowed 8,502,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, Khoi would like to borrow 9,810,000 VND. He will use the loan funds to plant peach’s flower trees. He wants to save more money, to build a new house in the future.

loans.use: to plant peach’s flower trees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, pants, and shorts for women and men

loans.name: Salasala Group

texts.en:
Maua is a married woman in her mid-thirties with two school-going kids. She has been running two businesses, one selling charcoal and the other a broiler business. She is in these businesses for six years. She works from 6:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This will be Maua's sixth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. With the previous loans, all of which were repaid successfully, she restocked on charcoal  and started her broiler business. With the returns received, she paid school fees and household expenses. She will use this loan to restock her charcoal supply again. She dreams to expand her businesses more. 

Maua will share this loan with her loan group Salasala, which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock on charcoal.

loans.name: Mien

texts.en:
Mien was born in 1983. She has a son and a daughter who are learning at kindergarten and primary school. Her husband is an electrical repairer. He earns about 5,000,000 VND per month. Mien sells fish and seafood to earn a living. Her income is about 5,000,000 VND. She has done this job for five years. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2009. In the last cycle, she borrowed 7,194,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy fish and crab to sell in her stall. She always wants to raise her children well and have more money for the business.

loans.use: to buy fish and crab to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years; she earns more income from a general store.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF.  She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Yasmeen

texts.en:
Ms. Yasmeen is a 33-year-old married woman who is living with her husband and four children in Punjab, Pakistan. For about six years she has been in the work of hand embroidery. She makes beautiful patterns for the people of her community. Her designs are in high demand and she has managed to consolidate a clientele that allows her to contribute to the expenses of her home. 

To help her to continue her operations, she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy reels of thread in different colors, as well as packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment. With this assistance, she would be able to cater more customers consistently. She hopes to see an increase in her income by targeting more customers. Yasmeen dreams for her children's bright future. She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history and is very much thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to buy reels of thread in different colors, and packs of beads, sequins and stones for embellishment.

loans.name: Narcisa Carmita

texts.es:
La clienta Narcisa vive en Guayaquil. Ella comenzó su trabajo porque la necesidad de ingresos la obligo a trabajar vendiendo caramelo, poco a poco fue obteniendo ingresos y por eso decidió cambiar de actividad comercial a venta de pescado y comida rápida. 

En la actualidad vende pescado trabajando sola desde muy temprano y en ocasiones con la ayuda de su la hija, labora en la mañana y en la tarde. La dificultad que ella tiene en su trabajo es la lluvia, es soltera, tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian en escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar pescado. Su sueño es ampliar su casa para que sus hijos vivan mejor.
texts.en:
Narcisa lives in Guayaquil. She began working because she needed the income. In order to earn money, she sold candy and gradually began generating revenue. She then decided to change her business to selling fish and fast food.

Narcisa currently sells fish by herself, starting in the early morning hours. Sometimes she will have help from her daughter. Narcisa works in the mornings and continues into the afternoon. The difficulty with her work is dealing with the rain. She is single and has two children who are attending a state school.

With this loan, Narcisa will buy fish. Her dream is to expand her house so that her children can live better.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Fernando De Jesús

texts.es:
Fernando de 50 años de edad, se dedica al oficio de vigilancia desde hace más de 10 años; pero debido a que es una actividad muy mal remunerada desea capacitarse en la elaboración de quesos y calados con el propósito de crear su propia empresa y mejorar su condición económica. 
Sueña con tener una vivienda propia y brindarle a su familia una estabilidad.
texts.en: Fernando, 50 years old, has been working in the surveillance industry for more than 10 years, but because it is a very poorly paid activity he wants to become trained in the craft of cheese making and fretwork with the idea of starting his own business and improving his financial condition. He dreams of owning his own home and giving his family stability.

loans.use: to pay for training in the making of cheese and fretwork

loans.name: Jose Gildo

texts.es:
El cliente Jose vive en Guayaquil. Su papá le enseño a trabajar vendiendo calzados y de ahí en adelante  se independizo ya que le gusta este tipo de comercio. El trabaja solo, no tiene hora fija. 

La dificultad en su trabajo es su enfermedad ya q hay a su edad es un poco complicado trabajar y en ocasiones  no puede trabajar. Es casado su esposa vende helados, gelatina y bolos, tiene hijos mayores de edad (uno de ellos aparece en la foto).

El préstamo lo quiere utilizar como capital para su trabajo comprando plantas para zapatos, suelas, tiras, pegamentos para realizar sus zapatos. Su sueño es poder tener un local propio.
texts.en:
Jose lives in Guayaquil. His father taught him the trade of selling shoes. He moved on to become independent since he enjoys this type of work. Jose works alone and does not have a set schedule.

The difficulty with his work is dealing will the illnesses that come with age, which can make his duties a little more complicated. On some occasions, he is not able to work. Jose is married and his wife sells ice cream, gelatins, and ice pops. They also have children (one of whom appears in the photo).

This loan will be used as capital for his work. Jose will buy soles, leather, bands, and adhesives for making shoes. His dream is to have his own shop.

loans.use: to buy soles, leather, bands, and adhesives for making shoes.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys de 54 años de edad, se dedica a  la venta de productos de panadería y postres a sus amigas y vecinas desde hace algunos años. Hoy se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito con el fin de capacitarse en la elaboración de quesos y calados para aumentar sus ventas. Su mayor sueño es montar su propia panadería y contribuir en con los gastos del hogar, mejorando la calidad de vida de su núcleo familiar,
texts.en: 54-year-old Gladys has been selling pastries and desserts to her friends and neighbors for a few years. She's currently seeking a loan in order to get training in making cheese and desserts with syrup, so she can increase her sales. Her biggest dream is to set up her own bakery and help support her household expenses, thereby improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to get training in making cheese and desserts with syrup.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo a sus 59 años de edad, es un hombre lleno de retos, sueña con montar su propio negocio, por lo cual realizó un curso de embutidos, el cual desea complementar con una capacitación de elaboración de carnes frías y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito, ya que no cuenta con los recursos para dicha inversión.
Asegura que una de sus mayores prioridades es brindarles a sus hijos acceso a la educación superior y mejorar la calidad de vida y la condición económica de su familia.
texts.en:
59-year-old Guillermo is a man who faces several challenges. He dreams of starting his own business, which is why he took a course in cured meats. He wishes to complement this with a training in making cold cuts. For that purpose he's currently requesting a loan, since he doesn't have the resources for this investment.
He guarantees that one of his biggest priorities is providing his children with access to higher education, and also improving his family's living conditions and financial situation.

loans.use: to get training in making cold cuts.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Glady's has been married for several years. They have three children, and all of them are dependent on her.

Together they set up a retail store at the market, which is located in a strategic place in town. She says they started with a little capital that she got from other jobs she had done previously as a salaried worker. Thanks to the work she is doing she has educated her children. 

She is requesting the loan to buy daily needs products to stock her store. She will buy things such as rice, noodles, sugar, etc. She is grateful for the help that she is receiving. It is a great growth opportunity for her.

loans.use: to buy daily need products to stock her store.

loans.name: Irma Mercedes

texts.es: Doña irma de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus 5 hijos y su esposo ella se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace 10 años siembra los principales granos básicos maíz y frijol con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, Doña Irma solicita un crédito para poder comprar los insumos necesarios para su cosecha como. Abono, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. Y para mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía que es donde hace sus siembras y asi obtener mejores ganancias con sus ventas para poder darle  a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Irma is 37 years old and she lives in her own house with her five children and her husband.  She has worked in agriculture for ten years.  She plants the main basic grains like corn and beans.  With the earnings she obtains from her sales she manages to cover the household expenses.  

Irma is requesting a loan to be able to purchase the necessary supplies for her harvest like manure, seeds and fertilizers, to improve the land, which is shown in the photograph and is where she does her plantings, and thus obtain better earnings with her sales in order to be able to give her family better financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, etc.

loans.name: Olinda Del Transito

texts.es: Doña olinda de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, Ella se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace 30 años siembra maiz y sorgo, gracias a su trabajo ha sacado a adelante a su familia y ha podido solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Olinda esta solicitando un crédito para poder mejorar su terreno que es el que muestra en la fotografía y comprar insumos agrícolas como: Abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas y todo lo necesario para su siembra y asi poder obtener mejores cosechas para seguirle dando a su familia todo lo necesario sin limitación alguna
texts.en:
Olinda is 60 years old and she lives in her own house with her husband and her son.  She has worked in agriculture for 30 years.  She plants corn and sorghum.  Thanks to her work she has been able to get ahead with her family and she has been able to cover the household expenses.  

Olinda is requesting a loan to be able to improve her land, which is shown in the photograph, and to buy agricultural supplies like manure, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and everything necessary for her planting and thus be able to obtain better harvests in order to continue giving her family everything they need without any limitations.

loans.use: to improve the land and to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, etc.

loans.name: Sajida

texts.en:
Ms. Sajida is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of making footballs for the past 15 years. She makes balls in different sizes, and sells them in her community and in the local market. She is famous in her town for providing high quality footballs. She earns enough to pay for the expenses of her family members. She is contributing much to the family income, as her husband’s income is not sufficient to fulfill the demands of his family members alone. Sajida is a motivated mother of five. She is able to provide them with good quality food, education, and clothing. 

For the improvement of her business, she contacted a Kashf Foundation business development officer for a loan of Rs. 25,000. The amount will be used to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay. She hopes to increase her sales, which ultimately will help in generating more cash. She dreams of expanding her business, and desires to use part of the profits for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase rubber bladders and leather covers in a large quantity to cater to more customers without delay.

loans.name: Mwanahawa

texts.en:
Mwanahawa is a merchant who sells clothes. She is married and lives in the Kisauni. Mwanahawa began selling in the marketplace thanks tofinancial assistance from her husband who is also a merchant. Gradually she was able to increase her business and now she offers her products throughout the district.

Mwanahawa buys from Mombasa at an affordable price which allows her to continue offering good prices. The articles of clothing that she sells most are those for women and children such as blouses, t-shirts, shorts, sweatshirts, and lingerie. She is requesting assistance so that she can buy articles of clothing that are in season. Mwanahawa wants to be well-stocked with these items so that she can offer them to her customers.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a widow. She has six small children who are still in primary school and she is dedicating her efforts to advance them. She began her business two years ago. She sells flat bread, cooked beans and rice, and the business, due to her considerable effort, is doing very well.

Thanks to her hard work, Asha is educating her children, and purchasing all the necessities that she could hope for. Asha wishes to continue working and investing in her work so that she can have the means to continue helping her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her stand such as meat, eggs, etc., and also to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Kadzo

texts.en:
Kadzo is a widow, and she lives in Kisauni. She has a fish business. She has been buying and selling fish for over four years. She says that with great effort her business is growing, and she is equipping it little by little. She hopes to be able to have a great place of business. That way she will be able to also have better conditions for her customers.

She requested the loan to buy stock of fish and add a vegetable stall. She always wants to be able to give her customers fresh, good quality products.

loans.use: to buy stock of fish and add a vegetable stall.

loans.name: Ana Josefa

texts.es: Doña ana de 40 años de edad se dedica  a la agricultura desde hace varios años su principal siembra es el  maíz y el sorgo con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar ella vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 21 y 19 años de edad. Doña Ana esta solicitando un crédito para comprar  abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, y herramientas para seguir con su cosecha y asi obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Ana is 40 years old.  She has worked in agriculture for several years.  Her main crops are corn and sorghum.  With the earnings that she obtains from her sales she manages to cover the household expenses.  She lives in her own house with her husband and her two children who are 21 and 19 years old.  

Ana is requesting a loan to purchase manure, seeds, fertilizers and tools in order to go on with her harvest and thus obtain better earnings to give her family better financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, etc.

loans.name: Fatmata Maya

texts.en:
This is 45 year-old Fatmata Maya.  She is single, and has two children aged, 20, and 13 years-old. In 1992, Fatmata Maya established her onions, cooking-oil, rice, tinned tomato and maggi business. She began her business because she wanted to sustain her family .Working six days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000 in order to buy ground-nuts, palm-oil, and bennie (sesame seeds). She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Fatmata Maya plans to build a more spacious stall to better display her goods. Very hard working, she thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy ground-nuts, palm-oil, and bennie (sesame seeds).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy garrei, ground-nuts, palm-oil, and bennie (sesame seed).

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with seven children and one of them attends school. She is looking after another family member (her mother).
She has been selling used clothes in the market at retail for ten years, working six days a week. She generates additional income from rental rooms. 

She has requested a loan of UShs 2,000,000 from Kiva partner MCDT- SACCO in order to enable her to stock more bales of used clothes to sell. Her challenges include seasonality and defaulters. Her dream is to expand to become a wholesaler and also to build more rental rooms. She joined MCDT-SACCO because of the relatively low interest charged on loans. She resides in a house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, food and paying for utility bills.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Shabana

texts.en:
Ms. Shabana is a 27-year-old married woman. She has expertise in embroidery, and has been using her skill to provide for her family for over 5 years now. She started this line of work at a very young age. During the initial years of her business, she barely made enough money to purchase the required materials. Today she is proud to be famous in her community and to be the best at making beautiful patterns with thread and beads. 

She has requested a loan worth Rs. 25,000 to purchase spools of threads, packs of sequins, and glittery material in various colors.  She says that with the passage of time, the females in her community are becoming demanding; satisfying them is a challenge that Shabana has taken up. For their prosperous future, she wants to provide her children with a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads, packs of sequins, and glittery material in various colors.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with one child who attends school. She is also looking after two sisters.

Jane has been operating a beauty salon for five years, working seven days a week. She does not have any other source of income.

She has requested a loan of UShs 1,000,000 from Kiva partner MCDT- SACCO in order to be able to purchase hair shampoo, hair oils, human hair, cream relaxers, hair beads and towels. Her challenges include seasonality and unstable power supply. Her dream is to own a big beauty salon and a gymnasium.  She joined MCDT because of their interest in low income earning women. She stays in a rented house with access to both electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more hair shampoo, hair beads, towels, cream relaxers and human hair.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is a 40-year-old male living and working in the city of Magburaka in the northern province of Sierra Leone. Alfred is married and has seven children, three of whom are attending primary schools.  Not only has Alfred been working at a sugar factory for the past ten years, he also generates additional income to support his family through farming.

Alfred is requesting a loan of SLL 1,200,000 from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Sierra Leone in order to purchase seeds to plant in his farm. 

Through partnering with his employer, the sugar company, SMT is able to provide borrowers like Alfred with microloans that are repaid through payroll deduction.

loans.use: to purchase seeds to plant in his farm.

loans.name: Elsah

texts.en:
Elsah lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is married and has four children. She owns a green grocer, a business which she has been operating for seven years. She sells tomatoes, sugar, onions etc in this business.

Elsah learnt about Kiva partner Milango through friends who invited her to the group and she joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is the high costs of transport while sourcing the goods.
 
Elsah is applying for a loan of 74,450 Kenya shillings in order to buy vegetables and fruits wholesale. She hopes to someday be a major supplier of fruits even to the hotels.

loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits wholesale and some bags of sugar.

loans.name: Medius

texts.en:
Medius lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with seven children and all of them attend school. She is not looking after other family members.

She has been selling second hand clothes in the market at both wholesale and retail for the last 15 years, working six days a week. She does not earn any additional income.

She has requested a loan of UShs 1,100,000 from Kiva partner MCDT- SACCO in order to enable her to stock more bales of shirts, blouses, trousers, dresses and skirts to sell.  Her challenges include thieves and seasonality. Her dream is to accumulate sufficient profits to enable her to acquire land to build a house and also to become a wholesaler. She joined MCDT because of the relatively low interest on loans. She rents a house with access to electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more bales of trousers, blouses, dresses and skirts to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits wholesale.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has two children. He owns a transport business which he has been operating for two years. He offers transport service to the residents of Mombasa.

Julius learnt about Kiva partner Milango through a friend who invited him to the group and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenges he is facing are high theft of motorcycles and high fuel costs.

Julius is applying for a loan of 62,700 Kenyan shillings in order to expand the business by buying another motorcycle. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the standard of living of his family.  His plan for the future is to buy additional motorcycles.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 40 years old and lives in the town of Luwero, in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children. For the past 10 years, Eva has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells plastic items. 

To help expand her business, Eva has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more plastic items such as thermoses, basins, and plastic plates to sell; it will help Eva to generate greater profits and provide basic needs for her family. Eva hopes that in the future, she will be able to start up a big supermarket in town. 

Eva is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Eva who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more plastic items such as thermoses, basins, and plastic plates to sell.

loans.name: Mwanahalima

texts.en:
Mwanahalima makes a living cooking and selling delicious chapatis (flat bread), and thanks to her previous Kiva loan, she has been able to continue with her business. She is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to her business and supporting her family. 

Thanks to her previous loan, Mwanahalima has expanded and improved her overall business as well as the quality of her products. She plans to use the support from this loan to establish rental houses, purchase bricks, cement, and sand to build rooms and this will enable her to continue working and supporting her family .  She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, and sand to build rooms.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is a hardworking mother who runs a salon but apart from that she has a cafe which supplements her earnings. With the loan of Kshs 10000 she wants to buy stock of food for her cafe in order to have enough materials to use in food preparation. She intends to buy maize flour, vegetables, rice, wheat flour and beans to make food.  She thanks Kiva for the support.

loans.use: to buy maize flour, vegetables, rice, wheat flour and beans for making food,

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is married with two school-going children. They live at their own house, which has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Martha has operated a fruit and vegetable business for the past year. She sells from home to her neighbors. She dreams of establishing a mini-greengrocer in the future.

With this 25,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha is a married mother of four school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the children.

She has operated a retail business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbors. She faces a challenge in her business of delayed payments by creditors, and she dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 40,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat and maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat and maize flour and cooking fat.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en: Noor lives in the Mariakani area of Kenya's Coast Province. He is married and has five children. He owns a retail shop, a business which has been in operation for five years. In this business, he sells retail items, such as rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. He learnt about Milango through friends who invited him to the group and he joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business. His main challenge is the high cost of products. Noor is applying for a loan of KES41,850 to buy retail stock, such as sugar, flour, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve his family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy retail stock, such as sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: La Sra. Miriam sigue con la actividad del  tejido de blusas de hilo,  cuenta que le fue bien con el anterior crédito ya que lo utilizo en la compra de hilo por mayor, cuenta que le fue bien  creció en su actividad e incremento su clientela, y por ende sus ingresos económicos, en esta ocasión solicito el crédito para la compra de hilo por mayor para el tejido de blusas y así seguir  incrementando su capital de trabajo, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta nueva oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en: Señora Miriam continues with her business of knitting blouses from yarn. She relates that things went well with the previous loan, since she used it to buy yarn wholesale. She says that it went well. She grew her business and increased her clientele and therefore her income. At this time she is applying for a loan to purchase yarn wholesale to knit blouses and thus continue increasing her working capital. She feels happy and grateful for this new opportunity that is offered to her.

loans.use: to buy yarn to knit blouses.

loans.name: Kabibi

texts.en:
Kabibi sells charcoal. Managing her business involves offering merchandise and accepting payments over a short or long term, which she collects each day. This type of work allows her to provide jobs to other people since she has many customers.


Kabibi is an entrepreneur who seeks to improve the stability of her family day after day. Her objective going forward is to buy a handcart for delivering her merchandise. She is requesting this loan so that she can buy a variety of products to sell. This will enable her to continue working and selling many types of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Iterambere Group

texts.fr:
Nabor fait partie du groupe  Iterambere  et   habite à Gitega. Il a  48  ans et est marié à Anastasie, une vendeuse  de  bananes. Ensemble ils ont  7 enfants âgés de 5 à 20 ans dont 6 étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de  boutiques (haricot, sel, savons,..) depuis 32  ans. 

Il  est à son  deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’articles de sa boutique (haricot, sel, savons,…), à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Nabor lives in Gitega and he is a member of the Iterambere group.  He is 48 years old and married to Anastasie, a banana seller.  They have seven children together, aged 5 to 20.  Six of their children go to school.

Nabor has been selling grocery products (beans, salt, soaps...) for 32 years.

He is on his second loan with Turame.  With this loan, financed by KIVA, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity a grocery products (beans, salt, soaps) for resale, in order to make more money.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of grocery products (beans, salt, soaps, etc.)

loans.name: Jose Humberto

texts.es: Don Jose de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años  siembra maíz y frijol  con las  ganancias que obtiene de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda pero con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder realizarlo por eso solicita un crédito para construir unos cuartos para sus hijos y poder comprar los materiales necesarios como: cementos, ladrillos, arena y todo lo necesario para construir su vivienda y poder vivir tranquilos y seguros .
texts.en: Don José, who is 51 years old, lives in his own house with his wife and their two children. He has been working in agriculture for a number of years. He plants corn and beans. With the earnings that he obtains from his harvests, he manages to pay some of the expenses of his household. He wants to improve his house, but with what he earns, it is not enough to be able to do it. For this reason, he is applying for a loan to construct some rooms for his children and to be able to buy the necessary materials such as cement, bricks, sand, and everything necessary to construct his house and be able to live peacefully and safe.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, etc.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed is working in the township of Magburaka in the Northern province of Sierra Leone. Mohamed is married and has 7 children; 4 are in primary school, and 3 are in secondary school. 

Not only has Mohamed been working as a steam boiler operator at a sugar factory for the past 10 years, he also has been generating additional income to support his family by selling palm oil and rice in the local markets for 6 years. His wife also works as a trader. Mohamed is requesting a loan of SLL 2,500,000 from Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Sierra Leone, to purchase additional stock for his small business.

Through partnering with his employer, the sugar company, SMT is able to provide borrowers like Mohamed with microloans that are repaid through payroll deduction.

loans.use: to purchase additional palm oil and rice for his small business.

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
Santa Lucia con mucho esfuerzo ya está en su ciclo número 7, donde todas las miembros están muy contentas por formar parte del programa de comités, ya que vieron una gran oportunidad, no solo para ellas sino también para sus familias.
Mercedes, una de ellas se dedica a la venta de queso y de leche. Comenta ella que empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas, ya que tiene que repartir la leche a sus clientes para la hora del desayuno. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora, que quiere salir adelante, por lo cual se esmera al máximo y quiere salir adelante.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de leche y queso, el cual podrá vender y de esa forma procurar los medios para poder seguir ayudando a su familia. Agradece por la gran oportunidad que todas están recibiendo, ya que les será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Santa Lucía Group made a lot of effort to be in its seventh loan cycle.  All the members are very happy to be part of the communal bank program because they saw a great opportunity, not only for themselves but also for their families.

One of them, Mercedes, makes a living selling cheese and milk.  She says she starts working very early because she has to distribute the milk to her customers for breakfast.  She's a very hardworking person who wants to get ahead, so she makes the maximum effort.

She's requesting this loan to buy milk and cheese to sell so she can have the means to continue helping her family.

She's grateful for the big opportunity they're all receiving because it'll be a big help to them.

loans.use: to buy cheese and milk

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.es:
Leonarda nació en la ciudad de Yanatile (Calca, Cusco, Perú) pero vive en la ciudad de Salvación.  (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). 

Leonarda tiene 47 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante su familia y su actividad económica principal es la agricultura, ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra plátanos, piñas, yucas, maíz y otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar semillas y fertilizantes. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Leonarda was born in the city of Yanatile (Calca, Cusco, Peru), but she lives in the city of Salvación. (The city of Salvación is located in the district of Manu in the province of Manu, in the department of Madre de Dios, Peru).

Leonarda is 47 years old and is in a free union relationship from which she has six children. She is a hard-working and entrepreneurial woman who is raising her family. Her principal economic activity is agriculture. She has a number of plots of land where she plants bananas, pineapples, yuccas, corn, and other crops. She has already worked in this business for a number of years, and it is going very well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into her work. She belongs to the communal bank "Tesoritos del Manu" (Little Treasures of Manu), and at this time she needs the loan to buy seeds and fertilizers. She is grateful for and values the loan, and she promises to make her monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Gloria Esperanza

texts.es: Doña gloria de 45 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hija en casa propia, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, humilde y responsable  se dedica  a la venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. Doña Gloria solicita un crédito para poder mejorar su vivienda ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para poder comprar los materiales necesarios como: cemento, arena, ladrillos y mano de obra para construir su vivienda y asi ella y su familia puedan vivir mas seguros.
texts.en:
Gloria, 45, lives with her husband and her daughter in her own house.  She's a very hardworking, modest, and responsible person.

She makes a living selling fruits and vegetables in the market near her house.  With the profits from her sales she manages to pay the household expenses.

Gloria's requesting a loan to improve her house.  What she earns isn't enough to be able to buy the necessary materials, such as cement, sand, and bricks, and to pay for labor to build her house so she and her family can live more securely.

loans.use: to buy cement, bricks, sand, etc.

loans.name: Marta Julia

texts.es:
Marta Julia es una señorita de 20  años, soltera,  junto a su familia  actualmente viven en el caserío Maya Kakchiquel, municipio de  Sololá.
Ella se dedica  al cultivo de maíz  para el consumo familiar. Esta actividad la realiza desde niña junto a su familia, esto le genera también algunos ingresos para cubrir otras necesidades. Otra actividad que realiza es el cultivo de hortalizas. 
Ella está solicitando un préstamo de Q 3,000.00 para la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz.
Su sueño es terminar su carrera y graduarse como Perito Contador y luego ejercer su profesión.
texts.en:
Marta Julia, 20, is a single young woman.  She and her family currently live in the community of Maya Kakchiquel in the town of Sololá.

She makes a living growing corn for family consumption.  She has done this job with her family since she was a little girl.  This also generates some income to cover other necessities.  Another job she does is grow vegetables.

She's requesting a loan of 3,000 quetzales [GTQ] to buy fertilizer to grow corn.

Her dream is to finish her degree and graduate as a certified accountant so she can practice her profession.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow corn

loans.name: Amougou

texts.fr: Amougou est une femme de 57 ans mariée mère de 9 enfants. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( maniocs, plantains) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 10 ans. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai acheter un pick-up des régimes de plantains pour avoir un bon stocks ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Amougou is a 57-year-old woman.  She is married and the mother of nine children.  She is involved in retail and sells fresh produce (cassava, plantains), depending on the season, at a local market.  She has been involved in this activity for the past ten years.  

Amougou knows her suppliers and also her customers particularly well, as she has built her customer base over time, thanks to her experience in this field.  However, because of her small capital, she always has to sell all her stock of merchandise before she can buy more goods.  As a consequence, she is constantly out of stock.

She would like to buy a truckload of plantains in order to have a good stock of merchandise, which will allow her to better satisfy the constant demand from her customers and will prevent shortages.

Amougou will save her profits, not only to increase her business, but also to meet the needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy a truckload of plantains.

loans.name: Kibibi

texts.en:
Kibibi has been married for years, and she has one child. They have lived in Kisauni in a rental house that has electricity and piped water.

Kibibi has been a vendor for 1 year. She has a stall in the market where she sells fruit, vegetables, and novelty items. Her shop is well-stocked, and she has an established customer base. She gets up very early to open the stall and to buy fresh produce so that she can offer high quality products to all of her customers.

Today she is requesting a loan to buy fruits and vegetables so that she can continue to offer her customers a good variety of what they need.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Maria Consuelo

texts.es: Doña Maria de 56 años de edad, vive con su familia en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, está ubicada en su lugar de residencia, se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues vende a buen precio su mercaderia y es una persona muy amable; como toda buena comerciante quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, golosinas, huevos, pan, bebidas, etc. Doña Maria tiene buenas referencias de pago, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Maria is 56 years old and lives with her family in her own home. She has a store selling primary-need items such as beans, milk, eggs, bread and other products. She has had the business for many years, giving her plenty of sales experience that has allowed her to increase her profits. The store is located in her home and she has many customers since she offers good prices and is a very friendly person. Like all good business people, she wants to expand her business and make a new investment, but first she needs capital, which is why she is requesting a loan that will allow her to purchase basic grains, snacks, eggs, bread, soft drinks and other items. Maria has good references and is confident she will pay off the debt while giving her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, snacks, eggs, bread, soft drinks and other items.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is a businessman living in the coastal town of Mombasa, Kenya. He is married and has a shoemaking shop that he has been running for the last fifteen years. He was introduced to Milango Financial Services by his friends, and joined to access credit.

He is applying for a loan of 21,050 (KES) to buy shoe soles, linings, leather, and Tough Bond glue for the business. He believes this will help supplement the income from his second hand clothes shop.

loans.use: to buy shoe soles, linings, leather, and Tough Bond glue for the business.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana nació en el centro poblado de Gamitana pero vive en la ciudad de Salvación.  (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). 

Juana tiene 33 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante su familia y su actividad económica principal es la recolectar mariposas y venta de comestibles, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio donde vende diferentes productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo arroz, azúcar, fideos, otras cosas más. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería al por mayor como sacos de azúcar y sacos de arroz. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en: Juana was born in the central town of Gamitana but now lives in the city of Salvación (district and province of Manu, department of Madre de Dios). She is 33 years old and has three children with her common-law husband. She is a hardworking and enterprising mother who makes headway for her family by collecting butterflies and selling food. She runs a small grocery store out of her home selling different primary-need products like rice, sugar, noodles and other items. She has made a living with the business for a number of years and it is going very well thanks to the hard work she puts into it. Juana belongs to the "Tesoritos del Manu" community bank and is requesting the loan to purchase wholesale supplies like sacks of sugar and sacks of rice. She is grateful and values the loan, and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale supplies like sacks of sugar and sacks of rice.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Amahoriwacu Group

texts.fr:
Pierre fait partie du groupe  Amahoriwacu  et   habite à Gitega. C’est un veuf de 43 ans. Il a  4 enfants âgés de 13 à 20 ans dont 2 étudient.

Il  fait le commerce de  boutiques (riz, sel, savons,..) depuis 4  ans. 

Il  est à son  deuxième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité d’articles  de sa boutique (riz, sel, savon,…) à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans l’avenir, il voudrait  introduire dans son commerce les beignets et  en fournissant les clients détaillants.
texts.en:
Pierre, a 43-year-old widower, lives in Gitega and is a member of the Amahoriwacu group.  He has four children, aged 13 to 20, two of whom are in school.

He has been selling grocery products (rice, salt, soaps...) for the past four years.

Pierre is on his second loan with Turame.  With this loan, received from KIVA, he will increase his capital and buy a large quantity of grocery products (rice, salt, soap) for resale in his shop.  His goal is to earn more.

In the future, he would like to start selling fritters, on a retail basis, to his customers.

loans.use: to increase his capital and buy a large quantity of grocery products (rice, salt, soap) for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell.

loans.name: Abanamarimwe Group

texts.fr:
Beratira fait partie du groupe  Abanamarimwe  et   habite à Gitega. Elle a 46 ans et est mariée à Jean, un cultivateur. Ensemble  Il s a  4 enfants  dont 2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de  bananes et de fruits depuis 24 ans. 

Elle  est à son  troisième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de bananes et de fruits  à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Beratira is a member of the Abanamarimwe group and she lives in Gitega.  She is 46 years old and married to Jean, a farmer.  Beratira and Jean have four children, two of whom are in school.

Beratira has been selling bananas and fruits for 24 years.

She is on her third loan with Turame.  With this loan, received from KIVA, she will increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas and fruits for resale, to earn more.

loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of bananas and fruits for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Pilgrim

texts.en:
Pilgrim is from Kisauni. She is married and is the owner of a store that sells various types of clothing in Kisauni, where she has worked for more than three years.

She is a very hard-working person who, thanks to her efforts, is getting ahead and helping her family day by day. She tells us that things are very difficult, but in spite of that, she makes an effort to move forward.

She is asking for this loan in order to purchase various types of clothing to supply her business. In this way, she will be able to continue working and making sales that will give her the income to maintain her home.

loans.use: to purchase various types of clothing to supply her business.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María es una joven de 23 años, habitante de un barrio llamado Ciudad Sandino, es casada su esposo labora como técnico quirúrgico en un hospital público, ella labora como recepcionista en una institución estatal, de esta manera esta joven pareja busca como salir adelante en la vida, aun no tiene hijos por lo que antes que lleguen ella quiere darle prioridad a la mejora de su vivienda, es por eso que con este primer crédito hará la mejora del piso de la casa que no tiene buenas condiciones, comprara cemento y cerámica para empezar la obra.
texts.en:
María, 23, is married and lives in the Ciudad Sandino neighborhood.  Her husband works as a surgical technician in a public hospital.  She works as a receptionist in a state institution.  This is how this young couple seeks to get ahead in life.

They don't have children yet and, before they do, they want to make it a priority to improve their home.  This is why with this first loan she'll improve the floor of the house, because it's in bad condition.

She'll buy cement and tiles to begin the work.

loans.use: to buy tiles and cement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has four children. He owns a tailoring shop; a business he has been operating for eight years. Stephen learned about Milango Financial Services through a friend who invited him to the group. He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. 

His main challenge is competition from established businesses and debts. Stephen is applying for a loan of 62,700 Kenyan shillings to buy sewing machines and fabrics. He will use the extra income to improve the standard of living of his family.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines and fabrics.

loans.name: Blanca Rosa

texts.es:
Blanca, de oficio comerciante, originaria de las Isletas de Granada. Ella vende granos básicos, su anterior crédito lo utilizo para comprar arroz, azúcar, frijoles y purina. Está muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado atravez del financiamiento Kiva. Actualmente cuenta con más clientela y la demanda de los productos ha aumentado, ella es madre y padre para sus hijos todo los días se levanta con la fe de darles un futuro mejor a sus hijos, mejorar su negocio pues es su único medio de subsistencia. 
Hoy está solicitando el crédito para comprar arroz y aceite al por mayor pues conseguirá un mejor precio.De esta manera  lograra mantener precios justo para poder sustentar las alzas.
texts.en: Blanca is a merchant and a native of Isletas de Granada. She sells basic grains. She used her previous loan to purchase rice, sugar, beans and dog food. She is very grateful for the support from Kiva's financing. She currently has more customers, and demand for her products has grown. Blanca is a single mother who gets up everyday with the faith to give her children a better future by improving her business, since it is their only means of subsistence. She is requesting the loan to purchase rice and oil wholesale so she will get a better price. In this way she will be able to keep her prices stables and sustain her profit margins.

loans.use: to purchase rice and oil wholesale.

loans.name: Gerome

texts.fr: Gérôme est une homme de 48 ans marié père de 7 enfants, 5 d'entre eux vont encore à l'école. Il est commerçant et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais( tomates,légumes) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 20 ans. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'il a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais il se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'il est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaiterai augmenter son stock de vivres en achetant en gros ceci augmentera non seulement ses ventes mais aussi son bénéfice. Bénéfice qu'il réinvestira en partie dans son activité pour l'agrandir et le reste lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Gérôme is a 48-year-old man who is married and the father of seven children.  Five of his children are still in school.  Gérôme is involved in retail and sells fresh produce (tomatoes, vegetables), depending on the season, at a local market.  He has been involved in this activity for the past 20 years.

Gérôme knows his suppliers and also his customers particularly well, as he has built his customer base over time, thanks to his experience in his field. However, because of his small capital, he always has to sell his entire stock of merchandise before he can buy more goods. As a consequence, he is constantly out of stock.

He would like to increase his stock of produce and buy bulk quantities of food products, which will not only increase his sales, but also his profits.  

Gérôme will reinvest part of his profits in his business, in order to expand it, and will use the rest of the money to meet the needs of his family.

loans.use: to increase his stock of tomato crates.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of goods (tomatoes, rice, condiments etc.)

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati makes a living selling charcoal, and thanks to her previous Kiva loan, she has been able to continue with her business. She is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to her business and supporting her family. 

Thanks to her previous loan, Bahati has expanded and improved her overall business as well as the quality of her products. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal for resale. She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wholesale corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale vegetable stall in the future.

With the KSHS 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and she appreciates the previous Kiva loan, which helped her to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 41 años de edad, es una mujer casada, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Rosa se dedica a vender pollo por las mañanas en su puesto de venta en el mercado y por las tardes vende comida en la vereda de su casa, se inicio en esta actividad buscando mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia, hace 5 años que viene ejerciendo esta actividad, empezó vendiendo anticuchos, salchipollo, salchipapas a las afueras de su hogar pero con el tiempo pudo establecerse mejor.Este es el primer crédito con Kiva, y esta agradecida por el apoyo económico recibido ya que le ayudara a mejorar su negocio además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.Con el monto solicitado de S/.1000 soles comprará insumos tales como arroz , aceituna y condimentos para la preparación de juanes además comprará pollos para su puesto de ventas .
texts.en:
Rosa, 41, is a married woman.  She lives with her husband and her two children in her own house.

Rosa makes a living selling chicken in the morning in her sales stall in the market.  In the afternoon she sells food on the sidewalk of her house.  She started this job to improve her quality of life and that of her family.

She has been doing this job for five years.  She began selling "anticuchos" [grilled beef hearts], "salchipollo" [fried potatoes, hot dogs, and chicken], and "salchipapas" [fried potatoes and hot dog] outside her home, but in time she was able to set herself up better.

This is her first loan with Kiva.  She's grateful for the financial help received because it will help her improve her business.  She also promises to make her payments punctually.

With the requested amount of 1000 soles [PEN] she'll buy supplies such as rice, olives, and condiments to prepare "juanes" [a traditional regional dish similar to a tamal made with rice and wrapped in a bijao leaf].  She'll also buy chicken for her sales stall.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as rice, olives, condiments, and chicken

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase an industrial gas stove, corn, pork rinds, firewood and other products.

loans.name: Yeredon  A Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  YEREDON  A sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FOH, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le sorgho  avec  SATOU debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte payer les frais de labour et les engrais  pour entretenir : 1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 155.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The YEREDON A group is made up of married women who are, on average, 33 years old.  These women also have an average of four children each and they all live in polygamous families in Foh, one of the villages of the Sikasso Cercle (third administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to pursue their farming activities during the rainy season.  This is their sixth loan with this institution, and all previous loans have been duly repaid.

The featured borrower, Satou, grows sorghum.  In the photo, she is in the middle of the standing row.  She plans to use her loan to pay for plowing and to buy fertilizers to cultivate 3.7 acres of land.  After the harvest, she sells her crop in her village and at the Sikasso market.  Her customers are both men and women. 

She is expecting to make an average profit of 155,000 CFA francs per farming season.  This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farming inputs and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Lupita

texts.es: Lupita tiene 33 años de edad, vive en su casa propia a lado de su esposo y sus dos hijos.Hace poco Lupita se enfermo gravemente por lo que tuvo que dejar de trabajar por un tiempo, siendo su principal actividad la venta de Pollos, actualmente se esta reponiendo de su enfermedad ,para volver a trabajar con el mismo entusiasmo que la caracteriza. Como una mujer trabajadora espera seguir con su trabajo y obtener mejores ingresos para su familia .Este el primer crédito con Kiva, por lo que agradece el apoyo económico recibido y se compromete a pagar sus deudas de manera puntual. Lupita, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de pollos para aperturar su puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Lupita is 33 and lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. Recently Lupita became seriously ill, so she had to stop working for a time; her main activity being the sale of chickens. Currently, she is recovering from her illness so that she can again work with the same enthusiasm that characterizes her.

As a hard working woman, she hopes to continue with her work and obtain better income for her family. This is her first loan with Kiva, so she is grateful for the financial support received and promises to pay her debts on time. Peter will invest the 1000 soles in the purchase of chickens so that she can open her sales stand.

loans.use: To buy chickens.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en:
Onesmus lives in the Mombasa area of Coast province, Kenya. He is married and has one child. He owns a transport business, which he has been operating for five years. He offers transport service to the residents of Mombasa through a three-wheeler.

He learned about Milango through a friend who invited him to the group, and he joined with an aim of accessing credit to improve the business operations. The challenge he is facing is high fuel costs.

Onesmus is applying for a loan of 99,100 Kenyan shillings to expand the business by buying a motorcycle and repairing the three-wheeler. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle and repair the three-wheeler.

loans.name: Stanslus

texts.en:
Stanslus is married. He and his wife have five children, and all of them attend school and are dependent on them. Stanslus has worked as a seller for five years. He says that it was difficult at first, but little by little, he got used to it with the help and support of his wife. He worked for other people for many years and then decided to start his own retail shop, which has gone very well for him because he is a friendly person. 

He is requesting this loan to buy sodas, juices, meat, flour, eggs and other supplies to stock up his stall and carry on selling.

loans.use: to buy sodas, juices, meat, flour, eggs and other supplies.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a businessman and lives in the Mombasa area. He sells buns, a business that he has run for the last five years. He is married and has three children.

Julius is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenyan shillings to buy food stock like flour and cooking oil and utensils for making the buns. He believes the business can pick up well enough to help provide for his family's needs and repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy food stock like flour and cooking oil and utensils to make buns.

loans.name: Norway Group

texts.en:
Asha, who is in her early 30s, is a married woman with three children who are in school. For a period of three years now, she has been running a retail shop business. She is doing fine with the business and her family also. She works from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit per month. 

This will be her fifth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy more shop foods, which she resold to more clients. She started a clothes-selling business (fabrics selling). She has paid back all her loans successfully. With the profits received, she bought a TV, fridge and radio and covered home expenses. She will use this loan to buy retail shop stock to resell. She dreams to improve her business.

She will share this loan with her loan group, Norway, which totals nine members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy retail shop stock to resell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married mother of four children. She runs a business dealing in the sale of cereals. The business has been in operation for 28 years. 

Mary was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy cereals for sale.

Mary believes she can save the extra income for the education of her children and grow from a retail to a wholesale business.

loans.use: To buy cereals for sale.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is from Kisauni and has been selling men’s and women’s clothing and accessories from a rented shop for two years.

She is a client of Yehu Microfinance, and has been for more than a year. Thanks to the help she has been receiving, she has been able to improve her business. Her dream is to be able to have her own shop someday, so that she can have a greater income.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy women’s clothing and accessories so she can sell them and continue to work.

loans.use: to buy women’s clothing and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock of coconuts, brooms, graters, etc., for sale.

loans.name: Munyazi

texts.en: Munyazi is grateful for the loan she previously received through Milango. Her business has picked up well and was able to generate the required repayments besides meeting her needs. She would like to improve on it and even set up other sources of income. She is asking for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy stock of paraffin for sale in a new business.

loans.use: To buy stock of paraffin for sale in a new business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy milk for sale and also increase the stock of fruits and vegetable.

loans.name: Kavumbi

texts.en:
Kavumbi, who is married, lives with her partner in the town of Kisauni. Her partner is a mason. She owns a food store, which is very well-known in the neighborhood. She mentions that she started her business with savings from her previous business, and then thanks to her work and sacrifice, her food store grew, and her business is now self-sufficient, using only the profits it returns. Kavumbi defines herself as a very hardworking person and someone who is very keen to get ahead and to better herself.

Kavumbi is asking for this loan to stock her store with baked goods, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and other supplies, which are the products that generate the biggest profits. With these products, she will be able to meet demand as well as improve her income.

loans.use: to stock her store with baked goods, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and other supplies.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina's grocery business is on the increase in terms of the income generated from it. She has been able to provide education to her children through it and now looks forward to increasing the stock to realize more income. She has also been able to set up a transport business, owning a motorcycle.

She is applying for a loan of 107,300 Kenya shillings to buy new stock of fruits and vegetables for sale. She hopes to meet the repayments through the two sources of income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Tujikomboe Kitopeni Group

texts.en:
Amina, who is in her late 30s, is a married woman with two kids who are in school. For one year and six months now, she has been running a business selling charcoal. She does well in this project. She works from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. daily and is able to make a good profit per month.

This will be her first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy more sacks of charcoal. She dreams to own a big charcoal store. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, Tujikomboe Kitopeni, which totals 10 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fruits, gunny bags, boxes, poly bags etc for sale..

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is from Kisauni. She makes a living buying and selling women's, men's and children's clothing. She is married. Her husband is also a businessman who sells spare auto parts. Margaret and her husband live together in their own house along with their three children. Margaret is a very hardworking woman with very good references. She has been working in this business for eight years.

Margaret is requesting this loan to buy rain clothing, since the rainy season is upon her and she wants to offer a better variety of clothing to her customers. She is very grateful for this opportunity and notes that it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy rain clothing to sell.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is grateful to Milango for the development her family has gone through due to the access of funds. She has been able to improve her retail shop and now desires to increase the level of stock in it to raise the income.

Amina is applying for a loan of 31,450 KES to buy retail stock like sugar, flour, milk etc for sale in the shop. She also looks forward to setting up other outlets in the future.

loans.use: To buy retail stock like sugar, flour, milk etc .

loans.name: Irma Isabel

texts.es:
Irma, posee una panadería para obtener ingresos y con ello aportar para los gastos del hogar. Ella tiene 51 años de edad y vive en casa propia, está casada y tiene dos hijos de 20  y 25 años de edad; el oficio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia y lleva cinco años de gozar  del negocio, esta actividad la realiza de lunes a sábado de 7:00 am a 3:00 pm.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar productos para realizar el pan tales como: harina, levadura,  azúcar, aceite, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara para invertir en su negocio, aumentar la producción y los ingresos.
Su sueño es mejorar económicamente y así ayudarles a sus hijos para que en el futuro tengan una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Irma has a bread shop to make a living and, with it, she can pay her household bills.  Irma is 51 years old and lives in her own house.  She is married and has two children, aged 20 and 25 years old.  She learned her trade on her own and she has now had the business for five years.  Irma works Monday to Saturday from 7am until 3pm.

Irma's loan will allow her to buy ingredients, such as flour, yeast, sugar, oil and more, for making bread.  This investment will help her to invest in her business and increase her production and income.

Irma's dream is to improve her financial situation and to help her children so that they can study at university in the future.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, sugar, oil and more.

loans.name: María Licida

texts.es: María de sesenta y cinco años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus hijos quienes le ayudan en el gasto del hogar, ella tiene una venta de tortillas y es muy conocida, pues vende las tortillas más ricas y calientitas del lugar, su negocio está ubicado cerca de un colegio por lo tanto tiene mucha clientela pues a la salida de los estudiantes los padres aprovechan llevar el complemento de sus comidas, María es una mujer trabajadora y siempre aprovecha las oportunidades que se le presentan, ella solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maíz por mayor. María tiene la seguridad que así como en financiamientos anteriores podrá responder a cada una de los pagos, y además tiene fe que con ardua labor podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: María is 75 years old and lives with her partner and children who help her with household costs.  María sells tortillas and is well-known as they are the warmest and most delicious in town.  María's business is near a school so she receives a lot of business at the end of the school day when parents come for something for their children.  María is hard-working and always grabs a hold of the opportunities that she is given. She is applying for a loan from Integral to buy corn in bulk.  María is confident that, as with previous loans, she will be able to make all her repayments and she has faith that, with hard work, she will be able to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the hundredweight.

loans.name: Myagmarjav

texts.en: Myagmarjav is 27 years old and lives with his wife and 3 daughters in Ger in the Uvs province of Mongolia. He got a job at local private company. His wife still runs a tailor service at home and takes care of their daughters. Myagmarjav is planning to run the taxi service during his off-duty time to increase his family's income. He is a diligent and hardworking man. He is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a second hand car to start his taxi service business in town. He also drives his daughters to school and kindergarten on the way to work in the mornings, while his wife is busy with her tailoring business at home.

loans.use: to purchase a second hand car to start his taxi service business in town

loans.name: Yeredon  B Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  YEREDON  B sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FOH, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le sorgho  avec  AFOU debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et les engrais  pour entretenir : 1,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 150.000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Yeredon B group are married women with an average age of 31 and, on average, 4 children, who all live in polygamous families in Foh, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 6th loan from the institution and their previous loans have been correctly repaid.

Afou, standing in the middle of the picture, grows sorghum. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds needed for the cultivation of 1.5 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the produce will be sold in her village and at the Sikasso market to a clientèle composed of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 150 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Alice Madeleine

texts.fr: Alice est une femme de 34 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 2 et 12 ans.Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais (maniocs, plantains, noix de palmes et fruits) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis 16 ans. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter   son stock  pour mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille
texts.en: Alice is a 34-year-old woman who is married and the mother of 4 children aged between 2 and 12 years old. She is a merchant and has been selling seasonal fresh food (cassava, plantains, coconuts and fruit) retail at a local market for 16 years.
