She knows the suppliers well and knows her clientèle, built up over time thanks to her experience in her line of work, especially well. However, she is constantly suffering from stock shortages because, due to her small amount of capital, she is forced to sell all of her inventory in order to be able to buy more. She would like to increase her stock in order to be able to better satisfy the constant demand of her customers and to avoid stock shortages. She will save her profits so that she can not only grow her business but also provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to increase her inventory of merchandise.

loans.name: Yeredon  C Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  YEREDON  C sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à FOH, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : le sorgho  avec  MAIMOUNA debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter les semences et les engrais  pour entretenir : 0,75 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 55 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Yeredon C group are married women with an average age of 31 and, on average, 5 children, who all live in polygamous families in Foh, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to be able to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 6th loan from the institution. Their previous loans have been properly repaid.

Maimouna, standing in the middle of the picture, grows sorghum. She plans to use her loan to buy seeds and fertilizer needed for the cultivation of 0.75 hectares of farmland. After the harvest, the produce is sold in her village and at the Sikasso market to a clientèle made up of men and women. She expects to make an average profit of 55 000 francs per crop cycle. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to support her husband with the daily living expenses.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
la señora Maria Isa-bel tiene una venta en uno de los parques de chinandega desde hace 7 años ella cuida los bayos del parque y a la vez ahí puso su venta donde vende  productos de primera necesidad, y bisuterías,

Maria Isabel es madre de 4 hijos ninguno depende de ella , anteriormente trabajaba como maestra en honduras y  decidió ahorrar para venirse a Nicaragua a trabajar y poner su propio negocio, el esposo de ella le ayuda con los gastos ya que el también tiene su negocio y entre los dos sacan adelante el hogar.  es una señora que le gusta trabajar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Maria Isabel has been running a general store in one of the parks in Chinandega for seven years.  She takes care of the park's berry trees and also established her salespoint there of essential items and trinkets.

Maria Isabel is the mother of four children who depend on her.  She used to work as a teacher in Honduras but decided to save to go to Nicaragua to work and set up her own business.  Her husband helps cover expenses since he also has a business, so they share in providing for the household.  She is someone who enjoys working and getting ahead.

loans.use: To buy trinkets, juice, sodas, disposable diapers, sanitary napkins, paper towels.

loans.name: Ana Jacoba

texts.es:
La señora Ana Jacoba, es una persona trabajadora, emprendedora y responsable con sus obligaciones labora diario desde las seis de la mañana hasta las cinco  de la tarde, los siete días de la semana en su negocio venta de comida, en especial tacos y enchiladas en uno de los mercados capitalinos, ella trabaja junto a su hijas. 

Solicita el  préstamo para invertir en capital de trabajo, para la  compra de verduras y perecederos. Esto con el propósito de incrementar su negocio.

 Agradece  a  Ceprodel y Kiva, por la oportunidad y la confianza depositada en ella, por lo que este crédito lo invertirá en su negocio  de forma que esto le permitirá llevar el sustento a su hogar  e ir mejorando su condición de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Jacoba is a hard-working, responsible entrepreneur who works every day from 6:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., seven days a week.  She and her daughters sell food, especially tacos and enchiladas, in one of the capital markets.

She is requesting a loan to use as working capital to buy vegetables and perishable foods, with an aim toward increasing her business.

She is grateful to Ceprodel and Kiva for the opportunity and confidence shown in her.  By investing the loan in her business she will be able to support her household and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and perishable foods.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El señor José  de 56 años, vive en su casa de habitación ubicada en una comunidad del San Lorenzo, Valle en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica a la venta de pescado y camarón en diferentes comunidades donde vive.
Don José sus ventas son de lunes a domingo, sus clientes son todas las personas que visita y que le visitan también. 
Don José está solicitando  el préstamo para comprar una red de pesca ya que las que tiene ya están dañadas y así no puede pescar porque los peces se le salen.
Don José su sueño es comprarse una lancha más grande para cargar mas pescados.
 
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril  del 2013.
texts.en:
José, 56, lives in the community of San Lorenzo, a valley in southern Honduras.  He works as a fisherman and sells fish and shrimp to different communities around where he lives.  He works from Monday to Sunday and his customers are people who he visits or who visit him.

José is requesting a loan to buy a fishing net since the one he has is in disrepair and allows the fish to get away.  His dream is to buy a bigger boat so he can catch more fish.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April, 2013

loans.use: To buy a fishing net for his business.

loans.name: Maria Petronila

texts.es: Doña maria de 47 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos en casa rpopia, es comerciante de frutas y verduras. tiene su negocio desde hace 3 años eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para poder tener su negocio, vende en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia tiene mucha clientela pues vende a buen precio sus frutas y verduras, maria solicita un prestamo para poder comprar platanos, naranjas, papas, guineos, y todo lo que necesita para acrecentar su negocio y asi tener sus clientes satisfechos cuando la busquen para comprarle sus productos y ella prodra tener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a darle a su familia una mejor vida.
texts.en: Maria is 47 years old. She lives with her husband and three children in a house she owns. She is a fruit and vegetable seller. She has had her business for 3 years and that has given her the necessary experience to be able to run it. She sells in the market that is close to her home. She has a lot of customers because she sells her fruit and vegetables at a good price. Maria is asking for a loan to be able to buy bananas, oranges, potatoes, plantains, and everything she needs to grow her business. This way, she will have satisfied customers when they come to her to buy her products. She will be able to have better profits that will help her give her family a good life.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions, tomatoes, bananas, pineapples, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a solar panel for her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, manure, etc.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria nació en la ciudad de Puno pero vive en la ciudad de Salvación.  (La ciudad de Salvación está ubicada en el distrito del Manu en la provincia de Manu dentro del departamento de Madre de Dios, Perú). 

Gregoria tiene 59 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos, ella es una madre trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante su familia y su actividad económica principal es la venta de helados de diferentes sabores. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio y ve la muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Tesoritos del Manu” y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, saborizantes y otras cosas más.  Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Gregoria was born in the city of Puno, but she now lives in the city of Salvación, which is located in the district and province of Manu in the province of Madre de Dios, Peru.

Gregoria, 59, is in a common-law marriage from which she has five children. She is a hardworking and enterprising mother who provides for her family. Her main business activity is the sale of ice cream in various flavors. She has already been in this business for several years, and it is going very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work. She belongs to the "Tesoritos del Manu" communal bank. 

On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy ingredients such as sacks of rice, flavoring, and other items. She appreciates and values this loan and she is committed to paying her monthly installments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sacks of sugar, flavoring, and other items.

location.town: Salvacion - Manu - Manu - Madre de Dios

loans.name: Godom

texts.fr: Godom est un jeune homme  de 26 ans commerçant. il fait la vente en détail de la viande depuis 5 ans dans un marché de la capitale. Il a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'il a acquis au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Il a juste un problème lié à la petitesse de son capital qui l'oblige à acheter en petite quantités d'où la rupture permanente de son stock et l'insatisfaction de ses clients. c'est pour cela qu'il sollicite ce crédit  pour avoir un bon stock ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Il économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Godom is a young 26-year-old man who is a merchant. He has been selling meat retail for 5 years at a market in the capital. He knows the suppliers well and knows his clientèle, built up over time thanks to his experience in his line of work, especially well. He just has a problem owing to his limited capital which forces him to buy his merchandise in small amounts, resulting in constant stock shortages and dissatisfied customers. He is therefore requesting this loan in order to have a good inventory which will enable him to better satisfy the constant demand of his customers and to avoid stock shortages. He will save his profits so that he can not only develop his business but also provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to increase his stock of beef.

loans.name: Mercedes Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Mercedes, madre de familia siempre preocupada por el bienestar de la familia, quien continúa con su único medio de ingresos la venta de fritanga y apoyo de la pensión de su esposo con lo que hace posible cubrir parte de los gastos del hogar y de los niños. Este crédito que solicita es para seguir invirtiendo en mejorar la infraestructura de su casa que va poco a poco, en esta ocasión construirá un cuarto para sus hijos aprovechando un espacio libre en donde ya hay una pared recomenzada lo cual le facilitaría la construcción.
texts.en:
Mercedes is a mother who is concerned about her family's well-being.  She continues to earn a living selling fast food and with the support of her husband's pension is able to cover part of the household expenses.  

The loan she is requesting is to improve the infrastructure of her home little by little.  She would like to build a room for her children by taking advantage of a free space where one wall is already built.

loans.use: To buy cement, sand, iron and blocks.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es: Doña ana tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas desde hace 8 años tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy amable con sus clientes, trabaja de lunes a domingo  al mediodía y por la noche, con las ganancias que obtiene de su trabajo logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña ana esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar maíz por quintales para seguir con su negocio de venta de tortillas y asi darle a su familia una mejor vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Ana has had a business selling tortillas for 8 years. She has a lot of customers because she is very friendly to her customers. She works Monday through Sunday from noon until night. With the profits from her work she is able to cover some household expenses. Ana is asking for a loan to be able to buy quintals of corn to be able to continue with her business and give her family a better life without limitations.

loans.use: to buy corn wholesale.

loans.name: Dúo Amor De Los Amores Group

texts.es:
DUO AMOR DE LOS AMORES
Doña Teresa, es originaria de tecpan, tiene 46 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad estan sus 2 hijos menores de edad, ella  se dedica a la compra y venta de laurel y a la crianza de animales.
Desde hace algunos años ella ha empezado con esta actividad porque es el medio que tiene para salir adelante con su familia, gracias al apoyo de sus hijos ella sigue adelante con su negocio.
El sueño de ella es ampliar más su negocio para obtener mas ganancias y mandar a sus hijos a la escuela, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de Laurel para la venta ya que por medio de su negocio sus hijos podran tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Amor de los Amores Duo

Teresa, 46, is originally from Tecpan and has her two children under her care. She makes a living buying and selling laurel and raising animals.

She started this business several years ago because it is how she provides for her family. Thanks to the support of her children, she continues to move forward with her business. Her dream is to expand her business to have higher earnings and send her children to school. 

She is applying for this loan to buy laurel, which she will then sell. Through this business, her children will be able to have a better future.

loans.use: to buy laurel for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Mabel

texts.es: Doña rosa de 38 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijas en casa propia, es una mujer muy responsable, trabajadora y honrada, trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan dulce y pan frances, sale a venderlo por la colonia donde ella reside, doña Rosa solicita un préstamo para invertir en la compra de harina, manteca, latas y todo lo necesario para poder producir más. Este proyecto de mejoramiento para su panadería es muy importante para ella puesto que así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa, 38, lives with her husband and two daughters in a house they own. She is a very responsible, hardworking and honest woman who has her own bakery, where she makes sweet bread and baguettes. She sells the bread in the neighborhood where she lives.

Mrs. Rosa is requesting a loan to buy flour, shortening, molds and all that is necessary to produce more. This improvement project for her bakery is very important for her, since it will improve her and her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shortening, flour, yeast and other supplies for her bakery.

loans.name: Ramongwende Group

texts.fr:
Mme BLANDINE représente le groupe RAMONGWENDE. Mariée, elle est mère de 03enfants. Le plus âgé a 10ans et le moins âgé a 06ans. 02 vont à l’école. 
Mme vend des légumes depuis 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Toecin. Ses clients sont les femmes.
Elle veut s’acheter 17boites de tomate et 03 cartons de poisson frais.  
Mme veut épargner ses bénéfices. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique et mieux s’occuper  de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. BLANDINE is the featured borrower of RAMONGWENDE Group. She's married and the mother of three children. The eldest is 10, the youngest is 6 years old. Both attend school.

Mrs. BLANDINE has been selling vegetables for seven years. She gets her supplies in Toecin and her customers are women. She wants to buy 17 cans of tomatoes and 3 boxes of fresh fish.

She wants to put away her profits. She ambitions to open a shop and to take better care of her children.

loans.use: to buy 17 cans of tomatoes and 3 boxes of fresh fish

loans.name: Assana

texts.fr: Assana est une femme âgée de 52 ans. Elle est veuve et mère de 03 enfants qui sont âgés de 30,27 et 24ans. Assana travaille comme revendeuse depuis 1983. Elle vend des tissus pour tous clients dans un marché de la ville de Lomé. Ses achats se font à Lomé et elle est aidée par 01 personne. Au moment, sa difficulté principale est de ne pouvoir pas satisfaire toutes les demandes. Assana a requis son second crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des coupons de soie et de popeline. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. Dans les prochaines années, Assana voudrait agrandir la taille de l’activité en devenant grossiste.
texts.en:
Assana, age 52, is a widow and the mother of three children, aged 30, 27 and 24. She's been working as a reseller since 1983. She sells fabrics to a diverse clientele in one of Lomé's markets.

She gets her supplies in Lomé and has one person to help her. At this time, her main difficulty is being unable to meet customer demand.

Assana is seeking her second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy bolts of silk and poplin. She wants to reinvest in her business.

In the forthcoming years, she would like to expand her business by becoming a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy bolts of silk and poplin

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy retail stock like sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: Charo

texts.en:
Charo is a married man, and his main source of income is selling firewood. He is currently living near the town of Kisauni. Charo has been selling firewood for more than 11 years and has a well-established group of customers who place orders with him. As a result, he is managing to make progress.

Charo is requesting this loan to buy firewood as he has a special offer that will enable him to make more profits and continue helping his family. He is grateful for the opportunity that he is receiving as it will not only benefit him but also his family.

loans.use: to buy firewood

loans.name: Zinabou

texts.fr: Zinabou vit avec ses 03 enfants à Lomé. Le plus jeune âgé de 21ans seul est encore scolarisé. Âgée de 47ans, Zinabou revend des ignames, du mais et du haricot à domicile. Afin de mieux satisfaire les demandes des clients, Zinabou sollicite son second prêt à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Elle espère réinvestir dans l’activité et aider ses enfants à mieux s’épanouir. Elle a une ancienneté de 08ans.
texts.en:
Zinabou, age 47, lives in Lomé with her three children. The youngest is 21 and is the only one who still attends school. Zinabou has been selling yams, corn, and beans at her home for eight years.

In order to better meet customer demand, she's seeking a second loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to replenish her stock. She hopes to reinvest in her business and help her children to blossom more.

loans.use: to buy yams, corn, and beans

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is married to a businessman who also helps her run the business. They buy, package and sell hardwood charcoal. At first, Amina used to buy the charcoal already packaged. But she was able to expand the storage area, and she can now store up to 15,000 kg of charcoal. She buys bags and polyurethane, packages the charcoal and sells to small businesses in the zone. She sells from a small cart.

Amina needs this loan to buy charcoal because the number of customers is increasing and she needs to increase the amount of charcoal to meet their demands. Her greatest desire is to provide an education for her children so that she can guarantee them a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy charcoal

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is married and has three children who live with her. All of her children attend school and help her with household chores. Mercy is a merchant. She lives in Kisauni, where she has a small, well-stocked grocery store. She provides her neighbors and occasional other customers with all kinds of items of daily use for the home, such as sugar, rice, milk, a variety of drinks and other products.

Mercy is requesting a loan to buy these products and increase the stock in her store so that she can improve her family’s income and their quality of life.

She is an established client with Yehu Microfinance who has shown herself to be a very enterprising and hardworking woman who works hard for the well-being of her family. She also works to continue growing as a small business owner each day and as a leader of her family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, milk, a variety of drinks and other products to increase the stock in her store

loans.name: Dama

texts.en:
Dama has made a living in sales for years. She has a well-stocked charcoal store and is requesting a Kiva loan again. The previous one helped her a lot to be able to continue growing, improve her business and give her customers enough product.

She wants to be able to buy 20 sacks of charcoal to continue stocking her business and growing as a small business.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is married and has two adult children. She has a stand that she bought with much effort where she sells clothes. She stocks her business with various clothes for adults and children and supports her family with the income. She will use the loan to buy various clothes like shirts, skirts and blouses to attract more customer attention and purchases.

loans.use: to buy various clothes like shirts, skirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice makes a living selling charcoal. Thanks to her previous Kiva loan, she has been able to continue with her business. She is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to her business and to supporting her family. Her husband also helps out with household expenses as he is able.

Thanks to her previous loan, Eunice has expanded and improved her overall business, as well as the quality of her products. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal for resale. She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: To purchase 20 sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr: Coiffeuse et revendeuse de mèches, tissages et défrisant dans une baraque, yawavi est mariée à un plombier et est mère de famille. Son premier crédit qu’elle sollicite à WAGES lui permettra d’acheter des marchandises et de satisfaire au mieux au besoin des clients. Elle espère réinvestir dans l’activité et mieux éduquer ses enfants.
texts.en:
Yawavi is a hairdresser and who also resells hair extensions, weaves, and hair straightener in a small shop. She's married to a plumber and the mother of a family.

She's seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGEs, in order to buy products and meet customer demand the best she can. She hopes to reinvest in her business and better educate her children.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, weaves, and other products

loans.name: Moussiliou

texts.fr: Agé de 42 ans, Moussiliou vit dans un village lacustre du Bénin. Moussiliou est marié à Adidjatou, une marchande. Le couple a huit enfants dont certains scolarisés. En plus de leurs enfants, le couple a deux autres enfants à sa charge. Le couple vit avec leurs enfants. Moussiliou assure ensemble avec sa femme les diverses charges de la maison. Moussiliou a très peu fréquenté l'école. Pour répondre aux besoins de sa famille, Moussiliou vend du sable lagunaire qu'il extrait des lagunes depuis six ans environ. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Moussiliou sollicite pour la troisième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Ce crédit lui servira à acquérir une machine pour renforcer ses équipements ; ce qui lui de rehausser le niveau des ventes de sable lagunaire. Les crédits précédemment obtenus ont tous été bien remboursés.
texts.en: 42-year-old Moussiliou lives in a lakeside village in Benin. Moussiliou is married to Adidjatou, a merchant. The couple have 8 children, some of whom go to school. As well their own children, the couple are raising 2 more. The couple live with their children. Moussiliou covers the various household expenses, together with his wife. Moussiliou did not get much schooling. In order to be able to meet his family's needs, Moussiliou sells lagoon sand which he has been extracting from lagoons for about 6 years. In order to satisfy his customer demand, Moussiliou is requesting financial support from ALIDé for the 3rd time. This loan will allow him to buy a machine and upgrade his equipment, which will enable him to increase his sales of lagoon sand. All of the loans previously received have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy equipment with which to extract lagoon sand.

loans.name: Midoukpo 1 Group

texts.fr: MIDOUKPO 1 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres sont des amis et appartiennent à même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, nommée Jacqueline est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Jacqueline est âgée de 53 ans. Jacqueline est mariée à un certain Grégoire. Le couple n’a pas d’enfant. Pour subvenir à ses besoins, Jacqueline vend du poisson depuis trente cinq ans. Jacqueline s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Jacqueline s’associe avec les autres membres du groupe MIDOUKPO 1 pour consentir un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: Midoukpo 1 is a group of 3 people whose members are friends and belong to the same mutual savings group. The group's representative, Jacqueline, is the one with her hand raised in the picture. Jacqueline is 53 years old. Jacqueline is married to Grégroire. The couple do not have children. In order to meet her needs, Jacqueline has been selling fish for 35 years. Jacqueline gets her supplies at a market in Benin. Jacqueline is teaming up with the other members of the Midoukpo 1 group to request a 5th loan from ALIDé, in order to strengthen her business and satisfy her customer demand. The previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Gbenonkpo 12 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONKPO 12  est composé de trois personnes qui vivent dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mahoussi est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mahoussi est âgée de 56 ans. Mahoussi n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Mahoussi est mariée à un certain Jean. Le couple a un enfant qui n’est pas scolarisé et est à leur charge. Mahoussi vit avec son enfant et son mari. Mahoussi assiste son mari dans les charges familiales.  Pour ce faire, Mahoussi vend des ustensiles de cuisine(glacières, des assiettes et des bassines en aluminiums) depuis une vingtaine d’années. Mahoussi s’approvisionne dans un un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Mahoussi sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONKPO 12, un  septième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The Gbenonkpo 12 group is made up of 3 people who live in the same district. The group's representative, Mahoussi, is the woman with her hand raised in the picture. Mahoussi is 56 years old. Mahoussi did not go to school. Mahoussi is married to Jean. The couple are raising one child who does not attend school. Mahoussi lives with her child and her husband. Mahoussi supports her husband with the family expenditures. In order to do this, Mahoussi has been selling kitchen utensils (coolers, plates and aluminium basins) for around 20 years. Mahoussi gets her supplies at a market in Benin. With a view to satisfying her customers and increasing her sales and revenues, Mahoussi is requesting, together with the other Gbenonkpo 12 group members, a 7th loan from ALIDé. The previous loans have been correctly repaid.

loans.use: to buy kitchen utensils (coolers and aluminium basins).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, blocks

loans.name: Gulrukhon

texts.ru: Гулрухон 37-летняя замужняя женщина.У нее четверо детей. Она вместе с семьей проживает в районе Файзабад. У нее среднее образование. Гулрухон работает продавщицей. На рынке района у нее имеется собственный магазин, где она продает продукты питания, такие как булочки, различные виды печенье, фруктовые соки, прохладительные напитки и т.д. Она занимается торговлей в течение восьми лет. Гулрухон опытная продавщица. Она обслуживает своих клиентов качественно и относится к ним доброжелательно. Сейчас Гулрухон хочет увеличить товарооборот. Она берет кредит для приобретения ассортимента товара (продуктов питания).
texts.en: Gulrukhon is a 37 year-old married woman wiith four children. She lives with her family in Faizabad. SHe has a high school education. Gulrukhon works as a retail vendor. She has her own store at the district market where she sell grocery products such as buns, various types of cookies, fruit juices, cold drinks, etc. She has been a retailer for eight years; she has a lot of experience. She provides quality service to her customers and treats them well. Now Gulrukhon wants to increase her sales turnover. She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of grocery (food) products.

loans.use: to buy a variety of grocery (food) products to increase sales

loans.name: Essohanam

texts.fr: Mr Essohanam vit avec sa femme à Lomé. Âgé de 35ans, il revend dans un marché de la place des habits (friperies) et est aidée par 02 personnes. Pour mieux satisfaire les besoins des clients, Essohanam sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des marchandises. Comme perspectives d'avenir, Essohanam veut agrandir son commercer tout en prenant soin de la famille.
texts.en: Essohanam lives with his wife in Lomé. 35 years of age, he resells second-hand clothing at a local market and has help from 2 people. In order to be better able to satisfy his customers' needs, Essohanam is requesting his first loan from WAGES with which to buy merchandise. His future goals include expanding his business whilst taking care of his family.

loans.use: to buy second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Shamsullo

texts.ru: Шамсулло житель Файзабадского района, расположенный в 60 км восточнее города Душанбе. Ему 35 лет. Он женат и является отцом троих детей. Шамсулло работает в сфере торговли в течение 5 лет. Он занимается продажей продуктов питания в собственном магазине, который находится на рынке района. Шамсулло продает такие виды продуктов как: печенье, детское питание, консервированные продукты, фруктовые соки и т.д. Кредит берет для приобретения ассортимента товара (продуктов питания) с целью увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en: Shamsullo lives in Faizabad, which is located 60 kilometers east of Dushanbe. He is 35, married, and is the father of three. Shamsullo has been working in retail for 5 years. He sells groceries in his own store at the district market. Shamsullo sells products such as cookies, children's drinks, preserves, fruit juices, etc. He is requesting a loan to buy an assortment of grocery (food) products with the goal if increasing sales.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of grocery (food) products with the goal if increasing sales.

loans.name: Agbessi

texts.fr: Agbessi vit avec son conjoint maçon carreleur et leurs trois enfants de 07 ans, 02ans et 03mois à Lomé. Seul l’ainé va pour le moment à l’école. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, Agbessi revend du pure water et des produits divers dans une boutique depuis 2003. Avec son second crédit qu’elle sollicite de WAGES, elle espère acheter un congélateur, de pure water et des médicaments. Elle espère agrandir son activité tout en assurant une bonne éducation à la famille.
texts.en: Agbessi lives in Lomé with her spouse, a bricklayer and tiler, and their 3 children aged 7 years, 2 years and 3 months. Currently, only the eldest child attends school. In order to support her spouse with the household expenses, Agbessi has been selling "Pure" water and various other products in a shop since 2003. She hopes to use the second loan she is requesting from WAGES in order to buy a cooler, some "Pure" water and some medicine. She wishes to grow her business whilst also ensuring that her family gets a good education.

loans.use: to buy sachets of "Pure" water and medicine.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Revendeuse de produits d’alimentation générale dans une boutique, Adjo âgée de 41ans sollicite son troisième crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Comme perspectives d avenir, elle voudrait aider sa famille et assurer la pérennité de son activité. Elle a démarré en 1996, maman de 02 enfants de 17 et 10ans qui sont scolarisés.
texts.en: Adjo, who is 41 years old and sells grocery products in a shop, is requesting her 3rd loan from WAGES in order to buy more merchandise. Her future goals include supporting her family whilst ensuring the sustainability of her business, which she started in 1996. She is the mother of 2 children, aged 17 and 10, who both attend school.

loans.use: to buy grocery products.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: Ахмаду 48 лет. Он женат и у него семеро детей. Ахмад со своей семьей живет на юго-западной части Таджикистана в районе Вахш. Ахмад образованный мужчина. Он по специальности экономист. Ахмад работал по профессии 16 лет. Одновременно он занимается растениеводством. В ведении сельского хозяйства ему помогает семья. Он занимается посевами овощей. Ахмад этой сфере посвятил 25 лет своей жизни. Он любит свое дело, его деятельность приносит дополнительный доход, и помогает ему поддерживать быт. Ахмад берет кредит для закупа минерального удобрения для урожая помидора и огурцов.
texts.en: Ahmad is 48, married, and has seven children. He lives with his family in Vakhsh, in the southwestern part of Tajikistan. Ahmad is a well-educated and is a trained economist. He has worked professionally for 16 years. At the same time he farms on the side, and his family has been helping him with the agricultural work. He mainly grows vegetables, and has been doing this type of work for 25 years. He loves his business; it brings him additional income and helps him to maintain their way of life. Ahmad is requesting a loan to buy mineral fertilizer for growing tomatoes and cucumbers.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizer for growing tomatoes and cucumbers

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.en:
Blanca is a Kubo.financiero borrower. This is her story:

My name is Blanca Estela, I´m 28 years old and work selling cosmetics and candies.
After finishing elementary school, I started working to support my family. I have been selling cosmetics for the last five years and three months ago began to sell candies also.

I´d like to share with you, that I have been happily married for 12 years. We have two beautiful sons ages 7 and 2. I also have 5 brothers, all of them are married. Both my parents died, which made me a very strong person and at the same time value everything that I have. My husband Javier drives a taxi, so we both bring income to support or family.

I have a small local where I sell candies. Occasionally I go selling door to door or outside of schools.  I stoped selling cosmetics five months ago, because I didnt have money to buy inventory, but now I want to get back to selling cosmetics because I already have some recurring clients, but I will continue to sell candies. I will use the loan to buy cosmetics and candies, that way I will be able to increase sales and benefit my family. 

My biggest business accomplishments have been able to buy a car and start a small business.

loans.use: to buy candies and cosmetics that she will sell door to door.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Hervé Julien

texts.fr: Hervé est un homme de 35 ans, célibataire et père de 2 enfants. il possède et gère un cybercafé dans un quartier de la ville depuis 5 ans. il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter une photocopieuse afin d'augmenter ses ventes et ses profits. les bénéfices générés vont lui permettre d’accroître son activité à travers l'achat de nouveau matériel d'une part et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille d'autre part
texts.en: Hervé Julien is a 35-year-old man who is single and the father of 2 children. He has owned and run a cybercafé in a district of town for 5 years. He is requesting this loan in order to buy a photocopier so that he can increase his sales and profits. The profits generated will enable him to both expand his business by creating sales of new material and provide for his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela is a Kubo.financiero borrower. This is her story:

My name is Estela, I am a 45 years old single mother. I live with relatives in a house in Santa Martha Acatitla.

I finished high school and then started working, I have owned the store for the last 15 years, it is a store located in my house, where I sell different products such as: stationary, gifts, and candy. A little bit of everything.My niece started the business, but she had to stop working, so I bought it from here, that was 15 years ago.The store is called "El Arbolito" which means "Little Tree.", my slogan is the client comes first.

I will use the money to buy merchandise and get ready for the back to school season, which for me is the best of the year. I consider myself credit worthy, I pay my loans on time and like to honor my commitments.

My biggest challenge is to being able to provide my son with stability and send him to school.

loans.use: To buy stationary inventory and get ready for the back to school season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to improve on the shop floor and to increase the stock of food and drinks.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce has children who are in high school. She sells firewood from her home in the Kisauni neighborhood of Mombasa.

Thanks to her work, Joyce has been able to provide her children an education and to buy everything she needs for her home. Joyce has always demonstrated a good payment history. This is the second loan she has requested from Yehu Microfinance. She wants to buy firewood so that she can restock her business and offer more variety to her customers.

loans.use: to buy firewood.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia has made a living in sales for more than 3 years. She has a well-stocked retail store and is requesting a Kiva loan again. The previous one helped her a lot to be able to continue growing, improving her business, and giving her customers a good selection.

She wants to be able to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants, lingerie, etc. to continue stocking her business and growing as a small businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants, lingerie, etc.

loans.name: Viim Kom Group

texts.fr:
Mme TATIANA est la responsable du groupe VII KOM. Mariée, elle est mère de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 20ans et le moins âgé a 17ans. Les  02 vont à l’école. Elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme vend des habits  depuis 2001 soit 12ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10. Ses clients sont  les femmes, les hommes et les enfants.
Mme veut s’acheter 10 complets pagnes.
Elle veut réinvestir ses bénéfices dans son activité.  Mme ambitionne construire sa parcelle.
texts.en: Tatiana is the leader of the VII Kom group. She is married and the mother of 2 children. The eldest is 20 years old and the youngest is 17. Both of them go to school. She is also responsible for 4 more people. She has been selling clothes since 2001, that is, 12 years. She gets her supplies at a market in Sector 10. Her customers are women, men and children. She would like to buy 10 sets of pagnes (highly colourful and decorative West African clothing). She wants to reinvest the profits in her business. She aims to build on her plot of land.

loans.use: to buy 10 sets of pagnes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover maintenance repairs to his semi-trailer truck, fuel, insurance coverage for incidentals and to begin a cash flow.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence says that her store is a big help in the financial support of the home, since through this work and that of her husband they have been able to educate their children and give them what they need. She said that her dream is to have a larger commercial facility so she can obtain more customers and increase her earnings.

She is asking for a loan in order to invest in wheat flour and maize flour stock in bulk as well as other supplies for her home-based store. This will help her to continue selling and providing her customers with what they are looking for.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour and maize flour stock in bulk as well as other supplies for her home-based store.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is a very hardworking person. He says that he has a very good clientele because he always offers his customers a good variety and good quality in his products. That is why business is going so well for him.

Martin is requesting the loan in order to invest in his business. He wants to stock up with foodstuff like vegetables, fruit, noodles, rice, sugar and other items. He is grateful for the opportunity that is being given to him by Yehu Micro-finance and Kiva.

loans.use: buy vegetables, fruit, noodles, rice, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Zawadi

texts.en:
Zawadi makes a living cooking and selling delicious food in her restaurant and, thanks to her previous Kiva loan, she has been able to continue with her business. She is a very hardworking woman who is dedicated to her business and to supporting her family. 

Thanks to her previous loan, Zawadi has expanded and improved her overall business as well as the quality of her products. She plans to use the support from this loan to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, starch, yeast, eggs and other ingredients for making her delicious food. She is very grateful for this opportunity.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, wheat flour, starch, yeast, eggs and other ingredients for making her delicious food.

loans.name: Lazaro

texts.en:
Lazaro is married to a businesswoman and they have four children, all of whom attend school.

Little by little Lazaro began increasing his sales since he himself goes out to offer his products in the zone. He sells mostly clothing for women and children, like blouses, shorts, undergarments, t-shirts and sweatshirts. One of his great dreams is to have his own store in Kisauni. He is asking for a loan to purchase seasonal clothing. This will help him greatly with his sales.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing for women and children.

loans.name: Jon

texts.en:
Artboy Designs is a start-up sole proprietorship owned and operated by Jon. The company was referred to Accion Texas Inc. by Keith Frazier, one of the organization’s board members.  

Artboy is a “green” interior design business in Houston that focuses primarily on high-end commercial and residential clients. The business is promoted through its website, advertising booklets, and beautiful business cards. A $5,450 loan helped Jon pay for his marketing materials.  

He has 10 years of experience in the industry, which helped him establish a broad network of past clients in the Houston area. As his business becomes more established, Jon plans to hire employees. But for now, he is a “one-man show” – with high hopes of success. For more information on Artboy Designs, visit http://www.artboydesigns.com/.

loans.use: to market his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, iron bars, bricks and sand to build a wall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cement and drinks for resale

loans.name: Bianca

texts.en:
With their combined skills and expertise, Bianca and her fiancé created Wavvy Barber and Beauty Salon, a full-service, family-oriented barber shop and beauty salon that offers both the traditional services found in many chain hair salons, and a number of unique touches that help it stand apart from the San Antonio competition. These include spa services (manicures, pedicures, etc.) and hairstyles such as tapers, edge-ups and perms. 

As the company’s owner, Bianca established a firm mission to provide the highest quality services at affordable prices. Friendly and knowledgeable staff and an inviting environment are trademarks of the Wavvy brand. Bianca feels that these are the components that will keep her clients returning to the salon time and time again.

In the process of developing her business plan, financing was the one major roadblock Bianca encountered. But she didn’t let that deter her. While doing research online about financing options, Bianca came across the Accion Texas Inc. website. She reached out to the lending staff and worked with them to qualify for a loan to launch her business. Now Bianca can purchase new equipment, as well as create a website to complement the social media components that are essential to her marketing strategy.

Bianca is thrilled to take the first step towards opening the Wavvy Barber and Beauty Salon. She has defined concrete goals that she would like her business to accomplish, including the addition of 10 full-time employees who will embrace the Wavvy mission and help it reach its revenue goals.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and establish a website.

loans.name: Kawthar

texts.en:
Kawther is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in her Kiva profile photo.

Kawthar is a 38-year-old married woman from Tulkarem. She is a mother with three sons and one daughter.
 
Kawthar's husband has a bakery store and it has been working for more than ten years. Kawthar's husband would like to improve his bakery by buying some new equipments and raw material.
 
Kawthar took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help the family business to be improved and increase their income.

loans.use: to buy more raw material and equipment for the bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase necessary kitchen equipment to keep up with the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more artificial hair for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair products of different kinds for resale.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Isata. She is married and has four children, aged 3, 7, 14 and 26. She has one additional dependent who lives with her to help with the house chores. 

In 1999, Isata established her textiles business. She began her business because she wanted to be self-reliant and help her husband with running the home. Her business is located in the city center, and her main customers are adults. 

Working seven days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,434,000 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Isata has already received and successfully repaid one loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional cotton, wax, lace and linen materials. She hopes that this loan will increase the stock and improve the profit. 

In the future, Isata plans to improve the business and expand to the trade of plastic products, hoping to open outlets within the city. She started in a stall and now she has a shop. If given more support, she will improve the business to other areas of the town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for textiles.

loans.name: Isata

texts.en:
This is 34-year-old Isata. She is married and has a child, aged 17. She has one additional dependent; her sister's daughter lives with her for assistance with her education. In 2002, Isata established her business. She began her business after graduating from technical school to be self-reliant. Her business is located in the outskirts of town, and her main customers are ladies and gents. Working seven days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about 1,799,750 SLL (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Isata has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to pay for additional shoes, t-shirts, blouses, hair, hair products, body creams, perfumes and jeans. She hopes that this loan will improve and increase the stock. In the future, Isata plans to improve the boutique and increase the stock, and hopes to be able to raise enough profit and expand to the center of town. She started the business in hairdressing, and she now owns a boutique. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for shoes, t-shirts, blouses, hair, hair products, body creams, perfumes and jeans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to move into her own office space and purchase an inventory of wedding dresses.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old single man from Gaza city. Mohammad has a grocery store, selling different types of groceries. It has been a profitable project, but not enough to cover the costs.

Mohammad is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing needed stock of basic groceries that customers often request such as rice, sugar and milk, and to make improvements in the store's condition such as installing additional shelves and painting. This will increase sales  and increase Mohammad's income.

loans.use: to buy more products for his grocery store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase inventory and new equipment, and to provide her extra income to keep her business running efficiently.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 63-year-old married man. He is a father to two sons and two daughters. 

Mohammad lives in Jenin and has a restaurant for making Palestinian traditional dishes such as hommos, foul and falafel. Mohammad has had this project for ten years. It has been a profitable project and the only source of income to him, but he needs more support to cover some necessary costs.

Mohammad is requesting a 1,000 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a blender, plates and additional chick peas and olive oil. Taking this loan will improve Mohammad's business and increase his sales, which will offer to Mohammad and his family better living conditions.

Mohammad is photographed in his restaurant.

loans.use: To buy new a blender, plates and additional ingredients for the restaurant.

loans.name: Shwqy Group

texts.en: This group is called Shwqy and consists of 4 ladies. They are hard-working people who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 120,000 YER. Wadad is a kind, cheerful, and helpful 29-year-old. She is married and has wonderful children. Her family’s financial difficulties prevented her from finishing high school. Her husband works hard, but his income has not been enough to provide for his family comfortably. She has a plot of land and intends to build a house. She says the amount she has saved is not enough to buy construction materials to complete building a house. So she applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB. She hopes, after completing her house, to buy furniture and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to complete building a house.

loans.name: Isa

texts.en: Isa is a married man, 27 years old. He has two children and lives in Kankanda with his family. He is a farmer, growing bananas and onions. He has been in agriculture since 2010, and he works six days a week. Every day he works seven hours in the onion farm and four hours in the banana farm. He sells his products to traders from Kyotera and Kampala. He hopes to be the leading supplier of agriculture products in his area, if he gets enough capital to invest in the business. He has applied for this loan to buy pesticides and fertilizers for his onions. His major challenges are the weather, which is unpredictable, and acquiring pesticides, which are quite expensive. He also lacks sufficient capital for large-scale growing.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for his onions.

loans.name: Al-Jil Group

texts.en: Al-jil is a group which consists of three ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 140,000 YER. Nada is 33 years old, married, and has four children. She is a hard-working woman who strives to improve her living conditions. She has a small house, which is very old and needs a quick renovation. She is applying for a loan of 40,000 YER, which she will use to buy construction materials to use at her house. She hopes that, after the completion of the renovation, she will feel safe in her house with her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to use to renovate her family’s old house.

loans.name: Abdulai

texts.en:
Abdulai has been working as a plumber for 11 years at a sugar producing company near the township of Magburaka in the Northern province of Sierra Leone. At the same time, he has been running a small business selling rice, groundnuts (peanuts), etc. for 15 years. His wife is also a trader and helps with this business.

Abdulai and his wife have 7 children, 4 of whom are attending primary school and 3 who are in secondary schools. Since the family’s livelihood depends on generating income through the efforts of both his wife and himself, Abdulai is requesting a loan of SLL 2,000,000 from Salone Microfinance Trust, a Kiva partner in Sierra Leone.

Using this loan, he will purchase additional bulk products of rice, groundnuts, etc. to sell in the local markets. Additionally, he will be able to repay his loan through automatic payroll deduction, a service provided through SMT’s partnership with his employer, the sugar company.

loans.use: to purchase additional bulk products of rice, groundnuts, etc. to sell in the local markets.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is 50 years old, a married man with eight children, who lives in Ibb, Yemen. He is a good entrepreneur who began repairing fridges and washing machines 31 years ago. Even though he has experience in this field, he still encountering difficulties in attracting more clients. So he asked for a loan of 100,000 YER to buy spare parts for his business. He hopes that taking out this loan will increase his profits, so he can enlarge his business and buy a car. He thanks Kiva for funding his first loan.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his refrigerator repair business.

loans.name: Sokhong's Group

texts.en:
Sokong, age 39 and single, is a vendor who purchases recycled items and fruit, including bananas and coconut, for resale.  She has been involved with this business since she was 29 years old. With this loan, she is in her seventh cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan that she has fully paid back has maintained her living status in good shape. 

For this cycle, she has three other persons joining the same group, and Sokong is the leader. Now, she is asking for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy recycled items, bananas, and coconut for resale. She hopes this loan will replenish her selling items on time and get back to her a good income.

loans.use: To buy recycled items, bananas, and coconut for resale.

loans.name: Hakika Group

texts.en: Sarafina, who is in her early 30s, is a divorcée with one son who still goes to school. She has been running a retail food shop for two years.

loans.use: to buy rice at wholesale prices to sell at her food shop.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 21 femmes fait partie du Banc Villageois qui a été crée le 13 décembre 2008. Il regroupe des femmes qui habitent le même village et des alentours. Elles font comme activité principale le commerce. Elles vivent une parfaite solidarité dans le Banc Villageois.
Khady debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est divorcée et mère 3 enfants dont 1 garçon. Elle a en charge aussi sa maman. Elle est vendeuse de poisson au marché de Dakar. En effet avec le prêt elle compte acheter 2 caisses de poissons par jours cela dépend ce que le marché lui offre. 
Les bénéfices générés lui permettent d'entretenir ses enfants et sa mère. Elle parvient à payer les frais de scolarité de ses 2 enfants qui vont à l'école.
texts.en:
This group of 21 women belongs to the banc villageois created on December 13, 2008. It is composed of women living in the same village and nearby. They mainly work as vendor. They show full solidarity as banc villageois members.

Khady, standing on the right in the photo and raising her hand, is 38 years old. She is divorced and has three children, one of whom is a boy. Her mother is also a dependent. Khady sells fish at the market of Dakar. Specifically, with this loan she plans to buy two cases of fish per day, depending on the market offer. The resulting revenues will allow her to provide for her children and her mother. She manages to pay for the schooling of two of her children. 
.

loans.use: to buy fish.

loans.name: Phach's Group

texts.en:
A mother of seven children residing in Kampong Cham province, Phach is 47 years old and a farmer in the local area. She does cassava farming on a two hectares area to support her family as the main source of income, and she works for others for a fee for extra income. She has been with this business for ages and is able to earn about 16,000 KHR per day. 

This is the second micro-loan for Pheach’s group, consisting of two members, with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan has supported her business and improved her family’s livelihood at a good pace. Now she and her co-borrower are seeking 1,200,000 KHR  each. As the leader, Phach will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and to plow her cassava farm. She hopes to grow her cash crop fruitfully and gain high yield with good profit to sustain her family, as well as to set aside some money to build a decent house for her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and to plow her cassava farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sullay

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Sullay, a worker at a sugar producing company in Magburaka. Through partnering with local companies, SMT is able to provide borrowers like Sullay with micro-loans that are repaid through payroll deduction.

Sullay is a 35-year-old man who is married and has 5 children. All his children are attending primary school. Sullay has been working as a plumber at the sugar company for 8 years. His wife works as a trader in the local market. 

Sullay has requested a loan of SLL 1,000,000 in order to purchase building materials such as zinc, iron rods, cement, etc. He will use these materials to work on the construction of his home in order to provide a better shelter for his family and protect them from the upcoming rainy season.

loans.use: to purchase building material such as zinc, iron rods, cement, etc.

loans.name: Mohamed J.s.

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva in Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you Mohamed, a 39-year-old resourceful husband and father working hard to provide for his family.

Mohamed has been working as a sugar technician at a local sugar producing company for the past 10 years.  He is requesting a loan of SLL 2,000,000 from SMT to purchase building materials such as cement, iron corrugated sheets, etc. He will use these materials to work on the construction of his home in order to provide a better shelter for his family and protect them from the upcoming rainy season.

Through partnering with local companies, SMT is able to provide borrowers like Mohamed with micro-loans that are repaid through payroll deduction.

loans.use: to purchase building materials such as cement, iron corrugated sheets, etc. to work on the construction of his home in order to provide a better shelter for his family and protect them from the upcoming rainy season.

loans.name: Babati Group

texts.en:
Aisha, who is in her mid 30s, is married with two children, both of whom are grown-ups. She has been running a beauty salon for five years now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Aisha's 5th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to repair her salon by putting in wall tiles, restocking the out-of-stock salon equipment; she has paid back all her loans successfully. She used the profits to start building her own house and cover household expenses. She will use this loan to buy more salon equipment and to start selling cosmetics in her salon. Her dream is to one day be able to finish building her house.

Aisha will share this loan with her loan group Babati. Its 8 members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment and to start selling cosmetics in her  salon.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en: A 60-year-old married father, Horn is a local farmer residing in the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province. To deal with his family's daily living costs, he grows rice and sesame on two hectares. This is the business that he has been with for 10 years. Horn is a second-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s parter). He has fully repaid back his original loan with success; it enabled him to support himself better than before. Now, he is applying for a new loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and seed, and to pay for labor on his farmland. He hopes to earn more yields and make a better profit profit than he did last year so that he can keep supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and seed, and to pay for labor on his farmland.

loans.name: Irma Graciela

texts.es: Irma, tiene 28 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, vive en el municipio de Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. Ella tiene 3 años de tener su propio negocio de venta de ropa como blusas, pantalones, camisetas, y otros y sandalias. La venta la realiza de manera ambulante en al comunidad y a sus alrededores. Ha decidido por un préstamo de 12,000 lempiras para comprar más mercadería como ropa variada y sandalias. Este préstamo le ayudara a mantener un inventario mas surtido y poder ofrecer variedad al cliente. Su objetivo es tener el negocio surtido para dejarlo como patrimonio a su hijo y en lo personal quiere ser una gran empresaria.
texts.en: Irma is 28. She is a single mother with one child and lives in the municipality of Macuelizo, Santa Bárbara. She has had her own business for three years and sells clothing such as blouses, pants, shirts, and sandals. She sells door-to-door in the community and surrounding areas. She has decided to take out a loan of 12,000 lempiras for the purchase of more merchandise such as varied clothing and sandals. This loan will allow her to maintain a better stock and to offer variety to her customers. Her goal is to have a well-stocked business to leave to her child as an inheritance. In terms of personal goals, she wants to be a great businessperson.

loans.use: to buy clothing and sandals for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, blocks, and iron.

loans.name: Nver

texts.en:
Nver is 36 years old and lives with his wife, son and daughter in Geghamavan village, which is in the Sevan area. Nver graduated from Sevan State Technical College, and he is a tractor mechanic by profession. He worked at his profession until 2006. After that he started to work for Sevan Fire Service as a fireman. He said he likes his job because he is able to help people at any time. 

At the same time, Nver and his family are engaged in agricultural businesses. His wife helps him to grow vegetables in their garden and sells them in the Sevan fruit markets. Nver has a large animal barn where he breeds cows, sheep, bulls and piglets. He likes his animals and takes care of them with great pleasure. As he confessed, animal breeding is more profitable than his job, which for Nver is just a charity occupation. 

This is the first loan with Kiva for Nver. He needs a loan amount of 700,000 Armenian drams to buy 3 young cows in order to enlarge his animal breeding business, and he hopes to receive a good profit. Nver believes that it will be good start and he hopes to cooperate with Kiva in the future again.

loans.use: To buy 3 young cows in order to enlarge his animal breeding business.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.es:
La señora Elizabeth es viuda, tiene 33 años de edad, curso el 2do. año de educación primaria, tiene 5 hijos y de ellos nadie estudia, ella se dedica a la elaboracion de borado de guipiles, inició este negocio con la ayuda de su madre y hasta el momento lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y decide realizar un préstamos que lo utilizará para la compra de hilos para bordar guipiles, en el futuro quiere contar con un local en el mercado para la venta de guipiles. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican tambien a bordar guipiles.
en la fotografia aparecen 11 señoras pero solo a 10 se les concedio el préstamo.
texts.en:
Elizabeth is a widow and is 33 years old.  She has up to a 2nd grade education, and has 5 children.  None of her children attend school.  She works in embroidering regional dresses, and started this business with the help of her mother.  She has 4 years of experience with her business.

She organized a group and decided to request a loan that she will utilize to buy thread for embroidering dresses.  In the future she wants to have a location in the market to sell the dresses.  The other members of the group also work in embroidering dresses.  

There are 11 women in the photograph, but only 10 of them are part of the group requesting the loan.

loans.use: to buy threads to for embroidering regional dresses

loans.name: Papin

texts.en:
Papin and his family are still engaged in farming. With last loan from Kiva, Papin bought tomato seeds and raised a good harvest on his land. He received a good profit and repaired his barn for his animals. He breeds cows, bulls, sheep and chickens. He is very happy that the income from his farming allows them to meet their family's needs. 

Papin decided to enlarge the number of his animals and asks for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy 3 young cows and fodder for his animals. He hopes that it will be as good a deal with Kiva as his last loan.

loans.use: To buy 3 young cows and fodder for his animals.

loans.name: Esperanza Asegurada 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Carmela is one of our businesswomen. She works selling grocery products in her small store in her house. This kind of business is called "Colmado". She is a mother with 2 children. Only one of them lives together with her and her long term partner. They both work to support the needs of their household, and Carmela works every day to provide her children with a good education, clothing and food. She belongs to the "Esperanza Asegurada 3 & 4" Group together with 9 neighbors who also work hard to bring more stability to their families. 

Carmela is receiving her 10th loan from Esperanza Internacional and, because her loan repayments have been made punctually, she has been able to strengthen her business and make good investments. Her plan for this new loan is to invest in her business by buying different types of goods for daily meals, to increase her business inventory and to give better service to her clients. She uses the profits from the sales she makes to save. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy goods like rice, sugar, flour and beans.

loans.name: Kok's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang Province where rice farming is the popular business in the area, Kok is 40 years old and a widow. She has five children, four of whom are still dependent on her as they are still in school. Like the rest of her neighborhood, she does rice farming. The four hectares of rice growing has returned her about 15,000 Riels (KHR) per day. Including this loan, she is a third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva's partner). The past loans have enabled her to support her business on time and have helped her to increase her income and sustain better living conditions than before. 

Now, she leads a group of three to apply for a new loan. The total amount of her group loan is 2,000,000 KHR, of which 1,000,000 KHR is her portion. Kok will spend her loan portion to pay for plowing, to buy potash, rice seed, and to pay for transplanting. She hopes to earn more income, so she can expand her farming to a bigger scale.

loans.use: To pay for plowing, to buy potash, rice seed, and to pay for transplanting

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 31-year-old married man, and he is a father to three sons and one daughter. Mohammad is employed and gets a small salary, which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. For the past three years, Mohammad has been driving a taxi, which has been a profitable project and a second source of income for the family.

Mohammad is requesting a 1,500 USD loan from FATEN to help him cover the costs of purchasing a new engine for the taxi he drives. This will increase the taxi's ability to work extra hours and will enable Mohammad to take additional internal and external requests, which will improve the family's income positively.

In the photo, Mohammad is in front of his taxi.

loans.use: To buy a new engine for his taxi.

loans.name: Waza

texts.en: Waza is a 44-year-old married man who has 9 children. He lives in Ibb, Yemen. He is a hardworking entrepreneur, and a very innovative and creative person. His business consists of selling retail items: gifts, cosmetics and accessories for woman, His daily income isn't enough to cover his big family's needs. He wants to expand and buy new merchandise to meet the demands of various groups of customers, so he applied for a loan of 160,000 YER from AMB to buy cosmetics and accessories for woman to use. This loan will enable him to make additional profit and expand his business.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and accessories for for women.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en: Phally is a 40-year-old mother of four dependent kids from Moung Russey district in Battambang Province, where the rest of her family is. For the sake of her family, she grows rice on three hectares and operates a motor-taxi service for supplemental income. The current business, in which she has been involved for 20 years, has returned her about 38,000 KHR per day. This is not the first loan for Phally with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past six cycles have returned her a positive impact, allowing her to upgrade her living conditions at a good pace. She also has completely repaid back her past loans with success. Now, she joins a group of two to apply for a new loan. Her requested loan amount is 1,400,000 KHR while the other member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion on 12 sacks of fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes that this purchase will support her crop on time and boost her land's productivity, allowing her to triple her crop output.

loans.use: to buy 12 sacks of fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Roem's Group

texts.en: A resident of Battambang Province, Roem, 44, is married and has 10 children. Currently, only four children still count on her, as they are in school. She and the rest of her family depend solely on a single business, rice farming on one hectare. For 20 years, this business has returned her about 6,000 KHR per day. Roem, a third-time borrower, is joining with a first-time borrower in order to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loan, which has increased the family's income and gradually helped relieve their burdens. Now, she is seeking a loan of 700,000 KHR while her co-borrower is asking for for 1,000,0000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to plow her farmland and buy potash. She hopes to increase her income in order to expand her farmland.

loans.use: to plow her farmland and buy potash.

loans.name: Izzat

texts.en:
Izzat is a 36-year-old married man and a father to five sons and four daughters. He lives with his family in Rafah in an area where hired water sales can't reach his house. He is a worker who gets a small salary which is barely enough to cover the family's needs, but at the same time he is trying to offer better living conditions to his family.

Izzat is requesting a 1,050 USD loan from FATEN to cover the cost of purchasing a water purification filter for his house. This will bring clean and healthy water for different uses to Izzat and his family. He is photographed in front of the water purification filter he has in his house.

loans.use: to purchase a water purification filter.

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es:
Su nombre  es Alejandra  tiene 19 años. Desde pequeña le ha gustado el campo de la salud y quería ser una gran doctora o enfermera. cuando termino de estudiar también tuvo a su hija así que para estudiar le toco esperar un año y  ya por razones económicas no estudiar medicina así que auxiliar de enfermería estaba bien para empezar al pasar el tiempo y después de que su hija cumplió seis meses empezó a trabajar porque necesitaba reunir  dinero para estudiar y entro a trabajar en un bar hay reunió todo el dinero que pudo  y después de un año de estar trabajando, busco por Internet instituciones para estudiar auxiliar de enfermería nunca había escuchado de el instituto y una amiga lejana que se entero que estaba buscando institutos para estudiar el auxiliar le recomendó mucho campo alto ya que ella se había graduado de allí del el mismo técnico así que se dirigió hasta allá para mirarlo y para preguntar lo que se necesitaba y le gusto bastante entonces fue cuando decidió y allí tenia que empezar a estudiar.

Entro a estudiar en pero antes de entrar a estudiar tenia que pensar en quien iba a cuidar de su hija, sus padres siempre le han colaborado en ser madre joven y con el estudio pero no podían tener a la niña así que la matriculo en un jardín pero con mucho esfuerzo por lo pequeña una vez la niña ubicada empezó a estudiar y ahora va en segundo semestre muy contenta porque sabe que los esfuerzos se gratifican de una u otra forma. Le ha gustado mucho estudiar en campo alto los profesores son excelentes y los compañeros muy agradables.
texts.en:
This is Alejandra, age 19. Even at a young age she liked the field of healthcare and wanted to be a great doctor or nurse. When she finished school, she gave birth to her daughter and had to wait a year to study. For economic reasons, she was not able to study medicine, so studying to be a licensed practical nurse seemed like a good start. Time passed, and after her daughter reached 6 months of age Alejandra started to work because she needed to earn money to study. She started working at a bar and saved all the money she could. After a year of working, she searched on the internet for schools where she could study to be a licensed practical nurse. She had never heard of Campo Alto, but an old friend who had completed the same degree there found out that she was looking for schools and highly recommended Campo Alto. So, Alejandra went there to look around and ask about what she would need, and she liked it a lot. That was when she decided to start studying there.
Before she started she had to think about who would care for her daughter. Being a young mother, her parents have always supported her with her studies, but they weren't able to take care of her daughter. Alejandra enrolled her in daycare, and this took a lot of work. Once her daughter was settled, Alejandra started to study. She is now in her second semester and is very happy because she knows that her hard work will be rewarded one way or another. She has very much enjoyed studying at Campo Alto. The professors are excellent and her fellow students are very friendly.

loans.use: to finish her studies.

loans.name: Alejandra Camila

texts.es:
Alejandra es una mujer de 21 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar para ayudar a sus padres, Alejandra no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración que desea, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Alejandra trabaja como vendedora en un centro fotográfico de su ciudad, ella trabaja todos los días atendiendo a clientes y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Alejandra se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de una habitación en su vivienda, ya que esta solo tiene piso de tierra y requiere ponerle piso de concreto, de esta manera Alejandra y su familia tendrán mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Alejandra is 21 years old. She is unmarried and lives in the city of Ica with her parents and siblings. She is a very friendly, hard-working and enthusiastic individual, with a great desire for self-improvement. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources, and because she needs to work to help her parents, Alejandra has not been able to pursue a degree in Administration as she had wished. In her free time she likes to do some reading and she sometimes cooks a delicious Peruvian stewed pork dish [Carapulcra] to share with her family. 

On her own initiative and with much persistence and dedication, Alejandra works as a sales clerk in a photography shop in her city. She works every day, taking care of clients for approximately 10 hours. She thinks things are going well for her because of the good service and friendly treatment that she gives others. 

Alejandra is very thankful for Kiva lenders; with their assistance she will be able to renovate a room in her home. This room has only an earthen floor and she needs to put down a concrete one. This way Alejandra and her family will have greater security and well-being. She will continue working hard to achieve her dream of attending university.

loans.use: to renovate a room.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia
