Su dificultad es la transportación. Es casado su esposo es albañil. Si tiene 2 hijos uno de 2 años y 4 años están en escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar útiles escolares para sus hijos ya que van a ingresar a la escuela y otros artículos. Su sueño es poder comprarse un auto para su trabajo.
texts.en:
Fresia lives in Duran. When she was a young woman, Fresia started her family and wanted to help her husband by selling spices, such as cumin and garlic, as a street vendor. She currently works with her brother and they travel by bicycle throughout Duran so that they can offer their products to the stores.

Her difficulty is dealing with transportation issues. Fresia is married and her husband is a bricklayer. They have two children, ages 2 and 4, who are enrolled in a state school. With this loan, Fresia will buy school supplies for her children since they will be starting school and be in need of these items. Her dream is to buy a car for her work.

loans.use: to buy school supplies for her children.

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es:
José, requiere de un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de seguir invirtiendo en la siembra de granos básicos; este le permitirá comprar insumos agrícolas tales como: seis sacos de abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, entre otros.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a incrementar la productividad y con las utilidades que ha obtenido le está haciendo unas mejoras a la vivienda; las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado.
texts.en:
José needs a new loan to invest in his crops. This will allow him to buy some agricultural supplies such as: six sacks of fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, pest-control substances, and other items.

His previous loan helped José to increase his production and with the earnings from those crops he was able to improve his home. His family's financial situation has greatly improved.

loans.use: to buy six sacks of fertilizer, herbicides, insecticides, pest-control substances, and other items.

loans.name: Yovany Moises

texts.es:
Yovany,  se dedica a la ganadería. El está soltero, vive junto a sus hermanos y no tiene familiares en el extranjero.  El tiene seis años de realizar dicha actividad y lo lleva a cabo todos los días de 4:00 am a 3:00 pm, esto lo inicio por iniciativa propia.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar ganado y concentrado para engordarlos, despues venderlos; este le ayudara a fortalecer el negocio y con las ganancias brindarles ayuda a sus hermanos.
Su sueño es crecer el negocio,  tener una mejor calidad de vida él y su familia.
texts.en:
Yovany works in livestock. He is single and lives with his siblings. None of his family members live outside of the country. Yovany has been working with cattle for six years. By his own choice, he works each day from 4 a.m. to 3 p.m. 

Yovany is requesting this loan in order to buy cattle and concentrated food to fatten them so he may later sell them. This will help Yovany to strengthen his business and help his family with the money he earns. 

Yovany's dream is to expand his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle and condensed food to fatten them.

loans.name: Sany's Group

texts.en:
An elderly mother of nine children who resides in the Sampov Meas district and Pursat province, Sany is a farmer who grows rice and corn on two hectares of land to make a living. Aside from this primary source of income, her husband also helps earn extra income via a business selling ice cream. 

Sany has been doing this kind of farming work for about 20 years. She is a third-time borrower from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans already. She now feels empowered that she can sustain her business as well as her lifestyle. 

With this new loan, Sany and her group members are seeking 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, Sany will use her loan portion to buy a decent motorbike to support her husband's business. She hopes that she can make more income to expand her ice-cream selling business as well as her crop-farming business on a bigger scale.

loans.use: To buy a decent motorbike to support her husband's business.

loans.name: Nadys Soleyda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nadys, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio de pupuseria; este le permitirá comprar carne, arroz, harina de maíz, condimentos y unas mesas para el negocio.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener mayores ingresos; las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual, mientras que las condiciones económicas han mejorado.
texts.en:
Nadys is requesting a new loan to invest in her Pupusa business. This will allow her to buy meat, rice, corn meal, condiments, and some tables for her business. 

Her previous loan helped Nadys to stock her kitchen and increase her earnings. Her family's situation has not changed, but her finances have improved.

loans.use: to buy meat, rice, corn meal, condiments and some tables for her business.

loans.name: Bahodurjon

texts.ru: Баходурчон житель района Рудаки. Ему 40 лет. Он женат и отец двух детей. Его жена домохозяйка, а дети несовершеннолетние. Баходурчон является единственным кормильцем в семье. Он занимается изготовлением деревянных окон и дверей. Теперь он намерен заняться другой сферой деятельности. Он хочет заняться производством туалетной бумаги. Он имеет место для ведения деятельности и небольшой собственный вклад. Чтобы начать новый бизнес, Баходурчон просит кредит для приобретения оборудования для производства туалетной бумаги.
texts.en: Bahodurjon is a resident of the Rudaki district.  He is 40 years old, married and a father of two children.  His wife is a homemaker, and children are not of age.  Bahodurjon is the sole provider for his family.  He is involved in manufacturing wooden windows and doors.  Now, he intends to get involved in another business area.  He wants to start making toilet paper.  He has a space for running a business and a small investment of his own.  In order to start the new business, Bahodurjon is requesting a loan to purchase equipment for making toilet paper.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for making toilet paper

loans.name: Khim's Group

texts.en:
Originally from the Pursat province’s Sampov Meas district, Khim is married with five children. To overcome the daily cost of living, she farms corn and rice as the primary source of the family's income. She has been farming for 25 years and is able to earn about 15,900 KHR per day. 

Khim’s prior loan was her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid her past loan wisely and this has enabled her to support her business on time. 

Now, Khim leads a group of three to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizers and to pay a plowing fee. She hopes that she can earn more income so that she can set aside some money to run a small grocery stall. This would enable her to earn extra income for her family.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers, and to pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: Romazon

texts.ru: Ромазону 48 лет. У него большая семья. Он женат и является отцом троих дочерей и троих сыновей. Старший его сын обзаведен семьей и имеет одного ребенка. Все они одной семьей живут в районе Шахритус на юге страны. Ромазон уже 5 лет как занимается изготовлением деревянных окон и дверей. Сейчас он еще хочет заняться купле-продажей крупнорогатого скота. Он планирует закупать каждый месяц по 6-голов бычков, откармливать их в течение 30-35 календарных дней и затем перепродавать с наценкой на скотном рынке района. Чтобы реализовать свою цель он обратился за кредитом и надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Romazon is 48 years old.  He has a large family.  He is married and a father of three daughters and three sons.  His oldest son has a family and has one child.  All of them live as one family in the Shahrituz district in the south of the county.  Romazon has been involved in manufacturing wooden windows and doors for five years.  Now, he also wants to get involved in buying and selling cattle.  He plans to buy six bulls every month, fatten them up for 30-35 calendar days and then resell them with a markup at the district's livestock market.  He requested this loan in order to achieve his goal and hopes for your support.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Nathalie

texts.fr: Coiffeuse de profession, Nathalie âgée de 24ans revend aussi des mèches et des chaussures dans son salon de coiffure. Elle a démarré en 2006 et s’approvisionne généralement au Grand marché de Lomé. Pour mieux satisfaire les besoins des clients, elle sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des mèches et autres produits. Notons qu’elle est mariée à un cuisinier et n’a pas d’enfants en charge. Comme perspectives d avenir, elle espère avoir une activité prospère et assurer les moindres besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
A hairdresser by profession, 24 year old Nathalie also sells hair extensions and shoes in her hair salon. She began in 2006 and usually buys her supplies from the "Grand Marché" in Lomé.
To better meet her customers' needs, she is seeking her first loan from WAGES in order to purchase hair extensions and other products. We should point out she is married to a cook, and has no dependent children.
As for the future, she hopes to have a successful business and to cover her family's basic needs.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and flip-flops.

loans.name: Al-Tfaol Group

texts.en:
ِAl-tfaol is a four-member group from Hodeida, Yemen. All the members are women. They  have requested a loan of 150,000 YER to buy perfumes, incense and sewing materials. 

Jihad is 31 years old and the mother of six children. She knows how to read and write. She decided to help her husband who works very hard and does his best to provide his family with food and clothes. She has been selling perfumes, incense and sewing materials. She intends to expand her business to increase her profits. Therefore, she has asked for a loan of 50,000 YER to buy perfumes, incense and sewing materials for her business. She hopes that she can earn good profits by selling a lot of products to new clients in different parts of her city.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, incense and sewing materials for her business.

loans.name: Sitha's Group

texts.en:
A peasant from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Sitha is married and blessed with five children. To sustain the family, she farms rice on one hectare, the family's main source of income, while her husband works for others for extra income. Engaged in farming for 15 years, Sitha earns about 35,600 KHR per day.

Having managed her previous loan wisely to support her business, Sitha a second-time borrower, is leading a group of three to request a new loan. She will use her 1,000,000 KHR portion to pump water and to buy pesticide for her farmland. She is very hopeful that she can earn more income to save for future needs, especially when she gets older.

loans.use: To pump water and to buy pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Zaynuddin

texts.ru: Зайнуддин проживает в столице Таджикистана в городе Душанбе. Ему 42 года. Зайнуддин женат и воспитывает троих детей. Его дети учатся в школе. У Зайнуддин среднее образование. Он зарабатывает на жизнь путем торговли. На рынке города у него имеется торговая точка, где он продает женское нижнее белье и детскую одежду. Зайнуддин имеет большой опыт в сфере продаж, так как он занимается торговым бизнесом уже 13 лет. Зайнуддин пунктуальный и целеустремленный человек. Он запрашивает кредит для закупа сезонной одежды на продажу с целью товарооборота. Он хочет расширить и улучшить свой бизнес.
texts.en: Zaynuddin lives in the capital of Tajikistan, in the city of Dushanbe.  He is 42 years old.  Zaynuddin is married and raising three children.  His children attend a school.  Zaynuddin has a secondary education.  He earns a living through retail sales.  He has a retail outlet at a city market, where he sells women's undergarments and children's clothing.  Zaynuddin has an extensive experience in the sales field because he has been involved in this business for 13 years.  Zaynuddin is a punctual and driven person.  He is requesting this loan to purchase seasonal clothing to sell in order to increase goods turnover.  He wants to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal clothing to sell in order to increase goods turnover

loans.name: Franklin Alfredo

texts.es: El Sr. Franklin tiene 26 años,  tiene un hijo de 4 años, el se dedica a la construcción de puertas y muebles de cocina de aluminio,  tiene su taller  carpintería que se encuentra ubicado en la zona de 16 de Julio de la ciudad de El Alto   se dedica a esta actividad desde hace ya 6 años esta actividad lo aprendió de su padre quien también realiza muebles de aluminio,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr. Franklin utilizara  este préstamo  para  la compra de material de construcción para ampliación de su taller, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de este material ya que así tendrá mayor comodidad,   El Sr. Franklin enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida, ya que esta es su única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia, por este motivo se siente feliz ya agradecido a la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Franklin is 26 years old, he has a 4 year old son, and he works making doors and aluminum kitchen furniture. He has his own carpentry workshop that is located in the zone 16 de Julio, in the city of El Alto. He has been involved in this business for 6 years, a business he learned from his father who also made aluminum furniture. This is his first loan in a sequence with this financial institution. Mr. Frankloin will use this loan to purchase construction material to expand his workshop and the reason he needs this loan is because of the lack of working capital needed to purchase these items, also, this way he will be able to do so without added stress. Mr. Franklin faces challenges in his business such as making his way out of poverty by using his additional earnings to improve his quality of life, since this is the only economic activity he has to allow him to support himself and to support his family. And so, he feels happy and thankful for the financial institution that will lend him this money.

loans.use: purchase construction material.

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr: Jeune femme de 31ans, Ablavi est mariée et maman de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. L’ainé a 10ans et le dernier 02ans. Pour aider son conjoint chauffeur dans les charges du foyer, elle revend des charbons de bois à domicile depuis 1998 et sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises. Elle espère agrandir son activité et assurer l’avenir des enfants.
texts.en:
A young 31 year old woman, Ablavi is married and the mother of three children - two of whom attend school. The eldest is ten and the youngest two years old. In order to assist her husband (a driver) with the household expenses, she has been selling charcoal door to door since 1998; she is seeking her first loan with WAGES in order to buy more supplies.
She hopes to grow her business and to secure the children's future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda, de 38 años de edad es una mujer trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su esposo e hijos en la casa que compró hace algunos años. La zona rural donde reside es acogedora y muy accesible por lo que desea mejorar su comercialización. Desde hace 20 años dedica su tiempo y esfuerzo a la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de arveja, maíz y papa. Afirma que el maíz es el alimento que le brinda más ganancias, ya que la maduración es rápida y tiene compradores fijos. Ahora desea mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos y comenzar a sembrar el 100% de manera orgánica pues tiene mucha acogida en el mercado y en diversos lugares del país.  
Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, agradece el apoyo brindado , razón por la cual se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Yolanda, invertirá los S/. 1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 38 years old, is a hardworking woman. She lives with her husband and children in the house that they bought a few years ago. Yolanda lives in a  friendly, rural area that is a very good place for her to improve her business. For the last 20 years, Yolanda has made a living as a farmer, growing peas, corn, and potatoes.

Corn is the crop that brings in the most money for Yolanda since it grows quickly and she has fixed customers who buy it. Now, Yolanda hopes to improve the quality of her crops and begin to grow her plants 100% organically because there is a big market for organic goods in many places all over the country. 

This is Yolanda's first loan with Kiva. She is very grateful for the support it offers her, so she pledges to be punctual with her repayments. Yolanda will invest the 1000 Peruvian soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer to nourish her plants.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Loeurm's Group

texts.en:
Loeurm is a 50-year-old mother of one child living in Thmor Koul district, Battambang province.  She is a rice farmer who struggles with the daily cost of living.  She has been doing this for 30 years and is able to earn up to 28,900 KHR per day.  This is the second loan for Leourm with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner.  

She feels confident that she can progressively sustain her living and obtain a better yield and profit than her original loan, which she has fully repaid.  For this cycle, she joins with two members who have been with VisionFund before.  As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland.  She strongly hopes that this purchase will make her crop fruitful with a good profit return so that she can set aside some money for future needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Santa Maria Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SANTA MARÍA” iniciará el trigésimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Ruth es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa interior, venta de productos varios, venta de salchipapas, venta de calzados.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Ruth es integrante, ella indica que hace once años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de su hermana que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calzados; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió hace varios años atrás, aprendiendo la forma de venta de su madre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de calzados) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de Oruro y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones, el área de salud, los créditos y los ahorros.

En la fotografía una socia esta ausente, ya que se fue a consulta médica
texts.en:
The "Santa María" communal bank will start its thirteenth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata regional office. It is made up of nine members led by a board of directors of which Ruth is the chair. 

The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry on are varied, and include selling underwear, miscellaneous goods, salchipapas (fried potatoes with hot dog), and footwear. The loan they will take out benefits small-business people such as Ruth. She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for 11 years, joining at the invitation of her sister, who is a member of the institution. 

Currently she has a business selling shoes. She says that she launched this business several years ago, learning this way of selling from her mother. The loan she will take out now is to increase her capital, through the purchase of shoes. She will acquire these at the markets in the city of Oruro, and later sell them at her sales outlet. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her household as much as she can, as she is in a common-law relationship and has one child. 

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the training, the health clinic, the loans and the savings program. In the photograph, one member is absent as she went to a medical appointment.

loans.use: To buy shoes.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
Zonia, de 52 años de edad es una mujer sencilla y trabajadora. Vive en compañía de su padre en su casa propia.
La zona donde vive es muy alejada, posee manantiales y mucha vegetación por lo que aprendió desde muy joven a trabajar en la agricultura, afirma que sus principales cultivos constan de alverja, papa y maíz. Como buena mujer del campo desde las primeras horas del día se dirige a trabajar en sus cultivos, extrayendo los surcos y nutriéndolos con abono orgánico. Espera poder especializarse en la mejora de sus cultivos, pues sembrar le agrada sobre todo porque ya no tiene hijos que dependan de ella y desea ocupar su tiempo en lo que más le gusta.Este es el primer crédito con KIVA, agradece el apoyo brindado , razón por la cual se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas.Zonia, invertirá los S/. 2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Fifty-two-year-old Zonia is a simple and hardworking woman.  She lives with her father in her own home.

The area she lives in is very isolated; there are natural springs and a lot of vegetation, which is why she learned to work in farming from a very young age.  She tells us that her main crops are peas, potatoes, and corn.  Like a good countrywoman she gets up early in the morning and sets out to work on her crops, plowing her furrows and nourishing them with organic fertilizer.  She hopes to be able to focus on improving her crops, as she likes planting more than anything now that she no longer has children who depend on her and she wants to fill her time with what she likes most.  This is her first loan with Kiva and she is thankful for the help she has been offered, which is why she promises to make her payments on time.  Zonia will invest her 2,000 soles in organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: 25 De Julio Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LOS ANGELES DE  FLORIDA” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Elizabet es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de hornallas y repuestos de cocina, venta de tenis, venta de papa y chuño, venta de tucumanas, venta de ropa americana, ayudante de minibús.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Elizabet es integrante, ella indica que hace un año y medio que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de papa y chuño (papa deshidratada); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de sus padres, posteriormente decide establecer su propio espacio de venta.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de papa y chuño) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The comunal association "Los Angeles de Florida" began its fourth cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Central Focus of Senkata. It is composed of 8 partners and is directed by a directive board. Elizabet is the president. The businesses that the partners of the communal association bring forward are diverse. Some of them include the sale of burners and kitchen devices, sneakers, potatoes and dried potatoes, tucumana, American clothes, and helping on minibuses.

The loan they take out will benefit microbusinesses like the one where Elizabet works. She notes that for a year and a half she has worked with Pro Mujer, entering by the invitation of a friend who is a partner with the institution. Now she has a business selling potatoes and dehydrated potatoes, which gives her a knowledge of the business that she's learned over the years with her parents. She later decided to establish her own sales space. This form of work will permit her to generate resources to maintain everything possible in her home, as she is married and has two children.

When consulted, she said what she likes about Pro Mujer are the lessons about loans and health.

loans.use: to buy dried and fresh potatoes.

loans.name: Reyes Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “REYES” iniciará el quinto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Jeovana es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de carteras, carnicería, venta de limones y chancaca (dulce natural), venta de zapatos, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Jeovana es integrante, ella indica que hace ocho años que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calzados; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por iniciativa propia, con el primer préstamo realizado por la institución.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de calzados) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de Oruro y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones, el área de salud, el crédito y los ahorros.
texts.en:
The communal bank “REYES” is about to begin its fifth cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Central Focus of Senkata. This group is made up of eight members and has a governing board headed by Jeovana, the president. The members of this group run a variety of businesses which include, a neighborhood store, a bag store, a butcher's shop, a natural fruit and juice business, a shoe store, and food stand.  The loan the group is requesting will help the small business owners of Jeovana's communal bank group. 

Jeovana has been a member of Pro Mujer for eight years. She joined the group at the invitation of a friend. Currently, Jeovana owns a shoe store that she opened with her first loan through the institution. This new loan will help Jeovana to increase her capital so that she can buy shoes from the city fair in Oruro to later sell in her store. This will help Jeovana (who lives with her partner and son) to help her family pay its household expenses.   

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Jeovana says that she enjoys the training sessions on the topics of health, credit, and savings.

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Norn

texts.en:
A widow mother of three children from the Kror Kor district of the Pursat province, Norn is a farmer who grows rice on two hectares of land. She has been engaged in farming for 30 years and is able to earn about 32,000 KHR per day. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), Norn is a fourth-cycled client who has repaid her past loans already. She utilized her past loans to support her living progressively. This enabled her to be able to afford to buy household items for her family also. 

For this cycle, she is seeking a loan of 3,000,000 KHR in order to smooth her farmland for replanting. She very much hopes that she can grow her cash crops in a timely fashion and gain a high yield. This will provide more income, enabling her to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay to smooth her farmland for replanting.

loans.name: Tuo's Group

texts.en:
A local villager from the Thmor Koul district of the Battambang province, Tuo is a 36 year-old who is blessed with two children who are still in school. She mainly depends on a single business growing corn. She has been involved in this business for 10 years.

This is not the first loan for Tuo with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan, which she has repaid fully, returned her a decent income to upgrade her living status in a good manner. 

Now, she leads a group of two to apply for a new loan. As the group leader, Tuo will spend her portion to buy corn seeds and to pay a plowing fee. She hopes to grow her corn healthily, enabling her to earn a good profit for her family.

loans.use: To buy corn seeds and to pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: Kunthea's Group

texts.en:
Kunthea is a 40-year-old, married resident from the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province.  She has three children.  To support her family, she works for others and also grows vegetables for resale.  This business earns her about 38,900 KHR per day.  This is not the first loan for Kunthea’s group as they have been with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner, for the past three cycles.  The past loans, which she has fully repaid, supported the basic daily needs of her family and helped to grow the business at a good pace. 

Now, she is requesting a 400,000 KHR loan while the other members are requesting 300,000 KHR each.  As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash for her farmland.  She hopes to earn more income so that she can set aside some money for future needs.

loans.use: to buy potash for her farmland.

loans.name: Chhai's Group

texts.en:
Chhai is a 48-year-old, married woman from a rural village in the Tbaung Khmum district, Kampong Cham province.  She is blessed with six children.  To address her daily cost of living, she grows rice on 1.5 hectares and plants cassava on one hectare of farmland.  She is able to earn about 19,000 KHR per day from her current business, which she has been with for ages.  

This is the third loan for Chhai with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner.  She has wisely managed her past loan to sustain her business and living, especially being able to afford sufficient, decent food for her kids.  Now, she leads a group of four to apply for a new loan.  As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to lease a plot of farmland in order to grow more cassava.  She hopes that she can earn triple the income from her current businesses.

loans.use: to lease farmland to grow cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Manzanitas De Tocongori Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MANZANITA DE TOCONGORI”  iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Achacachi, está compuesta por ocho integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Gregoria es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: trenzado de mantas, comerciante de refrescos, tractorista, venta de abarrotes, venta de queso, tienda de abarrotes.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Gregoria es integrante, ella indica que es el primer ciclo que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de artesanías en trenzado de sogas; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de sus amigas, posteriormente decide emprender su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de hilos) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en la feria de su comunidad. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella es casada y tiene cuatro hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en crédito y salud.
texts.en:
The group "Manzanita de Tocongori" will start its first series with Pro Mujer, as a part of the Centro Focal de Achacachi, and is comprised of 8 people and headed by a directive board where Mrs. Gregoria is the President. The businesses that the members are associated with are varied, from making blankets, selling refreshments, operating a tractor, selling groceries, selling cheese and running a grocery store. 

The loan will benefit several of these small micro-businesses that Mrs. Gregoria is a member of, and she indicates that this is her group's first loan with Pro Mujer,  and that she became a member of this organization thanks to a promoter who came to visit her in her home. Today, she has a small business selling artisanal goods, making rope, something she learned from her friends and then, later, decided to start her own business. 

The loan that she will receive now is to increase her working capital (to purchase thread) that she will acquire in the upcoming festivals in the city of El Alto and then, afterwards, she will use it to sell goods in the festivals of her own community. This kind of work allows her to obtain the resources to support her home, as she is married and has four children. 

When she was asked, she said that what she likes about Pro Mujer is the training in money management and in health.

loans.use: purchase thread.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es: Margarita de 43 años de edad,vive con su esposo Máximo y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia de material rústico que compró hace algunos años.Margarita se dedica a la agricultura razón por la cual sale muy temprano a trabajar en sus terrenos agrícolas, las cuales posee gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación. Esto le ayuda a mejorar sus ingresos pues no tiene que alquilar para sembrar. Sus principales sembríos constan de flor de gladiolo, alverja y demás verduras. Confiesa que en cada cosecha comercializa los alimentos al mercado mayorista de la zona, donde obtiene buenos ingresos. Ahora desea mejorar sus ganancias con productos de buena calidad.  Este es su primer préstamo con KIVA y esta muy agradecida por el apoyo financiero brindado.Margarita, invertirá los S/.500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Forty-three-year-old Margarita lives with her husband Máximo and their five children in their own rustic home, which they bought a few years ago.  Margarita farms for a living, which is why she leaves very early to work in the fields she owns thanks to her hard work and dedication.  This helps her increase her profits as she does not have to rent to plant.  Her main crops are gladiolus flowers, peas, and other vegetables.  She tells us that with every harvest she sells the vegetables at the local wholesale market, where she makes good profits.  Now she wants to increase her earnings with good quality produce.  This is her first loan with Kiva and she is very thankful for the financial support she has been offered.  Margarita will invest the 500 soles in organic fertilizer to nourish her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Kimoun's Group

texts.en:
Kimoun is a 55-year-old mother of 4 children, residing in Kampong Cham province.  Here, cassava and rice farming are common businesses to earn a living.  No different from her neighbors, she also grows the cash crops of rice and cassava.  Her income mainly supports two of her children, who are currently studying in a local state school.  She has been involved in the current business for 29 years, earning about 25,000 KHR per day.  

This is not the first microloan for Kimoun with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner.  After the past loan, which she has fully repaid, she is able to improve her living status in a gradual manner.  She is also able to have a decent income to purchase household materials.  Now she is applying for a new loan with another co-borrower in the same group of two.  The loan request is for 1,200,000 KHR each.  As the group leader, she is going to use her portion to lease one hectare of farmland.  This will allow her to grow more cassava for extra income.  She hopes that she can make more income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to lease one hectare of farmland to grow more cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Thay's Group

texts.en: Thay is a 30-year-old, married villager from Takeo province.  She has two children to support, as they are still in school.  Thay is a farmer who grows rice and cassava on one hectare of farmland with the support from her husband.  She can earn up to 18,000 KHR from her current business, with which she has been involved for ages.  Thay is a second-time borrower with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner.  After the successful past loans, which she has completely repaid, she feels confident that she can sustain her business as well as her lifestyle progressively.  She now leads a group of four to apply for a new loan.  As the group leader, she will use her portion to pay for the plowing fee and to buy seeds for her farmland.  She hopes that she can earn more income so that her family can have a better living in the future.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee and to buy seeds.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Daisy Idalia

texts.es: Daisy de 40 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas y su esposo, es muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a sus dos hijas. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación lugar en el cual sus hijas le ayudan a repartir las tortillas, sobre todo en los fines de semana. Daisy desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobretodo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa y asi ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Daisy is 40 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and two daughters. She is very responsible and her main priority is to help her daughters excel.

She makes a living selling tortillas and prepares them every noon and every evening. Her business is based in her house, where her daughters help spread the tortillas, especially on weekends.

Daisy really wishes to improve her business, since it brings her a steady income which allows her to provide for her family. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy wholesale corn and lime. This will enable her to make a bigger quantity of tortillas, especially on weekends, when the demand is higher. 

This way Daisy can increase her income and improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and lime

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es:
Adriana de 52 años de edad, se encuentra pasando por una situación difícil debido a que hace algunos meses se divorció de su cónyuge y ahora debe velar por el sustento de su hogar y la educación de su hijo de 16 años de edad. Razón que la ha motivado a solicitar un crédito para asesorarse en la creación de negocio, ya que quiere convertirse en microempresaria pero desea conocer y aprender sobre cómo administrar su proyecto de emprendimiento para no quedar en banca rota y estar más tranquila en el momento de realizar la inversión.
Su mayor sueño es salir adelante y garantizarle a su familia una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Adriana is 52 years old. She is going through a difficult time because some months ago she divorced her spouse and now she has to take care of supporting the home and raising her 16 year old son. This is why she has asked for a loan to get some help creating a business. She wants to become a micro-businesswoman but she wants to know and learn how to manage her enterprise project so she won't end up in bankruptcy and be more at ease when she makes the investment. 

Her biggest dream is to get ahead and guarantee her family financial stability.

loans.use: to do a training for starting a business.

loans.name: Vahe

texts.en:
Vahe is 27 years old and lives with his parents in Vanadzor city. Vahe graduated from Vanadzor Culinary College and works in a pizzeria, as a cook. At the same time, Vahe has his own food production business, and after work time he makes candies and pastry products in his house. He sells them to Vanadzor’s supermarkets. Vahe’s mother helps him in this occupation. Vahe is satisfied by his work, and it allows him to take care of his family.

Vahe asks for a loan from Kiva lenders, because he wants to buy a new computer. He confessed that in our century, things are too hard without a computer and Internet connection. He wants to find and learn some information and new techniques through the Internet, which would be connected with cooking.

loans.use: To buy a new computer

loans.name: Bexsi Yanira

texts.es:
Bexsi es una mujer luchadora, emprendedora y joven de 26 años en una relación en estado civil de unión libre con un grado de educación de primaria completo lo cual agradase a sus padres por el apoyo brindado. Junto a su pareja tienen un hijo el cual esta en la escuela y se dedican a la agricultura en lo que es la siembra de hortalizas y al cultivo de café desde hace mas de 8 años. Fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron dicha actividad y que hasta hoy en día siguen practicando ya que es medio de ingreso para su familia. Su producto es comercializado con los intermediarios que llegan a la zona y que la caracterizan su producto como un producto de calidad e higiénico. El terreno que ellos cultivan es propio y lo adquirieron con mucho esfuerzo y mucho trabajo ahorrando y restringiendoce de muchas cosas para poder tener donde cultivar y no alquilar.

Hoy en día solicita ayuda para poder comprar fertilizantes, abono, plaguicidas, y una bomba de fumigación para poder cultivar un poco mas de café y darle mantenimiento a sus hortalizas ya que esto vendrá a aumentar las ganancias mediante la cantidad de café cultivado.

Sus planes a futuro es tener una amplia plantación de café la cual pueda seguirles dando bendiciones, sustento familiar y pueda ser trabajada de generación en generación y mantener sanas sus hortalizas ya que es el único medio de ingreso para su familia y poder cubrir los estudios de su hijo.
texts.en:
Bexsi is a hardworking, enterprising 26-year-old young woman.  She is in a domestic partnership and has a complete primary education, for which she thanks her parents for their support.  She and her partner have a son who is in school and they work in farming for a living, growing vegetables and coffee for over eight months now.  Her parents were the ones who taught her this profession and who still work in it, as it is a source of income for their family.  She sells her produce through dealers who come to the area and who describe her produce as good-quality and clean.  They own the land they grow on and they got it through a great deal of effort and hard work saving and going without many things to be able to have a place to plant without renting.

She is currently asking for help to buy fertilizer, manure, insecticide, and a fumigation bomb to be able to grow a little more coffee and to perform some maintenance on their vegetables, as this will increase their earnings from the amount of coffee produced.

Her plan for the future is to have a large coffee plantation that will keep providing them with good fortune, support for their family, and that will be able to worked from generation to generation.  She also plans to keep her vegetables in good condition, as they are her family's only source of income to pay for her son's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, manure, insecticides, and other things for her coffee and vegetable crops

loans.name: Fe Y Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fe y Esperanza están en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Ellas hacen la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, el cual ayuda a cada una a saber cuánto es su ingreso, de lo cual se pudo ver que 6 de las integrantes están con un ingreso muy bajo.
Una de las integrantes es Maria, quien por medio de la repostería está saliendo adelante y ayudando a su familia. Maria dice que es muy buena en lo que hace y gracias a su trabajo mejora su calidad de vida. Es una persona que desde siempre ha trabajo y no tiene miedo a hacerlo.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para hacer su repostería, como ser harina, huevos, manteca y demás. Maria agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo ella y sus compañeras.
texts.en:
The “Faith and Hope” Group is in its 4th loan cycle with the Women's Committee Program, where everyone works and helps each other to get ahead. These women are attempting to eliminate poverty, by helping each other understand what their income is. As a result,it is clear that 6 of the members earn a very low income.

One of the members is Maria, who is getting ahead and assisting her family by her work baking cakes. Maria says she is doing well and, thanks to her work, she is improving her quality of life. Maria is a person who from the outset, has always worked hard and she has no fear of doing so.

Maria is soliciting this loan to purchase supplies for cake baking, including wheat flour, eggs, butter and other items. Maria is grateful for this opportunity which she and her companions are receiving.

loans.use: to buy wheat flour, eggs, butter and other ingredients for baking cakes to sell.

loans.name: Hasmik

texts.en:
Hasmik is 23 years old. She has a higher education, having graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the field of Russian Language and Literature. Hasmik lives with her mother and auntie, in Vanadzor city. After graduation, Hasmik started to work as a cashier in one of Vanadzor’s supermarkets.
 
As her salary is too low, Hasmik decided to organize individual courses of Russian Language in her house for students. She helps students to prepare for their Universities' exams, and to prepare their diploma work. Hasmik said she teaches students with great pleasure, and it is more profitable than her salary as a cashier.
 
Hasmik needs a loan from Kiva. She wants to buy a computer and a printer, in order to organize the individual courses she offers more effectively and usefully.

loans.use: To buy a computer and a printer for use in her home-based business teaching Russian Language to students

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mujeres Valientes está en su ciclo número 1, ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas, y por medio de las capacitaciones quieren ir creciendo y mejorar así sus vidas. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza que les permite saber el nivel de ingreso de cada una, donde ninguna se encuentra por debajo de la línea de pobreza gracias al arduo trabajo que todas han hecho.
Claudelina, una de las miembros, se dedica a la venta de ropas, y cuenta que gracias a su negocio está creciendo y ayudando a su familia a tener lo que necesitan. Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que se acerca el frio quiere poder tener un stock de prendas que ofrecer a sus clientes y así seguir con buenos ingresos.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Valientes group is in its first loan cycle.  They're learning to work together, and through the trainings they want to keep on growing so they can improve their lives.  They're doing the poverty-elimination survey that allows them to find out the income level of each one.  Thanks to the hard work they've done, none of them is under the poverty line.

Claudelina, one of the members, makes a living selling clothing.  She says that thanks to her business she's growing and helping her family have what they need.

She's requesting this loan to buy winter clothing because the cold weather is coming and she wants to be able to have clothes in stock to sell to her customers and continue earning a good income.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow for producing milk.

loans.name: Favio Evelio

texts.es: El Sr. Favio tiene 34años,  casado con tres  hijos que son de las edades de 9,6  y 3 años, el se dedica a la compra y venta de accesorios y repuestos para movilidades desde hace ya bastante tiempo tiene su puesto de venta de accesorios que se encuentra en la zona de la 16 de Julio en este lugar es muy concurrido por choferes que realizan el mantenimiento de sus vehículos, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, El Sr.  Favio va a usar este préstamo para la compra de accesorios y repuestos para surtir su puesto   y así de esta manera brindar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, El Sr.  Favio va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando accesorios y repuestos al por mayor,   El Sr.  Favio es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en: Favio is 34 years old, married, and has three children who are nine, six, and three years old.  He has been buying and selling vehicle parts and accessories for a while now.  He has a stall where he sells accessories that is in the 16 de Julio area, which is where a lot of drivers go to have their vehicles serviced.  This loan will be his first cycle with the institution.  Favio will use this loan to buy accessories and parts to stock his stall, which will allow him to offer his customers better service and increase his profits.  He is asking for this loan to improve his business.  Favio will use his profits to keep buying parts and accessories wholesale.  Favio is a very hardworking person and he is glad to have the credit opportunity he has been offered.

loans.use: to buy vehicle accessories

loans.name: Marta Licet

texts.es:
Marta es una mujer emprendedora de 37 años de edad, casada y de su matrimonio tiene 6 hijos los cuales viven bajo su techo y ayudan con las diferentes actividades del campo que además son jóvenes estudiantes. Ella se dedica a la agricultura hace muchos años por lo cual tiene una vasta experiencia en dicha actividad. El producto es comercializado y vendido en la zona y en los alrededores donde ella habita muy popular por el carisma y la atención personalizada que ella y su esposo brindan a cada uno de sus clientes ya que para ellos son lo más importante en el negocio los cuales son los que hacen posible la comercialización de su producto.

Actualmente ella solicita ayuda para invertir en sus cultivos de granos básicos y café comprando abono, fertilizantes y otros productos que harán de su cultivo más seguro y confiable para su venta. 

Ella Sueña con tener una mejor variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes y llevarlo hasta otras zonas para su comercialización ya que por medio de esto ella podrá generar ingresos para su hogar y podrá darles un mejor futuro a sus hijos permitiendo apoyarle con sus estudios y demás cosas que ellos necesiten. Así como también fortalecer el patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marta, 37, is an enterprising woman.  She's married and has six children.  They live at home and help with the different farming activities, and they're also young students.

She has earned a living in agriculture for many years, so she has broad experience.  She sells her product in the area and on the outskirts of where she lives.  She's very popular for her charisma and the personalized attention that she and her husband give each one of their customers.  The most important thing in the business for them is the people who make it possible for them to sell their product.

Currently she's requesting a loan to invest in her basic grain and coffee crops.  She's buying soil amendments, fertilizer, and other products that will make her crop more certain and reliable for sale.

She dreams of having a better variety of products to sell to her customers and to take the products to other areas to sell.  This way she'll be able to generate income for her household, give her children a better future, help them with their studies and other needs, and strengthen her assets for her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and soil amendments for her corn, bean, and coffee crops

loans.name: Reina Isabel

texts.es:
Doña Reina es una mujer emprendedora, luchadora de 52 años de edad, casada y de su matrimonio tiene 1 hijo el cual vive bajo su mismo techo y ayuda con las distintas actividades en el campo como ser: Limpieza, Abono, Fumigación y corte del producto como lo es el café. Ella tiene un grado de educación de primaria no completado cursado hasta el 4 grado por lo cual no pudo seguir estudiando debido a la falta de apoyo por parte de sus padres en ese entonces. Ella es Comerciante de su producto y también tiene una pequeña pulperia con la cual genera y ayuda a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Ella se dedica a la agricultura hace mucho tiempo y fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron desde muy temprana edad. Su producto es comercializado con los intermediarios que llegan a la zona y otros que son llegados a la cercanía y que la caracterizan su producto como un producto de calidad e higiénico. El terreno que ellos cultivan es propio y lo adquirieron por el esfuerzo impuesto por su pareja desde hace muchos años.

Hoy en día solicita ayuda para poder comprar semilla certificada de café y poderla sembrar para poder obtener ganancias y una cosecha segura.

Sus planes a futuro es tener una amplia plantación dando variedad a sus clientes y todos aquellos que consumen su producto para de esa forma poder generar más ingresos que vendrán a ayudar para fortalecer el patrimonio para su hijo y sus nietos y que sean ellos los que sigan trabajando la tierra de generación en generación.
texts.en:
Reina is an enterprising, hardworking 52-year-old woman.  She is married and has a son who lives under her roof and helps her with different kinds of fieldwork, such as cleaning, fertilization, fumigation, and cutting her coffee plants.  She has a fourth-grade education; she was not able to go further because her parents could not support her at the time.  She sells her produce and she also has a small grocery store that allows her to help her partner with the household expenses.  She has worked in farming for a long time and she was taught by parents when she was very young.  She sells her produce to the dealers who come to the area and to others who come around and they say her produce is good-quality and clean.  They own the land they cultivate and they were able to get it through years of her partner's hard work.  

She is currently asking for a loan to buy certified coffee seed and to plant it so she can make a profit and have a guaranteed harvest.

Her plan for the future is to have a big coffee plantation that offers variety to her customers and to everyone who consumes her produce.  This will allow her to make more income, which will help strengthen the inheritance she leaves her child and grandchildren so that they can work the land from generation to generation.

loans.use: to buy certified coffee seed to plant

loans.name: Koeju Group

texts.es:
Koeju es un grupo de mujeres de la ciudad de Caacupé, ellas por medio del trabajo que están haciendo, han pasado a un nuevo ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras. Son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren dar a sus hijos y familiares todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
La señora Alicia es integrante del comité,  ella cuenta se dedica a la venta de ropas, y que por medio de sus ventas está ayudando a su familia. Es una persona con grandes ansias de crecer, lucha por su familia y se esfuerza siempre mucho por salir adelante. Cuenta que quiere tener un salón donde pueda dar a sus clientes todo lo que necesiten.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de prendas de todo tipo, como ser remeras, camisas, pantalones, y demás, para que así siga con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
“Koeju” is a group of women from the city of Caacupé. Due to the work they have accomplished, these women have advanced to their ninth loan cycle as part of the Women Entrepreneurs Program. These female heads of household want to provide their children and family members everything that they could not have.

Sra. Alicia is a member of this committee. She sells clothing and is able to help her family as a result of her sales. Alicia is very eager to grow, so she is always striving very hard to move forward on behalf of her family. She says that she would like to have a shop where she can offer everything that her customers need.

Alicia is requesting a loan so that she can invest in the purchase of clothing of all types, such as T-shirts, shirts, trousers, and other items. As a result, she can continue her sales just as she has always done.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, shirts, trousers, and other items.

loans.name: San Isidro Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Isidro está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una pone su pequeño grano de arena para poder seguir creciendo y también por medio de ese trabajo poder ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Edelmira, quien se dedica a la venta de terere y de hierbas medicinales. El terere es una bebida tradicional paraguaya, que se hace a base de hierbas medicinales, lo cual todos los días los paraguayos la toman, haga frio o calor. Ella cuenta que le está yendo muy bien en sus ventas, ya que hace tiempo que se dedica a esto y esta ya con una clientela bien formada.
La Sra. Solicita de este crédito para la compra mesitas para que pueda exhibir encima de ello sus remedios naturales, lo que le ayudará a seguir con sus ventas y seguir ofreciendo buenos productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Isidro" is in its fourth loan cycle, and each member contributes her little grain of sand so the group can continue growing and helping their families.

One of the members, Edelmira, sells tereré and medicinal herbs.  Tereré is a traditional Paraguan beverage made from medicinal herbs which Paraguayans drink every day, rain or shine.  She says business is going very well because she has been doing this for some time now and has a good customer base.

Edelmira is requesting a loan to buy tables to display her natural remedies.  This will help with sales so she can continue offering good products to her customers.

loans.use: To buy tables to display natural medicines.

loans.name: Kamodiya

texts.en:
Kamodiya, 51-year-old married woman from Ghoghariya-07 Village Development Committee of Bara District, is married to Rambalak and has two sons. Both she and her husband are involved in the tanga (bull cart) transportation business, an enterprise they started with a loan of NPR 2000 eight years ago.

Kamodiya's life was full of problems and hardship before starting the tanga businesses, but as a result of this enterprise her family no longer lives in poverty. She has requested a loan of NPR 15000.00 to repair the tanga. She has a plan to expand the business in the future.

loans.use: to pay for repair of the tanga (bull cart)

loans.name: Hamid

texts.en:
A man with a generous soul and a kind heart needs your help, as he has found himself in financial difficulties. Hamid is married and has four children who live in Haja, Yemen. He is a teacher who is paid a small salary.

The climate in Hamid’s region allows for raising livestock. He would like to do so, but the amount he has saved is not enough to buy some. So Hamid is applying for a 199,999 YER loan through AMB to buy a cow, sheep and some goats. He is planning to use the eventual profits from this loan to provide his children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy a cow, sheep and some goats.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Las 18 integrantes de este grupo son personas muy trabajadoras que luchan por sus familias para poder darles todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener, quieren que sus hijos no pasen por ningún tipo de necesidades. Ellas vieron una gran oportunidad de progreso en el programa de comité de mujeres de la fundación.
Elva, una de las integrantes se dedica a la producción y venta de dulces, cuenta que le está yendo muy bien en su trabajo ya que sus dulces son muy aceptados por sus clientes. Ella se esfuerza día a día, y cuenta que empieza a trabajar desde tempranas horas. Su sueño es podre tener una gran tienda de dulces y seguir de esa forma con su microemprendimiento.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus dulces, como ser azúcar, guayaba, frutas, edulcorantes y demás.
texts.en:
The 18 members of this group are very hardworking people who fight for their families to give them everything they themselves couldn't have. They want their children not to have to experience any type of need.  They saw a great opportunity for progress in the women's committee in the foundation. 

Elva, one of the members, works making and selling sweets. She says that it is going very well for her in her work because her sweets are very much accepted by her customers. She works day to day and says that she starts working very early in the morning. Her dream is to be able to have a great candy store and being able to continue in this way with her micro-business. She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients to keep making her sweets, such as sugar, guayaba, fruit, sweeteners and more.

loans.use: to buy sugar, guayaba, fruit, sweeteners, and more.

loans.name: 14 De Agosto Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado 14 de agosto está en su ciclo número 5° del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras que vieron una gran oportunidad para ellas y sus familias por medio del comité.
Zunilda es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, los cuales compra en forma de microfranquicia que les provee la fundación paraguaya. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que se esfuerza por poder dar a su familia todo lo que no pudo tener.
Solicita este crédito para la compra de microfranquicias de limpieza, para poder revender y de esa forma seguir ofreciendo a su clientela todo lo que necesita.
texts.en: The group called “14 de agosto” is in its fifth cycle in the women’s committee.  They are very hardworking women who recognized a great opportunity for them and their families in the committee.  Zunilda is part of this group.  She sells cleaning supplies she buys in mini franchises that Fundación Paraguaya provides.  She’s a very hardworking woman who strives to give her family everything she was unable to have.  She’s requesting this loan to buy micro franchises of cleaning supplies to resell thus continuing to offer her customers everything they need.

loans.use: to buy micro franchises to resell.

loans.name: Maiywa

texts.en:
Maiywa is 31 years old and a married woman, from Ghoghariya-7 Village Development committee, of Bara District. She is married to Rambali and has three sons and one daughter. They have started a tanga business. (A "tanga" is a cart like the one in the profile photo, which is used to transport local passengers.) They began the business six years ago, using capital from a Nirdhan Utthan Bank loan.

Their tanga business is performing well. They have earned respect in the community.  Maiywa has requested a loan in the amount of Nepalese Rupees (NPR) 60,000. (Sixty thousand). She will use the loan to purchase another tanga and expand the business. Her plan for the future is to buy a house, and to send the children to a good school, from the earnings of the business.

loans.use: to buy an additional tanga (bull cart), to enlarge the family business, transporting passengers

loans.name: Freddy Fabian

texts.es:
El cliente Freddy vive en Quevedo. Crecio en la finca con sus padres ellos tenían hectáreas de frutas que conservaban y animales como (cerdos que alimentaban de plátano). Fue asi que también heredo la pasión por criar cerdos y recolectar frutas.

El hace su trabajo con su conviviente, sus hijos todas las mañanas hasta las 7h00 que comienzan las clases.
La dificultad que tiene en su negocio es su enfermedad ya que hay veces que no puede trabajar normalmente. Si está casado, es ama de casa y lo ayuda en el trabajo del campo. Si tiene 3 hijos los cuales están en escuela fiscal. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, materiales de construccion para mejorar las jaulas de los cerdos y balanceado. Su sueño es tener una granja de producción de cerdos y distribución de frutas.
texts.en:
Freddy lives in Quevedo.  He grew up on the farm with his parents.  They had hectares of fruit that they conserved, and they had animals like pigs, which they fed with bananas.  That is how he inherited the passion for raising pigs and picking fruit.

He does his work with his life partner and his children until 7:00 when classes start.

The difficulty that he has in is business is his state of health.  At times he is not able to work as he normally does.  He is married.  His wife is a housewife, and she helps him with the field work.  He has three children, and they go to public school.

He wants to use the loan to buy cement and construction materials to improve the pigpens.  He will also buy balanced feed.

His dream is to have a farm producing pigs and distributing fruit.

loans.use: to buy cement, construction materials, and balanced feed.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is forty years old and is a hardworking and industrious worker. For the past five years she has sold underwear in Dansoman where she is doing a good business.

Grace joined ID Ghana in 2010 when a friend told her about it. This will be her seventh loan, and she is applying for a 1,000 GHS loan to buy more underwear to meet her customers’ demands.

loans.use: to buy more underwear to sell.

loans.name: Sarita

texts.en:
Sarita is a 28-year-old, married woman from Mahespur Villiage, of Bara district. She is married to Harishankar and has one son and one daughter. They are operating the business of cultivation and threshing, with their tractor. She has requested the loan amount of Nepalese Rs (NPR) 100,000. Sarita will use the loan to buy another tractor, so that they can expand the business.

She remembers her earlier days, which were full of hardship. But their business, started with loan capital borrowed from Nirdhan Bank, has helped her to overcome her bad days. They have a good business now, and have earned good respect as successful entrepreneurs. She wants to give her children good higher education.

loans.use: to buy another tractor for their business of providing cultivation and threshing services to farmers

loans.name: Abdulrhman

texts.en:
Abdulrhman is a 41-year-old man. He is married and lives with his children in Sana`a, Yemen. He is a very happy, energetic man. He is employed in an education office and works in the morning; he gets a low salary. He has another source of income which is a taxi, and he works in the afternoon to cover his family’s expenses.  

He has saved up money, but does not have enough for buying furniture. He has decided to apply for a loan of 274,999 YER from AMB to buy furniture for his house. He hopes that he will be supported and lenders will help him to realize his plans.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas, 27, is a very dedicated and hardworking individual. He lives in Glefe in the Dansoman region. For the past eight years he has worked servicing cell phones and is doing very well.

Thomas joined ID Ghana in August, 2012 when he heard about it from another client. He has since taken two loans and is now applying for a 1,200 GHS loan to buy more equipment to sell to his customers in the community.

loans.use: to buy more equipment to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Librada, se conformó con la iniciativa de la señora Cirila;  Actualmente se encuentran  en el cuarto ciclo, con 16 integrantes, a 35 km de  Curuguaty.
Cirila, quien es también la presidenta, cuenta que siempre trata de motivar a sus amigas a luchar y trabajar, no solo por sus familias sino también por la comunidad, ya que están en una zona muy lejana. Cirila se dedica a la cría y venta de animales de granja, como ser cabras, vacas, gallinas y demás, además de eso cuenta que es un trabajo muy difícil y de tiempo completo ya que debe de estar siempre pendiente de sus animales.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales y también para la compra de animales pequeños para la cría.
texts.en: The Santa Librada communal bank was started with the initiative of Cirila. Currently, they are on their fourth loan cycle with 16 members. They are 35 km from Curuguaty. Cirila, who is also the chairwoman of the group, says that she always tries to motivate her friends to strive and work, not only for their families, but for the community, since they are in a very remote area. Cirila works raising and selling farm animals, like goats, cows, hens, and more. She says that this is difficult, full-time work, because she always has to look after her animals. She is asking for this loan to buy feed for her animals and also to buy small animals to raise.

loans.use: to buy feed and small animals to raise.

loans.name: Nancy Group

texts.en:
This group consists of four members who reside in Dansoman. They are Nancy, Ramatu, Cynthia and Vida. They have been together since June 2008 and are still doing very well. They sell eggs, ladies' wear, ladies' footwear, and mixed items, respectively.

Nancy, the leader, is 32 years old and an egg seller. She has been doing this for the past five years. Through her dedication and seriousness in her business, she has been able to build up trust with ID Ghana. 

Now on her fourth loan, she is requesting to borrow the amount of GHS 3,000. The loan will help her boost the business and satisfy her customers in and around the community.

The entire group, together, needs GHS 5,900. They each will use their share to buy more goods, to resell to their respective customers in the community.

loans.use: To buy more eggs to resell to her customers

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en:
Mahdi is 42 years old, married and the father of seven children who live in Haja, Yemen. He is a teacher who earns a small salary. He is a hardworking man who faces a difficult challenge to provide for his family’s needs. 

He plans to raise livestock for selling, so he can earn a good profit. He is requesting a loan of 250,000 YER to buy livestock, including sheep and goats, for resale. 

Mahdi will use the additional income he earns to repay this loan, to cover the cost of paying for his children's education and to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy livestock, including sheep and goats, for resale.

loans.name: San Carlos Group

texts.es:
12 mujeres de la ciudad de Encarnación se unieron para trabajar juntas, hoy ya están en su segundo ciclo. Ellas desean poder llegar al máximo nivel del programa de comité de mujeres, y es por ello que están trabajando duro.
Noelia, quien es parte de este grupo, se dedica a la venta de frutas y de verduras, de todo tipo. Ella cuenta que es muy conocida por los buenos productos que vende, ya tiene una clientela bien formada que siempre compra de ella lo que les ofrece. Noelia comenta que su meta es poder tener una gran tienda de frutas y de verduras y de esa forma seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Solicita de este crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas y de verduras, ya que con ello puede seguir con sus ventas y generar los ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Twelve women from Encarnacion city formed a group in order to work together, and now they are requesting their second loan. They want to be able to get to the highest level of the women's committee program, and that is why they are working hard. Noelia, who is a member of the group, sells all kinds of fruits and vegetables. She says that she is very well-known for the good quality products that she sells. She has an established clientele who always come to her for these goods. Noelia says that her goal is to have a large grocery store and in this way to continue giving a good service to her customers. She is requesting this loan to be able to invest in fruits and vegetables and carry on selling and generating income to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Akyeah Group

texts.en:
Mabel and Patricia are partners in a group loan who live in Dansoman. They have been together since 2010 and are doing very well.

Mabel, the leader, is 53 years old and a single mother of five. For the past five years she has sold car batteries (Patricia sells various provisions). Through her dedication and seriousness she has been able to create trust with ID Ghana.

Mabel is applying for a seventh group loan, this time for 4,200 GHS which Patricia and she will share. Mabel will use her 3,000 GHS portion to buy more stock so she can her boost her business and satisfy her customers in and around the community.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell to their respective customers.

loans.name: Tilda Group

texts.en:
The group is made up of three members who have been accessing loans from ID Ghana since 2012. They are Matilda, Evelyn, and Adiza. They live in Dansoman. Matilda is a pepper seller, Evelyn sells provisions, and Adiza sells charcoal, respectively.

ID Ghana has been of great service to them since they have been able to grow their small businesses through the credit scheme. 

Matilda is a 45-year-old pepper seller. She has seven years experience. She works six days in a week (Monday to Saturday). She is constantly working to improve on her business capital. This is her second loan with ID Ghana and she is requesting an amount of GHS 600 to buy more to sell to her customers in the community.

The entire group needs a total amount of GHS 1,700 for business expansion and to meet customers’ demand.

loans.use: To buy more peppers and sell to customers.

loans.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Luchadoras está en su ciclo número uno del programa de comité de mujeres, donde cada una de las miembros se esfuerza y lucha por poder dar a sus familias todo lo que necesitan para no tener que pasar por privaciones como las que ellas tuvieron que pasar.
Mirian es parte de este grupo, es una mujer muy emprendedora, que por medio de la venta de comestibles, es decir, comidas rápidas, está ayudando a sus parientes. Comenta que con el tiempo se a hecho de muy buena clientela y que le está yendo muy bien.
Ella solicita de esta ayuda para poder invertirla en la compra de carnes, verduras, condimentos, y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo los comestibles que vende, ya que sus clientes le hacen muchos pedidos.
texts.en:
This group, Luchadoras, is on its first loan cycle in the program for women's communal banks, in which each one of the members works and fights to be able to give their families everything they need, so that their families do not have to go without like the women did. 

Mirian is part of this group. She is a very enterprising women, who by selling food, or rather, fast food, is helping her family. She says that over time, she has gained a lot of customers and that it is going well for her. She is asking for this help to be able to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and other ingredients to be able to keep making the food that she sells, since her customers are placing a lot of orders.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, condiments, and other ingredients.

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German es un hombre de 68 años, vive en la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el distrito de Jayanca con su esposa y sus siete hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su esposa dedican todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, German no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta pasear por el campo y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz Chaufa.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, German trabaja como ganadero, el cuenta con un pequeño número de animales entre carneros, ovejas, chivos y otros, los cuales cría para luego venderlos en los mercados de su ciudad, German trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
German se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de los servicios higiénicos de su vivienda, ya que actualmente cuenta con un silo, de esta manera German y su familia podrán contar con mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
German is a 68-year-old man who lives in the city of Chiclayo, in the district of Jayanca, with his wife and seven children. He loves them very much and they are his main reason for living. He is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person. He and his wife put their all into getting their family ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of economic resources and because of the necessity to get a job at a very young age, German was unable to study business administration as he had wanted. In his free time, he likes to walk in the fields and he sometimes cooks delicious fried rice.
On his own initiative, with great hard work and dedication, German works in livestock. He has a small number of animals - rams, sheep, goats, and others - which he raises to later sell in the city markets. German works every day for approximately ten hours and believes that it is going well for him because of his experience and his kind treatment of others.
German is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to improve his home's hygienic services. He currently has only a pit latrine. This way, German and his family will be able to have better security and well-being. He will continue working hard to achieve his great dream of finishing construction on his home.

loans.use: to improve his home's hygiene.

loans.name: Guldasta

texts.ru: Гулдаста жительница города Вахдат. Ей 50 лет. Она замужем и является матерью троих детей. Гулдаста обеспечивает семью за счет торговли.
